loans.name: Oky

texts.en:
Oky lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Oky is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Oky joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Oky sees improvements in his shop. For the last month, he has earned an average of $30 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions. 

His goal for his business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Ramona del Rosario tiene un negocio de venta frutas, verduras y especies  en unos de los mercados  del departamento de León desde hace diecinueve  años, sale de su casa a las 5:00 am y abre su negocio a las 6:00 am cerrándolo a 5 pm. realiza este trabajo para el sustento de su familia, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo.  

Doña Ramona  solicito este  crédito a Ceprodel para la  compra de ácido acético y especie al  por mayor, para ofertar su producto a un bajo precio al consumidor.

Los sueños de Doña Ramona son mantener siempre negocio y terminar la construcción de su humilde vivienda para darle mejor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Ramona del Rosario has been in business for 19 years selling fruits, vegetables and spices at one of the markets in the department of Leon.  She leaves her house in the morning at 5:00 a.m., opens her business at 6:00 a.m. and closes for the day at 5:00 p.m.  This is how she earns a living for her family, being a single mother with two children in her care.

Ramona is requesting a loan through Ceprodel to buy ascorbic acid and spices wholesale to offer her products at lower prices to the consumer.

Ramona dreams of always being able to maintain her business and finish construction of her humble dwelling to make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy ascorbic acid and spices.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DEMBAGNOUMA est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 11ème prêt. Les 10 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de ANE qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 150kg de maïs, 100kg de mil avec les grossistes  de Méridièla. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en: The DEMBAGNOUMA group is composed of six married women, who are on average 36 years old and have four children. They lives in traditional extended famillies in the village of Méridièla. They met through connections as neighbors, friends and their business activities. In order to reinforce their financial capacity and increase the level of activity of their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from whom they are asking for their eleventh loan. The previous ten loans were all correctly reimbursed. This group of women sell grains, including Ane, seen in the photo as the first woman standing on the left. She plans to use the loan to purchase 150 kilos of maize and 100 kilos of millet from the wholesalers in Méridièla. She sells these products at the markets and from her own home, in small quantities, for credit or cash, to a mixed clientele. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 27 000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business as well as reimburse the loan.

loans.use: purchase grains

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 33 years old, married, and together with his spouse he has been blessed with 1 child, aged 2 years. He has a hardware shop and has been in the business for 2 years now. His spouse also provides additional income. 

John will be using this loan to increase his stock of hardware such as paint, iron sheets, nuts and carpentry materials. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to add to his capital and repay his loan. This is his first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and his hopes in the future are to expand his business and start a farming business.

loans.use: To increase his stock of hardware.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es: Rafael, tiene la edad  de 70 años, está casado, vive con su esposa que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes foliares para aplicarle en esta época de verano para que se mantenga en un estado adecuado pueda tener una floración adecuada, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar anticipadamente algunas plantas de almácigo con un buen desarrollo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Rafael is 70 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority. With his loan he hopes to buy plant fertilizers to apply this summer so that they remain in appropriate condition and can flower appropriately, as well as fungicides and manual labor for work assisting with the coffee crops. He also hopes to buy some well-developed copperwood trees in advance in order to do some replanting at the start of the rains with the goal of increasing the plant density in the area, as well as taking advantage of the good fertility of the soil, the climate conditions, and other things that favor coffee cultivation. With these improvements to the crops, he hopes to make a little bit of profit and in this way improve his family's living conditions as well as invest a little more in the area of the crops and also meet some goals. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans before at state banks, but FUDECOSUR has given him the loan with easier terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: with his coffee crops

loans.name: Edelmy

texts.es:
Edelmy de 63 años de edad se dedica a la preparación de alimentos; ella tiene un pequeño ventorrillo de productos alimenticios, donde ofrece almuerzos, meriendas elaboradas por sus propias manos como arepas, bollos de maíz etc. Su meta es ampliar su capital de trabajo para invertir mucho más en materias primas e insumos y aumentar su producción. Porque planea tener su restaurante muy bien dotado, para ganar mas y educar lo mejor posible a sus hijos.  
En sus 30 años de experiencia ha logrado el propósito de su emprendimiento, que nació para apoyar a su esposo en la gestión del bienestar de su hogar, donde existen 4 hijos en las edades de 27 a 34 años. Ella inició primero su experiencia con una confección y posteriormente buscó la oportunidad de generar ingresos, mediante una actividad que rotara rápidamente su capital de trabajo, por ello empezó vendiendo pescado, bollos y meriendas. Sus principales consumidores son los vecinos y transeúntes que rutinariamente circunda sus alrededores. 
Edelmy trabaja diariamente y abre al público desde las 12 a las 6 de la tarde, vendiendo de contado y comprando también de la misma manera. Su capital de trabajo ha sido fortalecido por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización de la que ha recibido tres financiamientos y con la cual se ha capacitado para fortalecer su proceso administrativo y de manipulación de alimentos. Con sus créditos ha mejorado su infraestructura, comprando equipos y herramientas para moler el maíz y responder a sus procesos productivos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, cuarto financiamiento que ha hecho a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas para hacer bollos, arepas, y diversas meriendas, que aumentarán su producción permitiéndole un mayor ingreso.
texts.en:
Edelmy is 63 years old and works preparing food. She has a small food store where she offers lunches and snacks made with her own hands, such as corn tortillas and rolls, etc. Her goal is to increase her working capital to invest much more in ingredients and supplies and to increase her production. She plans to have her restaurant well-supplied, so she can make more money and give her children the best possible education.

In her 30 years of experience, she has been able to make her own business a reality. The idea came about so she could support her husband in managing the well-being of their household, where they have four children from ages 27 to 34. She began her experience with making things, and then looked for an opportunity to make an income, through an activity that would quickly rotate her working capital. So she started to sell fish, rolls, and snacks. Her main customers are the people of the neighborhood and passers-by who routinely come through the area.

Edelmy works every day, opening for business from 12-6 PM, selling in cash and buying in cash as well. Her working capital has been strengthened by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, from which organization she has received three loans. With their help, she has been enabled to improve her administrative process and her food production. She has used her loans to improve her infrastructure, buying tools and equipment to mill corn and respond to her production processes. Now she is applying for a Kiva loan, her fourth loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy ingredients to make buns, corn tortillas, and various snacks. This will increase her production and allow her to make a larger income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make buns, corn tortillas, and various snacks

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un joven estudiante de 25 años y vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Es el hijo menor de su familia, sus dos hermanos mayores no tienen ninguna profesión y actualmente efectúan trabajos temporales, su papá estudio la carrera de contaduría pública pero nunca pudo titularse y su mamá es ama de casa.
 
Al terminar el colegio, Gustavo comenzó a estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Electromecánica que con mucha dedicación y apoyo por parte de sus padres, él logro ser el primer profesional de su familia, mismo que lo hace sentir orgulloso y agradecido. Actualmente trabaja en una pequeña fábrica y solicita un crédito educativo para realizar el diplomado en Ingeniería y Tecnología de Sistemas Eléctricos, el cual complementará sus actuales conocimientos y así poder cumplir sus sueños de obtener un mejor puesto de trabajo en una gran empresa y mejorar su situación económica para poder ayudar a su familia y que su papá pueda jubilarse.
Gustavo de antemano agradece a las personas que a través de sus recursos económicos ayudan a otros y generan nuevas oportunidades de crecimiento, así como a él se le están otorgando ahora.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 25 years old and a student. He lives in the city of Cochabamba. He is the youngest child in his family. Neither of his two older siblings have a profession and currently have temporary jobs. Gustavo's father studied public accounting but never finished his degree; his mother is a housewife.

On finishing school, Gustavo began studying electromechanical engineering and, with a lot of dedication and support from his parents, he was the first professional in his family. This has made him proud and grateful. Gustavo currently works at a small factory and is applying for a loan for his studies in order to pay for a diploma in electrcial systems engineering and technology. This will complement his studies and his will be able to achieve his dream of finding a better job in a big company and of improving his financial situation in order to help his family, allowing his father to retire.

Gustavo is grateful to those donating money to help others and to create new growth opportunities, as is happening with Gustavo.

loans.use: to pay for a diploma in electrcial systems engineering and technology.

loans.name: Guillermo De Jesús

texts.es: Guillermo de 64 años, vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos, desde hace cuatro (4) años tiene una tienda la cual atiende en compañía de su esposa (ver foto), tiene como sueño ampliar la tienda donde distribuye artículos como leche, granos, verduras, lácteos y otros. En la actualidad tiene poco surtido y esto es perjudicial ya que no puede suplir con muchos productos que le pide su clientela. Guillermo en vista de esto optó en solicitar dicho préstamo con el fin de organizarse más y comprar al por mayor el surtido necesario (granos, azúcar, galletería, lácteos) para incrementar su stock y poder brindar mejor atención a las personas,  esto le representaría también el aumento en sus ingresos para cumplir necesidades básicas de todo negocio como son los servicios públicos, impuestos, y demás, y también mejorar el bienestar de él y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 64 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. For the past four years, he has managed a store along with his wife (who also appears in the photo). His dream is to expand the shop where he sells merchandise such as milk, grains, vegetables, dairy products, and other items. At the moment Guillermo has very little inventory. This is bad for business since he does not have many products for fulfilling the requests of his customers.

Guillermo chose to request a loan so that he could get more organized and buy a large supply of necessities (grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products) in order to increase his inventory and provide better customer service. The resulting increase in his income will not only allow him to provide for basic needs, but it will also be used to pay for all of his business expenses such as utilities and taxes. In addition, Guillermo and his family will experience an improvement in their well-being.

loans.use: to buy grains, sugar, cookies, and dairy products.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 30-year-old, married woman. For the past five years, she has been running a business, selling milk with her husband. She has many cows and buffaloes, which she uses for milk, selling to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. 

Irshad has become famous for providing good-quality milk and she makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently Irshad is in her fourth loan cycle and she has applied for a loan of PKR 45,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. Irshad is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is 37-years-old  and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband owns a small shop in which he sells beauty products. He contributes his full income to the household expenses. He always tries to establish his business by offering the latest cosmetics products. Nowadays, the latest cosmetics products introduced in the market are in very high demand and expensive as well.

Ayesha has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.  She will give the full amount to her husband so that he can buy the latest cosmetic products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipstick, nail polish, etc. She hopes that through this amount his business will be enhanced.

Ayesha is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy beauty products such as facial cream, hair colors, makeover kits, lipstick, nail polish, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en: Zareena is a forty-four-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been running a business selling children’s ready-made garments. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling well-designed clothes. She has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes in various sizes and designs for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She is in her fourth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothes in various sizes and designs for the summer season.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en: Nafisa is a fifty-one-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been selling spices to be used in cooking. She purchases the spices in bulk from a wholesale market and then sells them in packs of various sizes. She has become famous for providing good quality spices in her locality and earns enough to live a decent life. She is a responsible mother of three children and needs to earn more to cover the daily expenditures of her family members. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chillies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior. She wishes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of salt, red chillies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities

loans.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en: Rabia is 29 and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband owns a shoe shop in which he sells a variety of shoes. He buys shoes from different shoe manufacturing companies and sells them at his shop. He has been selling gentleman's shoes only, but now he wants to offer ladies shoes as well, in accordance with his customers' demands.  His major problem is the lack of the lump sum amount. Therefore, Rabia requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy crushing ladies shoes as well.  Rabia is very happy after taking this loan and says thanks to Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more variety of shoes for her husband's shoe shop.

loans.name: Dayana

texts.es: Dayana de 30 años, habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas de 2 y 7 años; allí vende mercancía,  como vestuario, calzado, perfumería, accesorios femeninos y productos en plata. Ella tiene 4 años de experiencia como comerciante, e inició esta actividad, con el propósito de poyar a su cónyuge en la gestión del bienestar de su hogar; al principio fue apoyada por su amiga quien viajaba a la ciudad de Medellín en el departamento de Antioquia, a comprar productos en cuero y confecciones, en las  grandes industrias de esta ciudad, donde ofrecen un nivel de calidad excepcional.  Su amiga proveía esta mercancía a Dayana  y ella la distribuía entre sus clientes, los cuales fueron poco a poco aumentando y solicitando otros artículos, con los que  hizo crecer su negocio. En la actualidad vende a crédito, y tiene una gran meta de crecimiento  y expansión de su microempresa, pues desea tener su propia casa, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a sus expectativas, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, calzado, colonias, perfumes y accesorios femeninos, artículos que tiene encargados y que le permitirán aumentar su volumen de ventas. El éxito de su credikiva es que le ayudará a incrementar su capital de trabajo, para rotar más rápidamente su efectivo y generar mas utilidades a corto plazo..
texts.en: Dayana, who is 30-years old, lives in the south of the city with her husband and their two children, who are 2- and 7- years old respectively.  She sells goods such as wardrobe items, footwear, perfume, women's accessories and silver products.  She has four years of experience as a saleswoman and started this business with the intention of helping her husband develop the well-being of their household.  At the beginning, Dayana had the help of a friend, who would travel to Medellín, in Antioquia Department, to purchase leather products and clothing in the city's big industries.  The quality of the products there is exceptional.  Dayana's friend would supply her with these goods, and Dayana would distribute the items amongst her customers.  Her customer base increased little by little and her customers began to request other items, which grew Dayana's business.  She currently sells on credit.  Dayana has a big goal: to grow and expanding her small business, as she hopes to own her own house.  Dayana's working capital isn't sufficient to meet her orders, and that is the reason she turned to a Credikiva.  This is her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will purchase clothing, footwear, cologne, perfume and women's accessories, items that she needs to deliver.  The loan will also help her to increase her sales volume.  The success of her Credikiva is that it will help her to increase her working capital, to rotate her cash more rapidly and generate a greater profit in a shorter amount of time.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, footwear, colognes, perfumes and women's accessories, items that she needs to deliver.

loans.name: Dubys

texts.es: Dubys e suna comerciante que vende  de mercancía variada, habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos de 13 a 18 años, con quien sueña verlos convertidos en profesionales exitosos. Desde hace 10 años, en el 2004 empezó su experiencia emprendedora, para apoyar a su cónyuge en la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, aprovechando que desde muy niña estuvo relacionada con la venta de mercancías en su hogar paterno, produciendo para su sostenimiento. Ella vende a crédito y de contado, comprando productos en el centro de la ciudad y a empresas que le otorgan guías especializadas de productos o catálogos para promover sus ventas. Los principales artículos son los cosméticos,  productos de tocador, ollas, artículos plásticos para el hogar, vestuario interior, con el cual logró incrementar su capital de trabajo y sostenerse en el mercado durante sus 10 años de experiencia.  Su meta es lograr mayor cobertura de clientes y para ello ha recurrido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará productos de tocador, accesorios femeninos, productos de plásticos de uso doméstico etc. Los cuales venderán en su mercado constituido por vecinos del sector y de los alrededores de los cuales recibe referidos que le ayudarán a incrementar sus ingresos para cumplir el sueño de ver a sus hijos prosperando como   profesionales exitosos.
texts.en:
Dubys is a merchant who sells a varied range of goods.  She lives in the city with her husband and three children, ages 13 to 18 who she wants to see become successful professionals.  In 2004 she began her entrepreneurial experience to help her husband manage the household economy.  She took advantage of the fact that as a young girl she was exposed to merchandise sales at her parents home.  She sells on both a credit and cash basis, and buys her products in the city center or by specialized catalogues.  Her main items are cosmetics, toiletries, cookware, plastic home products, and lingerie.  She has been able to increase her work capital and stay in business in the market for ten years.  

Her goal is to attract more customers so she has requested a CrediKiva loan, her first, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy toiletries, women's accessories, plastic home products, etc.  She will sell them to neighbors and people from other communities who are referred to her.  This will help increase her income so she can see her children prosper as successful professionals.

loans.use: To buy toiletries, women's accesories, plastic home products, etc.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Don Reynaldo de 62 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas cubre algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su nieto, Don Reynaldo esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno para hacer su siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía y así seguir con sus cultivos y obtener mejores ganancias para tener junto a su nieto una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reynaldo, who's sixty-two years old, has been working in agriculture for several years. His main crop is corn. He sells his products to grain dealers. With his earnings, he covers some of the household expenses. He lives in his own home with his grandson.

Reynaldo is applying for this loan to buy manure, fertilizers, pest control products, herbicides, and seeds as well as to improve his soil, which can be seen in the photograph, for his crops. Therefore, he will continue with his crops and obtain better earnings to have a better quality of life together with his grandson.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers, pest control products, herbicides, seeds, and so on.

loans.name: Jose Neftali

texts.es:
José, solicita más capital para resurtir el inventario de su negocio, efectuara la compra de cables, focos, candados, linternas,controles de televisió, etc., así ofrecerá a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan para su hogar.
El crédito anterior le permitió fortalecer su negocio y continuar trabajando para conseguir los ingresos que necesita para cancelar sus deudas y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting more capital to re-stock his business's inventory.  He will purchase cables, light bulbs, padlocks, flashlights, TV remotes etc. to be able to offer his customers everything they may need for their homes. 
The previous loan allowed José to strengthen his business and continue working so he could earn the income needed to pay his bills and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to purchase cables, light bulbs, padlocks, flashlights, TV remotes etc.

loans.name: Ana Yanci

texts.es:
Ana, cuenta que trabajar con créditos es de gran ayuda para ella porque le facilita de manera rápida poder tener la mercadería necesaria que ofrecerá a mejores precios a sus clientes, en esta oportunidad el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de jabón, detergentes, aceites, frijol, arroz, pastas y bebidas.
El nuevo estilo de vida que hoy tiene y la rentabilidad de su negocio es el producto de la buena inversión del capital que se le otorgo anteriormente, pues ella fortaleció su negocio con productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Ana says that having access to loans is a huge help to her because it helps her readily obtain the merchandise she needs at the best prices for her customers. For this opportunity, she will invest the loan in buying soap, detergents, oils, beans, rice, pastas, and beverages.  The new lifestyle she has today and the profitability of her business are direct results of the good investment of capital that she obtained from previous loans. She has been able to strengthen her business with necessary goods.

loans.use: purchase stock for her grocery store such as soap, detergents, rice, beans, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her business, such as oil, rice, coal, and pepper.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen, age 41, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Esther De La Paz

texts.es:
Esther es casada, junto a su esposo comparten la felicidad de tener dos hijos de 14 y 17 años, siendo soltera ella se dedicaba a vender tortillas con su mamá, con el tiempo se casó y de manera independiente se dedica a vender cocos, jugos de naranja, refrescos y panes, lo hace en un horario de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m., por el momento no ha tenido problemas en realizar esta actividad.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de naranjas, azúcar, pan, cocos, para su negocio así como también pagara mano de obra para construir un pozo y comprar una bomba achicadora, con lo con mejora las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Su aspiración es mantener su negocio surtido para que le de los recursos económicos con los cuales salir adelante con su familia y que sea autosificiente.
texts.en:
Esther is married, and she and her husband share the happiness of having two children aged 14 and 17. When she was single, she sold tortillas with her mother. In time she married, and she sells coconuts, orange juice, soft drinks, and breads independently. She does it on a schedule of 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. For the moment, she has not had problems doing this work.

She is asking for a loan to buy oranges, sugar, bread, and coconuts for her business, as well as to pay for labor to build a well and to buy a water pump, with which she will improve her family's living conditions.

Her goals are to keep her business stocked so that it will give her the economic resources for her and her family to move ahead and to be self-sufficient.

loans.use: to buy oranges, sugar, bread, coconuts, and a water pump, and to pay for labor to build a well

loans.name: Maria Marina

texts.es:
María, desea seguir trabajando para continuar apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios es por esa razón que se decide a solicitar un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de aceite, aderezos, repollo, tomates, chicharrón, quesillo, harina y bebidas, para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Los efectos positivos que le dio el crédito anterior son que tuvo los ingredientes necesarios para su venta de pupusas, aumento su clientela, sus ingresos son mejores y ofrece a su familia un mejor estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en: María wants to keep working so that she can keep her children in school. That's why she is requesting a new loan, which she will invest in the purchase of oil, seasonings, cabbage, tomatoes, chicharrones (pork rinds), cream cheese, flour and beverages, so that she can provide her customers with good service. She's received great benefits from her previous loans; she's had the necessary ingredients to sell her pupusas (a traditional meat-stuffed dumpling), expand her clientele, increase her income, and provide her family with an improved standard of living.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make pupusas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds and supplies to grow vegetables

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem, a 44-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality. Shameem always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being.

For the improvement of her business, Shameem has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Shameem's sixth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 38-year-old lady.  She is married and lives her life with her four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She is taking a loan for her husband because he owns an embroidery shop. He has been selling embroidery material for many years. He sells sequins, pearls, threads, precious stones, silk, needles and wooden frames for embroidery. The embroidery material for bridal dresses is very expensive, but its turnover is very high.  Due to the high costs he faces and the shortage of material, he is unable to purchase expensive raw materials to sell. Therefore, Asia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can remove the shortage of embroidery material. Through this amount he will buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

Asia is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To help her husband buy stock of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, precious stones and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.es:
María, se dispone a surtir su chalet comprara gaseosas, jugos, galletas, repollo, harina, aceite, aderezos, quesillo, etc., para tener la materia prima para elaborar las pupusas y así a provechar al máximo la temporada escolar.
Gracias al crédito anterior se le facilito el ofrecer más productos y a precios accesibles para sus clientes con los que pudo mantenerse trabajando.
texts.en:
María is ready to stock up her sales stall.  She will purchase sodas, juice and cookies as well as cabbage, flour, cooking oil, seasonings, cream cheese etc. as raw materials for making pupusas.  Then she will be able to take maximum advantage of the school season.
Thanks to her previous loan, María was able to offer more products at affordable prices for her customers, and she was able to keep working.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, juice, cookies, cabbage, flour, cooking oil, seasonings, cream cheese etc.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer soltera que  busca la manera de salir adelante junto a su hijo quien estudia y trabaja, Mercedes tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende ropa variada y calzado, por este medio recibe sus ingresos con lo que mantiene sus necesidades diarias. Solicita el crédito para comprar camisas, pantalones, faldas, ropa interior y cosméticos.
texts.en: Mercedes is a single mother who is looking for a way to move ahead with her son, who studies and works. Mercedes has a small store in which she sells a variety of clothing and footwear. Through this she receives the income with which she provides for her daily needs. She is asking for the loan in order to buy shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, underwear, and cosmetics

loans.name: Jhon Alan

texts.es: Jhon de 25 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable  profesor de matemática, actualmente dicta clases de matemática, para poder pagar su segunda carrera de economía y seguir siendo exitoso en la vida. Jhon tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen economista. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Jhon   se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Jhon, 25, is single and does not have children. He is an agreeable math teacher. He currently teaches math in order to pay for a second career in economics and remain successful in life. Jhon has a goal to finish his studies with success and to be a good economist. With the requested loan, he will invest in his university tuition and purchase the school supplies he needs. Jhon is very grateful for this support and left with many desires to complete his proposed goals, thanking Kiva for the opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pigs as well as supplies to maintain and care for them (feed, special vitamins, etc.), and make improvements to his garages.

loans.name: Ruby Lucía

texts.es: Ruby es una mujer joven y emprendedora que trabajó durante años en diferentes empresas, pero hace un tiempo decidió comprar una pequeña farmacia en un sector bien acreditado y cerca de su casa. Ella trabaja con otra señora  que ya tiene experiencia en la actividad y abren el negocio todos los días desde las 9:00 am hasta las 9:00 pm. Ruby utilizará el crédito para comprar al por mayor el surtido para la farmacia (medicamentos, productos de aseo personal) y pagar unas facturas que aún tiene pendientes. Ella sueña con acreditar el negocio y con poder incrementar sus ingresos, que le permitan tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Ruby is an enterprising young woman who has worked at different businesses over the years. Some time ago, she decided to buy a small pharmacy that is located in a well-known area near her house. Ruby works with another woman who already has experience in this line of work. They manage the business every day from 9:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M.

Ruby will use this loan to buy more inventory (medicines and personal hygiene products) for the pharmacy. She will also pay a few outstanding bills.

Ruby dreams of building the reputation of her business so that she can increase her earnings. This will allow her to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy medicines and personal hygiene products and to pay a few outstanding bills.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals etc.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a 27-year-old single man who lives with his family in Hodeidah, Yemen. Ibrahim belongs to a poor family in Hodeidah and because of his bad conditions, he couldn't study.  Now, he is illiterate. He began his work as a driver for one businessman in a vegetable market in his city. Day after day, Ibrahim accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a car one year ago in order to improve his family's income. His car needs to be repaired, but unfortunately he doesn't have enough money to repair his car and purchase spare parts. Ibrahim decided to apply for a Youth loan of 45,000 YER from AMB in order to repair his car. Ibrahim looks forward to purchasing another taxi in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino, requiere un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tomates, chiles, repollos, manzanas, uvas, aguacates, pepinos, etc., contando con productos frescos y a un buen precio sus clientes continuaran sintiéndose satisfechos y él tendrá los recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos familiares.
El capital que se le prestó antes le dio la oportunidad de reparar su vehículo y con ello mantenerse trasladando la mercadería necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Cristino needs a new loan, which he will invest in buying tomatoes, chilis, cabbage, apples, grapes, avocados, peppers and more. He relies on having fresh products at a good price to keep his customers satisfied. Having satisfied customers is what gives him the economic resources to meet his family's expenses. 

The loan he requested last time gave him the chance to repair the vehicle that he uses to move his merchandise to his business.

loans.use: buy a variety of fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and a weighing scale

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María, vive junto a sus hijos, es soltera, en busca de la forma para salir delante junto a su familia y animada por familiares se decidió por instalar una tienda en su casa, ella administrado bien el negocio durante todo este tiempo, su dificultad es la delincuencia en la zona en donde reside.
El capital que está solicitando lo utilizara para comprar detergente, aceite, boquitas, galletas, bebidas, dulces, pan, entre otros productos necesarios para contar con clientes satisfechos y mejorar sus ventas.
Su visión es contar con mercadería necesaria que le dé oportunidad de atraer a nuevos clientes y mantener la preferencia de los que ya tiene, para mejorar su economía.
texts.en:
María is single and lives with her children.  Searching for a way to get her family ahead and motivated by family members, she decided to open a store out of her home. She has run it well all this time; her only difficulty is the crime in the area where she lives.

The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy detergent, oil, snacks, cookies, beverages, sweets, breads, and other necessary goods that will keep her customers happy and improve her sales.

Her vision is to rely on needed merchandise to attract new customers and remain their preferred source of groceries and supplies so that she can improve her economic situation.

loans.use: buy supplies for her general store.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard lives with her husband, three children, daughter-in-law and two little grandchildren. Alvard and her family are involved in agriculture. They keep livestock (sheep, cows, calves) and cultivate wheat.  Alvard's husband sells the gathered meat and milk in nearby markets so the family can earn an income for a living.

Alvard has applied for this loan to be able to purchase two calves, forage for the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation. These will be a big support for Alvard's farm and she will be very grateful to lenders for their support. 

As this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two calves, forage for the livestock and fertilizer for land cultivation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building blocks and sand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Humphrey

texts.en: Meet Humphrey a farmer who lives in the Kitale area of North Rift Kenya. He is married, the father of three children, and has been farming for three years. He earns his income from the sale of milk, eggs and crops and also runs a retail business. He enjoys considerable success on his farm, but has insufficient funds for the projects he would like to pursue. Humphrey chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of the quick and efficient service it offers its clients. During the training offered by our loan officers, he learned proper farming techniques. He says that this loan will allow him to purchase more poultry and provide his family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy poultry for his farm.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 49-year-old woman from Usenge, married to Samson, and together they have five children, ages 27, 18, 14, 12, and 8.

Mildred operates a retail shop, a business she has done for the last 20 years, earning an income of KES 2,000 monthly. 

She is taking a second loan with VisionFund Kenya, in the amount of KES 10,000, which she will use to buy more stocks of foodstuffs and other goods to add to the business. The profits will be used to repay her loan.

Mildred's dreams are to educate her children to high levels and to run a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell, like sacks of sugar, jericans of cooking oil, boxes of sweets, and sacks of flour.

loans.name: Dilshad

texts.en:
Dilshad is living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is an old client of BRAC Pakistan and this is her sixth loan. 

Dilshad is taking the loan for her son. In fact, her son drives an auto rickshaw. He has been driving the auto rickshaw for many years, using petrol which is very costly. 

Due to an increase in the cost of petrol, he sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new CNG (compressed natural gas) rickshaw. With the contribution of savings and the selling price of the old rickshaw, he is still short of the amount needed to buy a new CNG rickshaw.

Therefore, Dilshad contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. Through the loan, her son will buy a CNG rickshaw, so he can minimize the fuel expense and increase his income.

Dilshad seems very happy after taking this loan. She gives thanks to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a CNG Rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, es casada, vive junto a su esposo en casa de sus suegros, desde que era muy joven ella aprendió de su mamá la elaboración y comercialización de pupusas, actualmente lo hace de manera independiente y atiende la pupusería sola.
Necesita capital para invertir en la compra de harina, aceite, tomates, repollo, aderezos, bebidas y gas propano, son la materia prima que necesita para que su negocio funcioné de manera correcta, esto le ayudara a mejorar los productos que ofrece a sus clientes y tener mejores ganancias.
Anhela tener un negocio más grande pero que sea autosuficiente para sacar el mejor provecho de las ganancias.
texts.en:
María is married and lives together with her husband in the home of her parents-in-law. Since she was very young, she learned how to make and sell pupusas from her mother. She currently does this on her own and she looks after her food stall by herself. 

She needs capital to invest in the purchase of flour, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, seasoning, beverages, and propane. These are the materials that she needs for the proper functioning of her business. This will help her to improve the products that she offers to her customers and have better earnings. She strongly desires to have a larger business but still be self-sufficient in order to make the most out of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, tomatoes, cabbage, seasoning, beverages, and propane.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en: Naziran is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been providing flour grinding services in her community for many years. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family alone, so she started this business in her home to contribute to the family income. She has become famous for providing fine-quality flour and earns enough to support the needs of her family members. In order to purchase a new grinding machine, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 60,000 PKR. The new grinder would help her cater to more customers time after time, which will ultimately help her in generating more cash. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new grinding machine

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Teresa has a retail shop that she has been running for the last seven years. She also runs a mobile money-transfer business. She is 46 years old and together with her spouse has been blessed with five children. Her spouse works and provides additional income for the family. Teresa has requested a loan to buy more items to sell in her shop. She will also use a portion of this loan in her mobile money-transfer business. She will devote the profits she expects to earn to expand her business and repay her loan. This is Teresa's fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya; she has repaid her previous loans successfully and hopes to provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy is a married, 39 years old and lives in Kakamega County with his four children, who range in age from 16 to four years old. For the last 16 years, he has operated a motorcycle-transport business and earns an average income of KES 5,000 per month. He has also requested his first loan for KES 10,000 from VisionFund Kenya to use to repair his motorcycle. He will also use this loan to set aside some money as savings. His dream is to have a prosperous future.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra, age 25, is a married woman. For about 8 years, she has been working in a boutique. She makes beautiful embroidery patterns on cloth and then sews it for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy bundles of cloth and spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads and sequins. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to have an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy bundles of cloth and spools of threads in different colors along with packs of beads and sequins

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en: Mejumaa is a single lady with no children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. For the past three years, she has operated a business selling leso (or women wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge in the seasonality of demand for her produce, and dreams of expanding her business to become a big supplier of clothes in the future. She has requested a loan for Kshs 20,000 to buy more cloth to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more women's cloth to resell.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en: Ekaterine is a 31-years-old married woman. She lives with her husband and 11-years-old daughter. The only source of income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In  particular, they have a plot of agricultural land where maize is grown. They sell the harvested maize locally. Ekaterine needs money to purchase potato seeds. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 900 Gel to purchase seeds. She will grow potatoes and will sell them along with the maize. This will increase the income of their family and they will be able to improve the living conditions. Ekaterine awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds.

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 39-year-old woman. She is living with her husband and five children in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband owns a tailoring shop and sews men's clothing. In the past, he used a local stitching machine which is very slow and it does not work fine or properly. He wants to enhance the beauty of his stitching and for that, he wants to buy a juki machine (sewing machine). Professional people use this machine for tailoring because it has good speed and it works very fine.

He wants to buy a juki machine thorough his savings but he does not have sufficient income. Therefore Shagufta has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new machine to enhance his tailoring work.

Shagufta is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a juki machine (sewing machine) for sewing clothing

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 26-years-old married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are of all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy stocks of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables for selling by his wife in her grocery business. His business goal is to buy a tuk tuk for transport within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a permanent house. This is his fifth loan with  SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: buy stocks of tomatoes, onions and other vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a retail business where he sells bread, washing soap, eggs and other items.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years.  His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds.  

Joshua will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, soap, eggs and other items.  His business goal is to open a wholesale business within 5 years.  He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.  

This is his seventh loan with  SMEP DTM.  He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: buy more stock of bread, soap, eggs and other items

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 43 years old and married with seven children. With five children currently in school, Marilou works very hard to provide for them.

Marilou's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Marilou is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Marilou has requested PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell such as canned goods, bath soap, toothpaste, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc. 

Marilou is committed to rebuild, and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries like canned goods, bath soap, toothpaste, detergent soap, cooking oil, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Josue Humberto

texts.es:
Josué, es un joven soltero, vive con sus padres, con el fin de mejorar su situación económica, cubrir sus gastos personales y contribuir con los gastos familiares emprendió un negocio personal, el cual consiste en atender su propio gimnasio, por el momento no representa riesgo alguno.
Se ha decidido a solicitar un crédito para comprar máquinas de hacer ejercicio y pesas, para equipar mejor su establecimiento y dar un servicio con mayor calidad a sus clientes, espera atraer a nuevos clientes, mejorar sus ingresos con los cuales cancelara su deuda adquirida y continuara apoyando a su familia.
Sueña con tener un negocio con todo lo necesario para que su rentabilidad sea mejor y en un futuro que sea autosuficiente.
texts.en:
Josué is a single, young man who lives with his parents. In order to improve his economic situation, cover his personal costs, and help with family expenses, he launched his own gym business, which at the moment represents no risk.

He has decided to apply for a loan to buy exercise machines and free weights to better equip his establishment and provide higher quality service to his customers. He hopes to attract new customers and increase his income to cancel his acquired debt and continue supporting his family.

He dreams of having a business with everything necessary for better profitability and a self-sufficient future.

loans.use: to buy exercise machines and free weights

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Saum is a business woman who is very hardworking.  She is married with one child who is still underage.  She lives in her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

Saum has operated a charcoal selling business for the past 1 year.  Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, onions, oil, and other similar items for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Protus

texts.en:
Protus lives in the Kitale area of North Rift, Kenya. He is married and has 5 children. He has been doing farming for 5 years with his source of income coming from the sale of milk, eggs, and crops. He stated that his favorite aspect of farming is looking after his livestock, while his biggest challenge is eradicating livestock diseases.

Protus chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans and also have favorable repayment terms. This loan will bring in more income and thus, his family's living standards will improve.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Artisiah

texts.en:
Artisiah is a married woman with no children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal, African chairs (the chairs are made from rope), palm nut, fufu (starchy food made from cassava), etc., for her business.

loans.name: Eduardo Del Carmen

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo del Carmen es un obrero, soltero que vive en el municipio de condega a unos 35 km al norte de la ciudad de Estelí, él tiene más de 30 años de vivir en este municipio siendo una persona muy conocida.
Este señor labora en un matadero en el área de destace de los bovinos como responsable de dicha área y labora en el área de carga de esta misma empresa, él tiene más de tres años de laborar de manera continua, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso.
El señor Eduardo se presentó a las oficinas de ceprodel con el objetivo de solicitar un financiamiento para terminar de construir su casa de habitación que ya se encuentra con parte de la construcción realizada, él se muestra objetivo que dicho financiamiento le será aprobado y otorgado y de esta manera podrá tener su casa construida totalmente y así tener un techo digno y por ende mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Eduardo del Carmen is a laborer. He is single and lives in the town of Condega, located 35 km to the north of the city Estelí. He’s a well-known person, since he has lived in that town for over 30 years. 

He works at a slaughterhouse, in the butchering room. He is responsible for this area, and also works at the loading area of the same company. He has continuously worked for over 3 years, and this activity is his main source of income. 

Mr. Eduardo went to CEPRODEL to request a loan that he will use to finish building his house. Part of the construction is already done. He is confident that he will get the loan, and will be able to finish his house, this way having an adequate place to live and .improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, like: bricks, sand, cement, and iron.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin used his previous loan to buy fruits, biscuits, sweets, and soft drinks to sell in his food stall. It was profitable and he has been able to repay the loan successfully. He now runs a retail shop and he currently makes a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

He plans to use this loan to purchase more goods such as sugar, rice, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale. He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to build a good residential house. 

This is his second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he repaid the previous loan successfully. In the future he hopes to live a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as rice, sugar, and flour for resale

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 42-year-old married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business, in which he sells books. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are individuals and schools. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of payment by customers. 

He will use the 60,000 KES loan to pay school fees for his children. His business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is his third loan with  SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Lidieth

texts.es: Lidieth, tiene la edad  de 30 años, está soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Lidieth, 30, is single and lives with her parents and her siblings, who are her main priority.  With this loan, she plans to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and she also will pay for workers to help with her coffee crops.  In addition, she will buy some seedlings to re-plant at the start of the rainy season to increase the density of plants on her land so that she can take advantage of the good soil fertility and climate conditions that favor the cultivation of coffee.
With these improvements to her plantations, she hopes to obtain more earnings and thereby improve her family's living conditions, invest a bit more in her crops, and also accomplish some other goals.  This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She had not taken other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR is providing her with a loan with easier payment terms and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to care for her coffee crops

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two children, who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither has piped water nor electricity. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a cosmetic business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelery, chemicals and braids for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotion, hair oil, jewelery, chemicals and braids for resale.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María es una joven emprendedora de 24 años de edad, que por falta de oportunidades laborales se vio obligada a trabajar como vendedora ambulante, ofreciendo café, aromáticas, pan y tortas de carne, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica y trabaja diariamente de 4 a 10 am y de 4 a 8 pm, de esta forma ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer las finanzas familiares y progresar, María quiere incursionar con la venta de almuerzos de manera ambulante, pues los actuales clientes le están solicitando el servicio y encuentra una oportunidad de progreso en esta nueva labor que desea emprender, para ello solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará un triciclo para transportar los domicilios, una estufa semi industrial, utensilios de cocina e insumos (verduras, granos, carnes), esto le permitirá dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo con el que espera mejorar los ingresos.
María con su empuje, tenacidad y su espíritu de superación quiere seguir luchando para que en un futuro pueda cumplir el sueño de adquirir su casa propia y generar nuevos empleos, así estará en la capacidad de mejorar la condiciones de vida y disfrutar un mejor bienestar.
texts.en:
María is a young 24-year-old entrepreneur. She had few job opportunities, and so she was obliged to work as an itinerant seller, providing coffee, herbal tea, bread and Colombian meat fritters. She learnt this job empirically, and she works daily from 4 to 10 am and from 4 to 8 pm. In this way, she has managed to make enough money to help her husband with the household bills.

María wants to branch out into selling lunches in her travelling sales business in order to improve the family's finances and get on. This is because her current customers are asking for this service, and she sees it as an opportunity to progress in the new work that she wants to start. This is why she is asking for help in the form of the loan. She will use it to buy a tricycle for home deliveries, a semi-industrial stove, kitchen utensils and ingredients such as vegetables, grains, and meat. This will let her get her new profitable project off the ground, and with it she hopes to improve her income.

With her drive, tenacity and desire to get on, María wants to continue fighting so that in the future she can achieve her dream of owning her own house and creating new jobs. Doing this, she will be able to improve her living conditions and enjoy a better way of life.

loans.use: to buy a tricycle for home deliveries, a semi-industrial stove, kitchen utensils and ingredients such as vegetables, grains and meat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stocks of clothes, ladies shoes and metal boxes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of tomatoes and vegetables

loans.name: Olga Lucia

texts.es:
Ella es olga lucia, creció en un humilde hogar lleno de valores morales y disciplina, por circunstancias de la vida los padres se separaron que al quedar la madre sola cabeza de  familia luchando por brindarles un estudio no lo puede lograr y deciden emigrar para Bogotá donde gran parte de la familia vive.
Ellos esperaban mejorar la calidad de vida pero las cosas no salieron como esperaban y Olga a los 16 años decide trabajar y posponer el estudio y el sueño de ser bachiller por el momento.
Como era  de esperarse a la vida llega el amor y en esos momentos era   como una salida a los problemas que pudiera tener. De ese amor nace una bebe inesperada, fue algo muy difícil para todos especialmente para la madre, npues la niña menor de edad ahora tenía que madurar y asumir el rol de madre, los sueños se ven estancados pero en la mente siempre tenía presente estudiar y estudiar. Consigue un trabajo por días y con lo que ganaba se paga el estudio y se gradúa de bachiller, era un alivio, pero ella quería seguir estudiando aunque la pareja no estuviera de acuerdo y presentara un obstáculo.
Siempre quiso pertenecer al gremio de trabajadores en el área de salud especialmente odontología pues cuando vivía en el pueblo le fascinaba ir a los exámenes  de rutina para el colegio y todo lo que había allí le llamaba la atención.
Se puso de nuevo a conseguir trabajo pero de nuevo  llegaba una noticia inesperada un nuevo bebe los acompañaba en la vida, fue difícil porque de nuevo pensaba que se iba a quedar estancada en el proyecto, pero los consejos y el apoyo de la familia y amigos la animaron para seguir adelante y entender que los hijos no son impedimento para salir adelante al contrario hay es que luchar por ellos. 
De nuevo Olga se propone a conseguir un trabajo donde la dejen estudiar y con un esposo que no está de acuerdo con los proyectos y dos hijos por sacar adelante, lo hace, consigue un trabajo de medio tiempo donde los jefes la apoyan y le dan la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene que aplazar un semestre por cuestiones económicos consigue un subsidio y  lo termina; en el segundo semestre se entera de un programa de kiva y decide pedir ayuda pues los ingresos no le ayudan mucho ya que tiene también otras obligaciones y no soportaría de nuevo aplazar otro semestre habiendo luchado tanto por empezarlo.
Ella quiere terminar la carrera, ser una odontóloga y especializarse en ortodoncia con nuevos ingresos, comprar una casa y brindarle a los hijos un futuro prospero y ayudar a los padres hasta el fin de los días.
texts.en:
Olga Lucia was born in a humble home filled with moral values and discipline. Due to circumstances of life her parents separated leaving her mother to be the sole head of the family, fighting to give them an education but she was not able to and they decided to emigrate to Bogota where most of the family live. They hoped to improve their quality of life but things did not go as they hoped and Olga, at age 16, decided to work and postpone her studies and the dream of graduating from high school for the moment.

As could be expected in life love arrived and at that moment it was a solution to her problems. From that love an unexpected baby was born. It was very difficult for everyone, especially the mother, the underage child now has to grow up and assume the roll of mother. They are at a standstill but in her mind the dreams are always there to study and study. Getting a day job and with what she earned she paid for her studies and graduated from high school. It was a relief, but she wanted to continue studying even though her husband disagrees and sparks an obstacle.

She always wanted to belong to the guild of workers in the health field, especially dentistry, as when she lived in the village she loved to go to the routine tests for school and all that caught her attention. She began again to continue work but another unexpected new baby came along. It was difficult because once again she thought that she was going to have to hold back on the project, but the advice and the support of family and friends encouraged her to go ahead and to understand that the children were not an impediment to success but to fight for them. 

Once again Olga planed to get a job putting aside her studies with a husband that does not agree with her projects and two children to bring up, but she is able to get a part time job where the bosses support her and give her the opportunity to study. She has to postpone a semester for financial reasons and gets a subsidy that ends. In the second semester she is acquainted with the Kiva program and decides to ask for help as her income does not help a lot as she also has other obligations and could not endure another delay for another semester having fought so much to commence it.

She wants to finish her studies, to be a dentist and specialize in orthodontics, and with new earnings buy a house and give her children a prosperous future and to help her parents to the end of their lives.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition

loans.name: Yesica Del Carmen

texts.es: Yesica se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y las hortalizas, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como lo muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlo a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus hijos y su compañero de vida quien trabaja como albañil y también le ayuda en la siembra, Yesica esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, abonos, herbicidas, etc. para poder seguir con su siembra y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yesica has worked in agriculture for several years. Her main crops are corn and vegetables. When her harvest is ready, she stores it in sacks—as the photograph shows. She then sells it at several markets that are located near her place of residence. With her earnings and the help of her husband, they manage to cover some of the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her children and partner, who works as a mason and also helps her with her crops. Yesica is applying for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control products, manure, herbicides, and so forth to be able to continue farming. In this manner, she will obtain better earnings to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, pest control products, manure, herbicides, and so forth.

loans.name: Cristhian Francisco

texts.es: Cristhian Francisco, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de preparación del terreno. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de banano de buena calidad y sanidad para que tengan un buen desarrollo a corto plazo, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de banano. Con esta nueva siembra de cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Cristhian Francisco is 24 years old, married, and lives with his wife who is his main priority.

With his loan he intends to buy fertilizer, fungicides and to pay for labor to help him prepare the land, besides being able to buy some good quality healthy banana plants so he can have a short term harvest, while taking advantage of the good fertility of the soil and the climate and other conditions that favor the cultivation of bananas. With this new sowing of crops he hopes to have a little income in order to improve the living conditions for his family and also to invest a little more in harvesting and also to meet some goals.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in state banks but FUDECOSUR has offered a loan more easily and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to grow banana plants

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 46 years old, married, and the mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nasreen has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers. Nasreen is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and auto spare parts for her husband's vehicle that is used in the business.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “KANTU DE SAN JERONIMO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Magaly Marisol ella es casada y tiene 30 años y tiene 2 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 1 año en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar, aceite y arroz.

La socia que esta tapada su cara ya no pertenece al banco comunal Kantu de San Jeronimo. 
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ponches, negocio de carpintería, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrowers belong to the communal bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo.” This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

One of the borrowers, Magaly Marisol, is married. She is 30 years old and has 2 children. She has a business selling groceries. She sells prime necessities such as rice, sugar, milk and oil. She works from 8:00AM until 6:00PM. She has been in this business for one year and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her grocery store business. She is asking for a loan to buy milk, sugar, oil and rice.

The person whose face is blocked out does not belong to the communal bank Kantu de San Jeronimo. 

The other borrowers are in the business of selling fruit punches, in carpentry, grocery stores, and restaurants. 

The borrower is grateful to those that are a part of this dream through Kiva and she promises to comply with the established loan payment plan.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, oil, and rice

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: pedro de 57 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, el se dedica a la tapicería desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela establecida, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Pedro quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando el techo y construir las paredes en donde muestra la fotografía, pero con lo que obtiene no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por eso razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar laminas, ladrillos, hierro, polines, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra y así terminar de arreglar su vivienda para vivir mas seguros y cómodos.
texts.en:
Pedro, of 57 years old, lives in his own house along with his daughter. He has worked in upholstery for several years, and his business is located at his place of residence. He has a lot of clients, and with his earning, he’s able to pay for the household expenses. 

Don Pedro wants to improve his house by putting a roof, and building walls for the place that is shown in the photo. However, his earnings are not enough and that’s why he’s asking for a loan. He will use it to buy iron sheets, bricks, iron, poles, cement, sand, and to pay for labor. This way he will finish building his house, making it a safer and more comfortable place to live in.
