loans.use: to buy iron sheets, bricks, iron, poles, cement, sand, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 39 years old and single. She works as a seamstress and also sells African wax-print fabric. She learned this trade from her mistress for three years, and then decided to open her own shop. Her business is located in her own residence, but in order to buy material, lining and more African wax-print fabric with which to stock the store, she has to travel to the main market in Accra, which is located not far from Teshie. Therefore, she is  requesting this loan to buy these items. She says that by buying wholesale, she will spend less on transporting the products that she buys, and will also improve her business and her financial circumstances. She says that her dream is to see her business grow through this loan.

loans.use: to buy material, lining and more African wax-print fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains, potatoes, cassava, fruits, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Adi lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. He manages a small shop selling groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Adi is single and lives with four persons in the family home.

Adi joined Ruma one month ago because he was interested in selling mobile phone airtime credits. With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Adi sees improvements in his shop. 

For the last month, he has earned an average of $10 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales. He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  

His goal for his business is to expand to do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credit transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Carolina Elisabet

texts.es: Carolina de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace 5 años a la comercialización de juguetes lo hace de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, Carolina esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder comprar mas juguetes por mayor y así seguir con su trabajo para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Carolina, who's thirty-two years old, has been selling toys for five years. She sells her products as a street vendor at several markets that are located near her place of residence. With her earnings, she manages to cover some of the household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Carolina is applying for this loan from INTEGRAL to buy wholesale toys, and thus to continue working to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale toys.

loans.name: Eunia

texts.en:
Eunia is a 42-year-old lady from Kakamega county. She is married to Daniel who is a businessman in the same town. They have six children, ages 20, 18, 15, 13, 8 and 6 years old.

Eunia sells vegetables and cereals as her business and has done this for the past 18 years, earning an average income of 19,200 KES per month. She is taking her fifth loan of 45,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya, to use in buying more grocery items and cereals. The profits will be used to repay the loan and have some savings. Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Erick Daniel

texts.es:
Erick es un joven muy trabajador, día a día se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante en su trabajo como personal de seguridad, asimismo con mucho esfuerzo y ahorro logro iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, con lo cual tiene un dinero extra para los gastos; el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Erick está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar abarrotes para poder abastecer su pequeño negocio y de esta manera poder atender mejor a sus clientes, así el podrá seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener un negocio más grande”.
texts.en:
Erick is a very hardworking young man. Day to day, he strives to get ahead in his work as a security guard. Additionally, with much effort and saving, he succeeded in starting his small business of selling groceries, with which he has extra money for expenses. He works about 10 hours each day and believes that his work is going well because he is responsible. 

Erick is grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to buy groceries to supply his small business. In this way he will be able to serve his customers better, so he can continue working and fighting to be able to make his great dream a reality: "To have a bigger business."

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 36-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he offers dry cleaning services. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good marketable place and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a stock of washing soap and other cleaning materials. His business goal is to open a dry cleaning company within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his family living standards.This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a stock of washing soap and other cleaning materials.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years now. She is 36 years old, married and together with her spouse she has been blessed with 1 child aged 4 years. Her spouse also provides additional income. 

Margaret will be using this loan to buy more beauty products for using in her business. These include hair oil, dyes, lotions and cosmetics. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land. 

Having paid her previous loans successfully, this will be her third loan term with VisionFund Kenya. In future, Margaret hopes to expand her business and buy a plot of land for her family.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and cosmetics.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 46-year-old married man. He has three children ranging in age from 2 years to 7 years old. He describes himself to be honest, hardworking and ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a business friendly area and his primary customers are loyal customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be able to yield good returns within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will open another business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. It was wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan when it swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013.

To restart her business, Gina requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this business for two years now. With your help Gina will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

Gina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joedalyn

texts.en:
Joedalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 43 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Joedalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan on November 8, 2013. Joedalyn requested a 7,000 PHP bridge loan through NWTF to  purchase groceries, such as soft-drinks, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, etc., to sell in her general store in order to restart her business activities.

Joedalyn has been in this business for five years and would like to rebuild it with your help. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, such as soft-drinks, noodles, canned goods, detergent soap, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a divorced woman with four children; two are in school and two are adults. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanamvua has operated a food stall making rice, tea, beans, and chapati (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the 20,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and utensils for the business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, rice and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 29-year-old lady from Kakamega county who has two children aged 13 and 10.

She sells cooking gas (LPG) a business she has been engaged in for the last two years earning an average income of KES 7,500 per month. She is taking her 1st loan of KES 20,000 with VisionFund Kenya to increase her stock of gas cylinders. The profits will be used to repay the loan and collect savings.

Her dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to increase her stock of gas cylinders.

loans.name: Wallen

texts.en:
Wallen has rental houses in Nairobi town and the business has been profitable. She is 33 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. Her spouse also provides additional income. 

Wallen will be using this loan to buy building materials, such as cement, for renovating her rental houses. She will use the anticipated profits to grow her business. 

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to buy building materials for renovating her rental houses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For more than two years, she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a grocery store in the future.

With the 30,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of green vegetables, fruit, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for resale.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta is a 33-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and two children in Sachkhere district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of farmland, where different kinds of crops are grown. They sell the harvested products locally. Violeta decided to purchase a cow and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 800 GEL to purchase a cow. She will milk the cow and will start producing dairy products. This will increase the income of her family and thus will improve their living conditions. Violeta awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Hernán Alonso

texts.es:
Hernán es un campesino humilde y trabajador de 37 años de edad, que desde pequeño aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre y sus hermanos mayores; debido a esto, hoy en día se dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado de levante, cuyo producto es vendido en la plaza de mercado de la región.
Con el ánimo de mejorar los ingresos para su familia, Hernán desea reactivar su labor agrícola sembrando nuevamente semillas de fríjol, por esta razón solicita el crédito con el que comprará insumos agrícolas al por mayor (pesticidas, abonos, fertilizantes y semillas de fríjol);  así podrá tener cultivos que le generen ingresos con las cosechas que se vendan en el mercado.
Hernán, con su tenacidad y empuje quiere seguir luchando para sacar adelante sus negocios, pues sueña con tener toda su parcela con diferentes cultivos para satisfacer las necesidades diversas de los clientes y mejorar los ingresos para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Hernán is a humble, hard-working man from the countryside who is 37 years old. From the time he was very young, he learned to do all kinds of field work thanks to his parents and older siblings who taught him. Thanks to this, today he raises and sells livestock which he sells in the area's central market.

With the goal of increasing his family's income, Hernan wants to return to his work planting and growing beans, and that is why he is asking for a loan. He will use the money to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale (pesticides, manure, fertilizer, and seeds for beans); he will be able to have crops that generate income from the crops he sells at the market. 

With his tenacity and drive, Hernan wants to continue to fight to grow his businesses. He dreams of planting his fields with different crops to meet the needs of his diverse customers and thereby increase his income and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies at wholesale (pesticides, manure, fertilizer, and seeds for beans)

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 30 years old and is married to Ivy. They are blessed with one child who is two years old. 

Moses offers motorcycle transport services and has been in the business for four years now. 

He plans to use this loan to buy spare parts as well as service his motorcycle. This will enable him to serve his customers well and also increase his income. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and also to build a house for his family.

This is his fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loans successfully. His future hope is to buy land.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de 7 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames.  Elles ont en moyenne 30 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de produits cosmétiques (pommades, mèches, crèmes à lèvre, parfums,…), des boissons, de l’arachide, d’habits et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques et mèches de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 paquets  de mèches au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail Djicoroni  à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Aminata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
Most of the seven women who make up the Danaya group are married and live within monogamous families.  On average, they are 30 years old and also have three children each.  They all live in Djicoroni, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako.  They know one another through neighborhood ties.  The members of the group are involved in food preparation or small retail business, selling drinks, groundnut, clothes, as well as cosmetic products (ointments, hair extensions, lip balms, perfumes...).  In order to increase their business, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their first cycle of solidarity loan.

Aminata, the featured borrower, is a well-known seller of cosmetic products and quality hair extensions.  In the photo, she is seated in the middle of the front row.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 packs of hair extensions at the Grand Market.  She resells her goods, mostly to women and on a retail basis, in Djicoroni.  Thanks to this loan, Aminata is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.  Through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a plot of land to build a house on.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice and fish.

loans.name: God's Time Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the large group called “God's Time”. The group is made up of three married women who are, on average, 30 years old, and have two children. They live in traditional, extended families in the Teshie district of the town of Accra, Ghana. They know one another through business, friendship and neighborhood ties.

In order to strengthen their financial capacity and improve their businesses, the women have decided to work with the field partner, ID Ghana. This will be their sixth loan as a group. 

The women sell hair and body cream, deodorant, perfume, groceries and sewing accessories. 

Lawrencia is a seamstress. She will use her loan to buy material, lining and thread from the wholesalers in Accra. She sews and then sells her products at her residence in Teshie. Her service is cash and carry.

Lawrencia earns a good profit and will make a good one from this loan, which she will invest in her business and use to repay her loan. This is her second loan from Kiva, and together with her friends, will need a total amount of GHS 3,200 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy material, lining and thread from the wholesalers in Accra.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djiguiya est composé uniquement de femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, produits cosmétiques, des couches pour bébé, parfums, pommade, crèmes à lèvres, vernis, des condiments, huiles d’arachide, habits et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Fatoumata  (debout en 2ème position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des produits cosmétiques. Elle compte utiliser son prêt  pour acheter  20 paquets de couches pour bébé et 2 cartons de parfum au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail à Djicoroni et en ambulant à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femme. Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the Djiguiya group are all married within monogamous families.  On average, they are 34 years old and have five children each.  They all live in Djicoroni, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako, and have come to know one another through neighborhood ties.  The members of the group are involved in the preparation of food or in small retail, selling cosmetic products, baby diapers, perfumes, ointments, lip balms, nail polish, condiments, groundnut oil and clothes.  In order to develop their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Fatoumata, the featured borrower, is a well-known seller of cosmetic products.  In the photo, she is the woman standing second from the left.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 packs of baby diapers as well as two boxes of perfumes at the Grand Market.  She resells her goods on a retail basis and mostly to women.  She works in Djicoroni and as an itinerant seller.  Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.  Through her partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a plot of land to build a house on.

loans.use: to buy baby diapers and perfumes.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is a 25 year old single man. He describes himself as optimistic and eager. He operates a retail business where he sells jikos (charcoal stoves). He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a productive place and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be limited space. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to rent more business premise space to enable him have enough space where he can run his business smoothly. His business goal is to own a big business within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to rent more business premise space .

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Vicente es originario de Nicaragua, vive en una comunidad de Jinotega, con su esposa y 4 hijos con edades entre 2 y 11 años. Desde hace más de 12 años cuenta con su pequeña finca de 6.5 Hectáreas, en las cuales cultiva café y cacao principalmente. Los dos rubros son producidos bajo procesos de certificación, el café bajo el sello Comercio Justo y el cacao bajo certificación orgánica. En los últimos 3 años su producción de café pergamino ha sido de 300 quintales. Su meta este año, es renovar mediante el recepo 0.7 hectárea de café de las 2.11 hectáreas que tiene establecidas, a fin de mejorar los rendimientos productivos del café y hacer frente a los precios bajos del mercado con un mayor volumen. A medida que sus ingresos vayan aumentando, su visión es comprar más terreno para diversificar más su finca con otros rubros como ganado y disminuir riesgos. Este pequeño empresario rural siempre ha si muy cuidadoso de invertir los financiamientos que ha recibidos en las actividades para las cuales lo solicita y de reinvertir aunque sea una pequeña parte de sus utilidades en su propia finca.
texts.en:
Vicente is a native of Nicaragua. He lives the community of Jinotega with his wife and four children aged 2 to 11 years old. For more than 12 years he has had a small 6.5 hectare ranch on which he farms coffee and cocoa, primarily. The two are produced under processes of certification - the coffee with the stamp "Comercio Justo" ["Fair Trade"] and the cocoa as certified organic. 

In the last three years, his coffee production has been 300 quintals (30,000 pounds). His goal this year is to renew (by pruning) 0.7 hectares of coffee of the 2.11 hectares that he has established,so that he improves the productive yield of the coffee and confronts low market prices with greater volume. 

To the extent that his income increases, his vision is to buy more land in order to diversify his ranch more with other lines of farming such as livestock and to reduce risks. This small, rural entrepreneur has always been very careful in investing the funding that he has received in the activities for which he requests it and to reinvest, although it may be a small part of his utilities, in his own ranch.

loans.use: to buy plants and supplies for coffee renewal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coal, oil, and fufu (a starch food made from cassava) for her business.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is 39 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Maina, who brings in some additional income for the family. They are blessed with three children, aged 10, 8 and 7 years old. Harriet sells cereals, a business she has been running for the last ten years. To enable her to buy more cereals to sell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES30,000 from VisionFund Kenya. Her monthly income right now is KES30,000. She has plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children, buy more cereals and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya. In the future, she hopes to be an established businesswoman in her region.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Domenica

texts.en:
Domenica is 32 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with three children. She runs a boutique and has been in the business for two years. Right now she makes a monthly income of KES 17,000. 

Domenica plans to use this loan to purchase clothes and textile materials to sell in her business. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to repay the loan as well as expand her business by purchasing more clothes for selling. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. Her future hope and dream is to buy land.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 51 years old and married.  

Laura is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Laura requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Laura has been farming vegetables for 27 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Laura would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en: Dominga is 50 years old and married with six children. Dominga works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock, such as canned goods, soft drinks, bath soap, toothpaste, shampoo, etc. to sell. Dominga has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running her general store for eight years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and loading mobile phones. Dominga aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock, such as canned goods, soft drinks, bath soap, toothpaste, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dried meat for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods, such as rice, oil, charcoal, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy five 50kg bags of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for the construction of bathroom facilities, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 40 years old from Nyahururu. She is single and supports one child aged 17 years old.

She has been running a business of selling children's clothing and footwear for the last ten years. To enable her to buy more stocks of these items to sell to her customers, she has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 40,000. She has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her child, buy more stocks of clothes and shoes to sell to her customers and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be an established business woman in her region.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of children's clothing and footwear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 59 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chemicals, weaves and cosmetics

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with three children, two in school and one underage. They live at their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Fatuma has operated a juice-making business for the past one year. She sells from home to her neighbors. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase mangoes, juice flavors, carrots and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, juice flavors, carrots and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Madona

texts.en:
Madona is a 29-year-old housekeeper, from the village of Kartubani. She lives with her pensioner parents. She is a hard worker, who puts much effort into helping her family earn their living and cover the family's increasing needs. She works on family-owned agricultural land, growing eggplant and peppers, and taking care of the milk cow. She has a small income from this activity. However, this source of income isn't enough to meet all the daily needs of her family. A loan of 3100 GEL will be a huge support to this motivated woman and her family, enabling them to purchase dental instruments for opening a dental clinic. All the financial institutions rejected Madona's loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.
This will give Madona chance to earn income and become financially independent. With the Start Up program, she will be able to start her business and increase the productivity.

loans.use: to open a dental clinic.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina has a boutique business in Kangundo town. She sells handbags and clothes and has been running this business for the last four years. She is 52 years old, married, and together with her spouse has been blessed with six children. She also does poultry farming, and it has been profitable.

She will be using this loan to purchase handbags and clothes for resale in her business. She will also buy more chickens for rearing. She will use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children. 

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. In the future, Angelina hopes to see all her grandchildren get educated and live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy handbags and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick used his previous loan to buy such items as TVs and radios to add to his inventory. His business flourished after the loan investment, and he was able to expand his business.

Patrick has applied for another loan to enable him buy more DVDs and TVs to add to his inventory. He is optimistic that his business will continue to improve and that he will be able to meet the demands of his clients.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future so that he can become the leading electronics dealer in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy electronic items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his store to resell

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks like eggs, noodles, dried fish, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, etc., to sell for her general store business.

Arlene has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Arlene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like eggs, noodles, dried fish, canned goods, soft drinks, beers, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale fish to sell.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti is a hard-working and enterprising woman. She is a married mother of five children, one of whom is in school and the other four are adults. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Mwanasiti prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells them to neighbours and passersby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. With the requested KES40,000 loan she would like to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Máximo  Germán

texts.es: Máximo es un pequeño productor de café de Jinotega. Vive en su pequeña finca con su esposa y sus 4 hijos todos menores de 10 años. Su plantación de café es de 4.23 hectáreas y está integrado al proceso de certificación Fairtrade. La producción de café promedio de este pequeño productor ha sido de 100 quintales pergamino en los últimos 3 años. Hasta ahora ha venido enfrentando dificultades en el manejo post-cosecha de su café ya que no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias para realizar este proceso. Por lo tanto, está solicitando un financiamiento para inversión que le permita construir un beneficio húmedo para el manejo adecuado de su café, con lo cual asegurará una mayor calidad y además disminuir las pérdidas durante el procesamiento. Está seguro que con su trabajo y esfuerzo podrá lograr una buena producción, y que con este financiamiento podrá procesar adecuadamente su cosecha, para obtener mayores rendimientos.
texts.en:
Máximo is a small coffee producer from Jinotega. He lives on his small ranch with his wife and four kids, all under 10 years old. His coffee plantation is 4.23 hectares and is integrated into the Fair Trade certification process. The average coffee production of this small producer has been 100 quintals (about 10,000 pounds) Pergamino (beans with the outer parchment shell) in the last 3 years. 

Up until now, Máximo has faced difficulties in the post-harvest management of his coffee and does not have the necessary conditions to carry out this process. Therefore, he is requesting financing for investment that allows him to build a wet coffee processing plant for the appropriate management of his coffee. This will assure better quality as well as reduce losses during processing. Máximo is sure that with his work and effort he will achieve a good production, and with this funding he will be able to appropriately process his harvest to obtain greater yield.

loans.use: for the construction of wet coffee processing plant.

loans.name: Rufus

texts.en:
Rufus is 52 years old, and from Nyahururu. He is married to Mary and they are blessed with five children aged 18, 16, 14, 12 and 10 years old.

He is an electrician and also sells water storage tanks, a business he has been running for the last 12 years, and to be able to buy some electrical materials he has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES. 36,000 and he has plans of using the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy some electrical materials.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, age 34, sells motorcycle spare parts to earn a living. He has been engaged in his business for the last eight years and earns a monthly income of KES 25000. 

He and his wife Mary have five children, ages four, six, eight, 10, and 12 years old. 

Charles is requesting his first loan in the amount of KES 60000 with VisionFund Kenya. He intends to use his loan funds to expand his business, as well as to pay school fees for his children. 

The anticipated proceeds will be used to repay the loan, to add more share to VisionFund Kenya, and to grow his business.

His dream is to become a wholesaler in this sector.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle tires, springs, tubes, bolts, and motorcycle seats

loans.name: Cherryl

texts.en:
Cherryl is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy-and-sell rice business.

Cherryl has been in this business for two years. Cherryl earns more income from raising livestock.

Cherryl has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and married with four children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.

Rosalinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is married woman with five children, two of whom attend school and three of whom are adults. She lives in a rental house that has electricity  but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, paraffin, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap, wheat flour, bread, milk, paraffin, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. Rosa Argentina se dedica a la elaboracion y ventas de artesanias de barro elaborando adornos muy atractivos desde hace hace mas de 20 años, tambien es profesora de una escuela primaria donde ayuda adarle las primeras letras a mucho niños de escasos recursos, la Sra. Rosa necesita este credito para invertir en la compra de barro, moldes de figuras, pinturas y otros materiales necesarios para la elaboracion de figuras de barrios (artesanias)
texts.en: Rosa Argentina makes and sells clay handicrafts making very attractive decorations. She has been doing this for over 20 years. She is also a teacher in a Primary school where she helps to teach the first letters to many children of modest resources. Rosa needs this loan to invest in the purchase of clay, molds, paint and other materials needed to produce her clay figures (handicrafts).

loans.use: to buy clay and molds for decorations.

loans.name: Felix De La Cruz

texts.es:
Felix tiene 56 años, vive en la cálida ciudad de Nazca al lado de sus esposa y de sus 5 hijos, a los cuales quiere mucho y sobre todo por quienes lucha cada día para hacerlos personas de bien y sobre todo sean mejores que el. Felix trabaja como Guardián en un colegio de su ciudad, trabaja alrededor de 12 horas diarias pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de picarones por las calles de la ciudad;  con el fruto de sus trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos familiares, él cree que le va bien en sus trabajos porque es responsable y porque sus hijos lo impulsan a luchar cada día.

Félix está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que es la tercera oportunidad que le brindan su gran apoyo y ahora podrá solventar algunos gastos de su hogar y realizar algunas mejoras en donde habita, así seguirá luchando para poder para darle a sus hijos una profesión y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Felix is 56 years old and lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and five children. He loves them very much and he strives every day to make them good people and more than anything better than him. Felix works as a caretaker in a High school in his city. He works about 12 hours a day but he also has a small business selling picarones (a dessert made from squash and sweet potato) in the streets of the city. With the fruits of his labor he can manage to pay with much effort the household expenses. He feels things are going well for him at work because he is responsible and also his children inspire him to struggle each day.

Felix is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as this is the third time they have offered their great support and now he can pay some household expenses and make a few improvements in his residence. He will continue to struggle to give his children a profession and improve their quality of living.

loans.use: to pay off personal expenses and improve his residence.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en: Shadi is a 34-year-old, married man from Dier Al-Balah. He lives with his wife and two sons in a small, simple house. For the past year, Shadi has been buying goods from wholesalers and transferring them to local traders. It is a good business and earns a good income. Shadi took a USD1,200 loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his business to resell. It will also help him increase his sales and his income. Shadi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products for his business to resell.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is a food vendor. She earns an additional income from raising livestock. She has successfully repaid her sole previous loan from NWTF, which helped her to sustain her business activities. As the married parent of one child, Sheila works hard to support her family.

Sheila has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 43 years old and married with five children.

Lolita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lolita has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Lolita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Mets Parni village with her husband and 19-year-old son. Her elder son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country trying to support his family financially. 

Gayane herself runs a farm. She and her husband keep cows, pig, and chickens and also cultivate wheat, barley, and potato. 

By applying for this loan, Gayane would like to purchase agricultural machinery for organizing the cultivation process. This will help her to make the cultivation work efficient and she will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural machinery for organizing the cultivation process

loans.name: Bintiali

texts.en:
Bintiali is a widowed woman with two children who go to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods and selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Enkh-Amar

texts.en: Mr. Enkh-Amar, 50 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as oxygen operator since 2004. His wife sells newspaper for a living. The house they live in has deteriorated over the years so he is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. As a result, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to buy building and insulation materials

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un nuevo crédito para surtir el negocio de venta de ropa, comprara pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos, trajes y faldas, para ofrecer mercadería nueva a sus clientes y satisfacer sus gustos.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior Martha puedo adquirir mercadería necesaria para fortalecer su negocio y mantenerse en el mercado, sus ventas aumentaron, la situación económica es mucho más favorable para su familia que de momento se encuentra muy bien.
texts.en:
Martha finds herself needing to request a new loan to stock-up her clothing business.  She will use the loan to purchase shirts, blouses, dresses, suits and skirts.  This will help her to offer new merchandise to her customers and meet their preferences. 
With the help of the previous loan, Martha was able to acquire the merchandise she needed to strengthen her business and keep herself in the market.  Her sales increased and her family's financial situation is now much more favorable.  At the moment, they are doing well.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, dresses, suits and skirts.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah, age 55, operates a hardware store where she sells such items as pipes, cement, and building metals. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her enterprise is located in a business-friendly place and she has built up a clientele of many loyal customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She describes herself to be a visionary and an honest businesswoman.

Hannah and her husband have one child.

Hannah has requested a loan in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use her loan funds to buy such items as cement, building pipes, and spades. Her business goal is to open a general shop within five years. 

She hopes that her business will eventually yield high returns. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy necessary items such as cement, building pipes, and spades for her business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 43 years old, from Naivasha and is married to Jane. They have three children who are in school. 

Peter has a farming business that he has been doing for many years. He has applied for his first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy two cows. He is optimistic that that his life will be better after the loan.

He hopes to diversify into zero grazing in the near future.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 43 years old, from Nyandarua South, and he is married. They have three children who are in school and aged between 12 years old and two years old.

Patrick has a wool spinning business that he has been doing for the past four years. He has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy wool for his spinning business. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to improve his family's livelihood and business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Justo Leocadio

texts.es:
Justo es un pequeño productor en una comunidad rural de Jinotega, dedicado a la caficultura desde hace más de 25 años. Su finca es de 10 manzanas, de las cuales 5 son de café. Su producción anual promedio en los últimos tres años ha sido de 90 quintales de café pergamino. Cuenta con las certificaciones de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices.

Hasta ahora él ha venido enfrentando dificultades en el manejo post-cosecha de su café ya que no cuenta con las condiciones necesarias para realizar este proceso. Por lo tanto, este año está solicitando un financiamiento a mediano plazo, que le permita construir un beneficio húmedo para el manejo adecuado de su café, con lo cual asegurará una mayor calidad y disminuirá las pérdidas durante el procesamiento. Esta inversión le permitirá a Justo procesar su café en su finca, incrementar los rendimientos y obtener mayores ingresos para  mejorar las condiciones de su familia. Adicional a esta inversión, él está solicitando otro financiamiento a corto plazo para el mantenimiento de sus plantaciones en el presente ciclo.
texts.en:
Justo is a small producer in the rural community of Jinotega, making a living by growing coffee for more than 25 years. His ranch is 10 manzanas (about 17.2 acres), five of which are for coffee. Justo's average annual production in the last three years has been 90 quintales (about 9,000 pounds) of Pergamino (with the outer husk) coffee. His coffee is Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E Practice certified. 

Until now, Justo has confronted difficulties in the post-harvest management of his coffee because he does not have the necessary conditions to carry out this process. Therefore, this year he is requesting medium-term funding that would let him build a wet coffee processing plant for the appropriate management of his coffee. This will assure better quality and reduce losses during processing. This investment will allow Justo to process his coffee on his ranch, increase yield and obtain better income in order to improve conditions for his family. In addition to this investment, he is requesting another short-term loan for the management of his plantations in the current season.

loans.use: construct a wet coffee processing plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tissues, soap, spray, etc., for her business

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet has a clothing business and has been running it for six years. She is 60 years old, single and has three children. 

She will be using this loan to purchase bales of children's clothes to sell. Violet anticipates making more profits, which she will use to add more clothing stock. 

This is her fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid her previous loans successfully. In the future Violet hopes to open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase bales of children's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, age 53 and unmarried, operates a retail shop business to earn a living. She sells such items as maize flour, soap, bread, and salt. Her business is located in an area with potential and she has many loyal customers. She has been engaged in her business for the past 20 years and describes herself as ambitious. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. Rosemary has seven children. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan of KES 20,000 and is seeking her second loan. She intends to use the KES 20,000 loan funds to buy a stock of such items as bread, salt, and soap to offer for sale. 

Her business goal is to be financially stable within five years. She hopes that in the future she will excel in her business.

loans.use: to buy such items as bread, salt, and soap to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Beverlyn

texts.en:
Beverlyn is 53 years old and has three children. Beverlyn is married and has one child who is still in school.

Beverlyn is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Beverlyn requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Beverlyn has been in pig fattening for 33 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Beverlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
José, se dispone a preparar todo para la próxima siembra, por lo que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas y semilla, de esta manera no tendrá inconvenientes para continuar fortaleciendo su negocio.
José utilizo el préstamo anterior para tener a su disposición de manera rápida los insumos agrícolas que le ayudaron a tener una cosecha abundante, granos sanos de plagas, mejores ventas y mayores ingresos, los cuales le sirven para mejorar su estilo de vida familiar y cumplir con los pagos de las cuotas del crédito.
texts.en:
José is ready to prepare everything for his next planting, which is why he is requesting a new loan.  He will use the loan to purchase compost, insecticides, pest-control and seeds.  This way, he won't have any problems continuing to strengthen his business.  
José used the previous loan to quickly acquire the agriculture supplies that helped him to have an abundant harvest, pest-free grains and an improved income.  All of this helps José to improve his family's standard of living and comply with his loan repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase compost, insecticides, pest-control and seeds.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada works hard to support her family. Buenaventurada is married and has a buy and sell scrap materials business in the Philippines.

Buenaventurada requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap materials to sell.

Buenaventurada has been in this business for 3 years now.

Buenaventurada would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Azatuhi

texts.en:
Azatuhi lives in Jajur village with her husband and two sons (ages 23 and 21 years old).

Azatuhi and her family are involved in agriculture. They keep livestock, cows, and chickens and cultivate barley and potato. Her husband sells the gathered harvest local market areas, so the family gathers income for its living.

Taking into account that the farming business is the only source of her family's income, Azatuhi would like to enlarge it. She has applied for this loan to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation. This will increase agricultural turnover and Azatuhi will be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for land cultivation

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Su finca es de 28 hectáreas de las cuales 12 son de café. En los últimos años ha logrado una cosecha de aproximadamente 500 quintales de café pergamino, los cuales produce bajo procesos de certificación: Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices. Este pequeño productor ha venido mejorando su finca y como parte de este plan se ha propuesto la inversión para la construcción de un campamento para garantizar buenas condiciones a sus trabajadores.

Uno de los mayores retos que enfrenta este productor en su finca es el control de las plagas y enfermedades del café, tales como la antracnosis la cual provoca manchas en las hojas y frutos.  Para garantizar un plan de manejo integrado de plagas y enfermedades en sus plantaciones, este pequeño productor está solicitando para este ciclo un financiamiento que le permita la adquisición de insumos y fertilizantes para el manejo agronómico del café, lo cual le permitirá además incrementar la producción en un 20% equivalente a 100 quintales más de café. Todo esto derivará en mejores ingresos para alcanzar la sostenibilidad y reinversión en su finca.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a farmer in the northern area of Nicaragua. His farm is 28 hectares, of which 12 are dedicated to coffee. In the last few years, he has succeeded in having a harvest of approximately 50,000 pounds of “pergamino” coffee, which he produces under processes certified by Fair Trade, UTZ, and C.A.F.E standards. This small farmer has been improving his farm and, as part of this effort, he has proposed an investment in the construction of a camp to guarantee good conditions for his workers.

One of the main challenges that confronts this farmer is controlling coffee infestations and diseases, such as fruit rot, which causes spots on the leaves and fruits. To guarantee a plan for managing the infestations and diseases in his farm, this small farmer is requesting a loan that will permit him to acquire supplies and fertilizers to agronomically manage the coffee. This will permit him to increase production by 20%, equal to 10,000 more pounds of coffee. All of this will result in better income to reach sustainability and reinvestment for his farm.

loans.use: to acquire supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 41 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is married. They have three children who are aged between 11 years and 1 year old.

Peter has a motorcycle business that he has been running for the past six years. He has applied for his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable him to buy spare parts that will in turn help expand his business. He is optimistic that his business will do better after the loan.

He hopes to live a happy life in the near future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and married with two children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Elena has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Elena aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Linner

texts.en:
Meet Linner, a farmer in the Litein area of South Rift Kenya living with her husband and 4 children. She has been farming for 5 years with her primary income being milk and eggs. Like most of the farmers in Litein, she loves dairy farming. Her biggest challenge is unpredictable climatic conditions.

Linner chose Juhudi Kilimo because of their low interest rates and their accommodation of even the low income farmers who want to develop their farming projects. Through this poultry loan, she will be able to generate more income for her farming projects and also to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 42 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She sells 'waakye' (the local name for rice and beans cooked together) in Accra in Ghana, and requested a GHS 1500 loan through ID-Ghana to buy more rice and beans, which she will cook and sell to customers in the morning.

Eva has borrowed and repaid six loans from ID-Ghana before this loan. This is her second from Kiva. She has been selling waakye for seven years and earns good income.

Eva aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more rice and beans, which she will cook and sell to customers in the morning.

loans.name: Akotobu Group

texts.en:
This group of four women is called the Akotobu Group. Their average age is 32 years old and they have an average of two children at home. They all live in traditional extended families in Teshie, one of the neighborhoods in Accra-Ghana. The women are relatives and neighbors who work together, buying and selling such items as vegetables, cassava, fresh fish, noodles, and charcoal. After successfully repaying all their previous loans, this is the eighth group loan for the women of the Akotobu Group. 

Mary is a member of this group and intends to use her loan funds to buy tomatoes, yam, cassava, and charcoal. She purchases her supplies at neighboring markets and sells to a diverse clientele of women and men, who pay sometimes in cash and often on credit. Mary hopes to make a good monthly profit, which she will use to meet her family expenses related to health, food, clothing, and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder into her business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, yam, cassava, and charcoal to offer for sale

loans.name: Muneyi Project Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Nokwasi from Masvingo. She is married with three children who are all attending school. Nokwasi runs a retail business sewing school uniforms, bedspreads, curtains and dresses. The business has been in operation for 5 years. She says the main challenge being faced is that of electricity shortages, which hinders her production levels. Nokwasi has requested a loan of $500 to buy sewing material from Tanzania. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her income and hence improve her family's welfare. In the future Nokwasi plans to supply shops in town with African attire.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials from Tanzania

loans.name: Medea

texts.en: Medea is a 23-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village of the Dusheti district with her husband and 2-year-old son. Medea trades in clothes, and this is the only source of income for the family. She needs to purchase a stock of clothes and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1000 Gel for purchasing clothes. After the stock is purchased, she will offer her clients wide assortments of clothes, and this will increase the income. With the increased income she will provide better living conditions for her family. Medea awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes

loans.name: Justo Leocadio

texts.es: Justo es un pequeño productor en una comunidad rural de Jinotega, dedicado a la caficultura desde hace más de 25 años. Su finca es de 10 manzanas, de las cuales 5 son de café. Su producción anual promedio en los últimos tres años ha sido de 90 quintales de café pergamino. Cuenta con las certificaciones de Fairtrade, UTZ y C.A.F.E. Practices. Para este año, él requiere un financiamiento a corto plazo para garantizar el mantenimiento de su plantación de café, a fin de poder garantizar la compra de insumos y fertilizantes que aseguren la nutrición de las plantas, y obtener una buena cosecha. Esto sumado a otro proyecto de inversión que se ha propuesto para mejorar el procesamiento de su café a través de la construcción de un beneficio húmedo, ayudarán a este productor a incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Justo is a small producer in the rural community of Jinotega, making a living by growing coffee for more than 25 years. His ranch is 10 manzanas (about 17.2 acres), five of which are for coffee. Justo's average annual production in the last three years has been 90 quintales (about 9,000 pounds) of Pergamino (with the outer husk) coffee. His coffee is Fair Trade, UTZ and C.A.F.E Practice certified.

This year, Justo needs short-term funding in order to guarantee the management of his coffee plantation. This allows him to be able to guarantee the purchase of supplies and fertilizers that assure the nutrition of the plants and obtain a good harvest. This is in addition to another investment project that has been proposed to improve the processing of his coffee through the construction of a wet coffee processing plant. They will help this producer to increase his income and improve conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Bajram

texts.en:
Bajram is a single, 30-year-old man living with his entire family in the southern part of Kosovo in a small town. He is a hard worker, working all day long as a taxi driver, and is the main source of income for his family. 

Bajram provides transportation services to all different people of different nationalities. Since he has been in business for a long time, his business and client base have grown steadily, and he has a good reputation in the community, where he works hard. 

Unfortunately, he has been unable to work and generate income lately because he needs to pay the fees and register his taxi. He is requesting a loan to pay the costs of registration for his taxi. He is grateful to all Kiva lenders and will continue to work hard to grow his business.  

He really appreciates this help!

loans.use: to pay the costs of registration for his taxi.

loans.name: Jose Ruben

texts.es: josé de 33 años de edad, desde hace varios años se dedica a la carpintería elabora puertas, ventanas, muebles, etc. posee clientela ya establecida por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa quien se dedica a la sastrería y sus hijos, Jose esta solicitando un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de los materiales que utiliza en su trabajo como: madera, barniz, selladores, pintura, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José is 33 years old, and for many years, he has been a carpenter making doors, windows, furniture, etc. He has established clients because of the quality of his products and his good prices. With his earnings, he can afford much of his household spending. He lives in his own house with his wife, who is a tailor, and his children. José is requesting a loan from Integral to buy materials that he can use for this work, such as wood, varnish, primer, paint, etc. This will allow him to continue with his work since it is his only source of income and to be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, primer, paint, etc.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Maria de 58 años de edad se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de productos de uso personal como lociones, desodorantes, cremas, shampoo, perfumes, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hijo, la clienta desea acrecentar su negocio por eso solicta un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercadería por mayor ya que tiene mucha clientela por dar sus productos a precios accesibles con la ayuda solictada ella podra obtener mejores ganancias y asi seguira dandole a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old. She makes a living by selling all types of products for personal use such as lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo, perfumes, and other items. Her business is located in her place of residence. With her earnings from her sales she will cover home expenses. She lives in her own house with her son. 

Maria wishes to increase her business, and therefore requests this loan that will allow her to buy more wholesale merchandise. She already has many customers to give her products to at accessible prices. With the requested help, she will be able to make better profits and in this way she will continue giving her family what they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, creams, shampoo, perfumes, and other items wholesale.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, drinks, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are daily customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of bread, drinks, soap, and other items. Her business goal is to own a mini-supermarket within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide sufficient income to her family. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bread, drinks, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 49 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Maria Victoria works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

Maria Victoria has been in this business for 15 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is 65 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Maximina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maximina has been pig fattening for 8 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maximina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell fruit business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional fruits, like jack fruits, mangoes, apples, and oranges, to sell at her buy-and-sell fruits business.

Rosa has been in this business for 30 years, and earns additional income from farming rice.

Rosa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit to sell, like jackfruits, mangoes, apples and oranges.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and a rice barn for her pig fattening business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for seven years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and a rice barn for her pigs

loans.name: Rocela

texts.en:
Rosela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional pork and beef to sell for her butcher shop business. Rosela has been in this business for eight years.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional pork and beef to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Araqsya

texts.en:
Araqsya is from Maysiyan village where she lives with her mother-in-law and three children. She works at the local post office. Together with her work, Araqsya also runs a farm. She keeps 2 cows, a pig, chickens and some calves. Araqsya also owns a plot of agricultural land where she cultivates wheat. To tackle financial hardships and gather a good income for her family's daily needs, Araqsya works day and night.
 
She has now applied for this loan to ask for some financial support for her farm. The loan will be used for purchasing seeds, fuel and fertilizer for land cultivation. This will be a big support for Araqsya's farm, and she will be able to enlarge her farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fuel and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Gracious

texts.en: This is 42-year-old Gracious from Harare, the capital of Zimbabwe, which means 'he who does not sleep". She is married with two children, both attending school. Gracious runs a manufacturing business sewing curtains, bedspreads, seat covers and dresses. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges faced are competition in the market and price volatility of materials. Gracious has requested a loan of $500 to buy raw materials for sewing seat covers and bed spreads. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her disposable income. In the future Gracious plans to grow into a large tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for sewing seat covers and bed spreads

loans.name: Dromo Group

texts.en:
These six women are part of the group called Dromo. They have an average age of 35 and an average of three children. They all live in traditional extended families in Teshie, one of the neighborhoods in Accra, Ghana. The women are relatives and neighbors who work together buying and selling jewelry, second hand clothing, soft drinks, fish, firewood and maize. After successfully repaying all previous loans, this is the fourth group loan for the women of the Dromo Group. 

Peace intends to use this loan to buy fresh red fish. She purchases her fish at the fishing port and supplies a diverse clientele of women and men for cash and on credit. Peace hopes to make a good monthly profit, which she will use for expenses related to health, food, clothing and school fees. She will reinvest the remainder in her business. 

They will need a total loan of GHS 4,200

loans.use: to buy fresh red fish from the fishing port

loans.name: Dinesh

texts.en: Dinesh is 36 years old and lives with his wife in his family home. He has been cultivating rice for more than 15 years independently. Previously, he helped his father with rice cultivation. Dinesh inherited a number of plots from his father and grandparents. Through his hard work, he has bought 2 small tractors (and is even saving for building a house). He was stimulated by his friends (Seva clients) to do business with Seva MFI. Dinesh approached Seva MFI for a loan of SRD 10000 to overhaul his tractors. After overhauling, the tractors will be in good condition for at least 5 seasons. This will enable him to save the extra repair costs and delays during the peak season of soil preparation.

loans.use: to overhaul his tractors.

loans.name: Brenda José

texts.es:
Brenda José es una joven de 34 años de edad, casada, madre de un niño en edad escolar, originaria del municipio de El Sauce.
Se desempeña como Secretaria en un colegio de la localidad donde tiene más de diez años de dedicarse a esta actividad la que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y dotar de todo lo necesario a su hijo y a su madre.
Se siente muy agradecida con Dios por ser madre de este pequeño porque es un regalo maravilloso que le ha dado el señor y sueña con ver en el futuro preparado a su hijo como profesional y un hombre de bien.
En este momento Brenda tiene problemas de salud en su columna por lo que necesita hacerse una serie de exámenes por lo que recurrió a Ceprodel para que le financien este crédito con fondos de los inversionistas de Kiva, ya que sabe que es una organización que apoya al más necesitado, con el propósito de comprar medicamentos, realización de exámenes y placas.
Tiene la esperanza en Dios que estas personas de buen corazón apoyen su solicitud y la fe que con este crédito mejorará su salud.
texts.en: Brenda José is a young woman, who is 34 years old. She is married and is the mother a school-age son. She is originally from the municipality of El Sauce. She works as a secretary in a school in her area, which she has done for more than ten years. This has permitted her to support her home every day and provide her son and mother with everything they need. She is very thankful to God for being a mother to her son because he is a marvelous gift, and she dreams of seeing her son become a professional and a good man in the future. At present, Brenda has health problems in her spine, for which she needs to have a series of tests. For this reason, she returned to Ceprodel so that they could finance a loan with funds from Kiva investors, since she knows that it is an organization that supports those in need. With the loan, she will buy medicines and get tests and X-rays. She has hope in God that people with good hearts will support her health and faith that this loan will improve her health.

loans.use: to buy medicines and get tests and X-rays.

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: Noemí de 31 años de edad es separada con 01 hija dependiente. Ella es parte del grupo “Madres Unidas” y está conformado por 07 socios entusiastas y responsables. Noemí se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir hace más de 03 años en la casa de sus padres. Noemí tiene el anhelo de contar son su propio local y crecer en su negocio. El crédito que solicitó es para la compra de telas, hilos y tijeras. El grupo “Madres Unidas” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Noemí es la segunda del lado derecho y lleva en brazo a su bebe.
texts.en:
Noemí, age 31, is separated and has one daughter, who still depends on her. She is part of the “Madres Unidas” group, which is formed by 7 enthusiastic and responsible members. For over 3 years she has worked making clothes at her parents’ house. Noemí dreams of having her own shop, and hopes to keep her business growing. 

The loan she requested is to purchase fabric, thread and scissors. The “Madres Unidas” group is thankful to all the Kiva lenders for the help provided. Noemí is the second one on the right side, and is carrying her daughter.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and scissors.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: Magdalena is married with five children and none of her children goes to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 3.000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from rental houses. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to build more rental rooms. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying the utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 50 years old and from Nyahururu. She is married to Gichohi, who produces some additional income for the family, and they are blessed with two children aged 20 and 16 years old.
