She is a dairy farmer, a business she has been running for the last fifteen years, and to enable her to buy another dairy cow, she has applied for her first loan of KES. 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES. 20,000, and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to buy animal feeds, buy more cows and pay her loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be an established dairy farmer in her region.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a fruit vendor. She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is requesting a new loan in the amount of PHP 15000 to further build her business. She will use her loan funds to buy fruits such as watermelons, mangoes, and oranges, as well as peanuts to offer for sale. 

Marilyn and her husband have five children, and she works hard to support her family.
  
Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so as to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits such as watermelons, mangoes, and oranges, as well as peanuts to offer for sale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Judith works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Judith is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Judith has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 47-years-old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Roselyn has been pig fattening  for 15 years and also earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad is 48 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Soledad has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52-years-old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

Teresita has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, sugar, milk, etc., for her bakery business.

Venus has been in this business for 6 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Venus has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, eggs, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Solita

texts.en:
Solita, age 47, buys and sells dry goods to earn a living. She has operated her business for the past 15 years. She earns an additional income from keeping pigs.

Solita and her husband have five children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Solita has borrowed and repaid 36 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested a new loan in the amount of PHP 30000 through NWTF, which she will use to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to offer for sale.

Her aspiration is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dry goods to offer for sale

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 37-years-old, married and has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Marites is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through selling ready to wear clothing.

With your help, Marites can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman. She has two children, one who attends school and one who is underage. She lives in a rented house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanamkuu has operated a fruits and vegetable stall, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tsitsi

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 34-year-old Tsitsi from Harare. She is married with four children and three are attending school. Tsitsi runs a manufacturing business producing seat covers, bed spreads and curtains. The business has been in operation for 3 years. She says the main challenges faced are competition in the market and source of funds to buy material. Tsitsi has requested a loan of $500 to buy materials and threads for tailoring. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to increase her disposable income. In the future Tsitsi plans to run a large tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy materials and threads for tailoring

loans.name: Maria Audelia

texts.es: María es una mujer de 52 años de edad que se dedica al comercio de frutas como: naranjas, guineos y limones. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante desde hace más de 4 años. Ella es una  mujer emprendedora quien busca las oportunidades del mercado para brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. María desea mejorar sus ingresos percibidos por su negocio de venta de frutas para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para poder proceder a la inversión de más frutas: naranjas, limones, guineos, etc. para cubrir una mayor demanda de mercado y mejorar las ventas y sus ingresos y de esta forma equilibrar su economía con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is a 52-year-old woman, who sales fruits, like: oranges, bananas, and lemons. She has worked as a street vendor for over 4 years. She is an entrepreneur woman, who looks for opportunities in the market to give her family better living conditions. 

María wishes to improve her incomes, and for that she is requesting a loan to FUSAI. She will use it to buy more fruits. This will help her to fulfill market demands, improve her sales and incomes, and have more stable finances. With this she hopes to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits: oranges, lemons, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Dionela

texts.en:
Dionela is 53 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Dionela requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Dionela has been pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Dionela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Juan, es soltero, vive en casa familiar, el negocio que posee es para cubrir sus gastos personales y contribuir un poco con los gastos de su hogar, se dedica a atender su taller mecánico, que con esfuerzos ha equipado lo necesario para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Con el préstamo que está solicitando realizara la compra de pastillas de frenos, aceites, bujías, espejos, focos, entre otros, que le serán de ayuda para cumplir con los trabajos pendientes y mejorar el servicio a sus clientes, espera incrementar sus ganancias y cancelar con puntualidad sus cuotas.
Su sueño es tener un taller con un mejor equipo para realizar su trabajo, mejorar su economía y apoyar a su familia.
texts.en: Juan is single and lives in his own house. His business helps cover his personal expenses and contributes to the household expenses. He oversees his auto repair shop, that, with his efforts, he has equipped with the necessary tools to offer good service to his clients. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy brake pads, oil, spark plugs, mirrors, and light bulbs, among other things that will help him finish his pending work and improve the service he gives his clients. He hopes to increase his earnings and repay his loans. His dream is to have a workshop with the best equipment to do his work, improve his finances, and support his family.

loans.use: to buy brake pads, oil, spark plugs, mirrors, light bulbs, and other things.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
A 600 USD loan is offered to Marciana to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy everyday. She will buy some additional supplies such as hair ties, shoes, toys and socks. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money everyday.

Running a business has made Marciana independent because she can be responsible for herself and also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it offers to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair ties, shoes, toys and socks.

loans.name: Agustinha

texts.en: Agustinha is applying for a loan of 800 USD from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 32 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as beer, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta, oils, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and slippers. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future. Agustinha lives close to the school in her town. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people, including students, come to buy.

loans.use: To buy beer, Coca-cola, Sprite, Sagiko, Fanta, oils, noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, water and slippers

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es:
Alfonso, es una persona que se dedica a la ganadería y agricultura desde su niñez, trabaja todos los días, tiene 37 años de edad, está acompañado, su compañera de vida tiene 32 años, juntos han procreado a dos hijos de 12 y 7 años, con los cuales disfrutan su día a día un ambiente familiar. 
El capital que solicita es para comprar ganado para repasto, con lo que incrementara el que ya tiene y fortalecerá su negocio, en el futuro podrá efectuar ventas de ganado con mejores ganancias.
Su visión es tener un negocio más estable que le siga proporcionando los recursos económicos para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso is a person who makes a living by raising livestock and farming. Since his childhood, he has worked every day. He is 37 years old and is in a relationship. His partner has 32 years old. Together, they have two children who are 7 and 12 years old with whom they enjoy a warm day-to-day environment. 

The loan Alfonso is requesting is to buy cattle for grazing, with which he will increase what he already has and strengthen his business. In the future he will be able to make cattle sales with better profits. His vision is to have a more stable business that continues providing economic resources to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy cattle for grazing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics, threads, needles, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory for his meat products business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Josephine has been in this business for the past three years. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.es:
Blanca, se decidió por un nuevo crédito para realizar la compra de abono, herbicida, pesticidas, semilla de maíz, lo que le facilitará el cultivo de maíz y continuar con la venta de tortillas, ya que de esta forma ella seguirá teniendo los ingresos que necesita para salir a delante.
La inversión anterior le ayudo a preparar la tierra y sembrar sin ningún problema, la cosecha fue abundante y libre de plagas.
texts.en: Blanca decided to take out a new loan to buy fertilizer, weed-killer, pesticides, and corn seeds, which will help her grow corn and continue to sell tortillas. In this way, she will continue having the income she needs to go forward. Her previous investments helped her prepare the land and sow the corn without any problems. The harvest was abundant and free of infestations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed-killer, pesticides, and corn seeds.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 35 years old, she is married and has four children. She is now applying for a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She opened her secondhand store in 2000 with her own working capital of 100 USD. She earns a good income from her business.

She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve shirts and short sleeve shirts. She is a very hardworking woman, and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, long sleeve shirts and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: A Kiva loan will help Myrna continue to be a competitive licensed real estate broker.  She lives in the Sacramento area and understands that in order to be competitive, she needs an online presence.  Zip Reality provides the website she will need to continue the success of her business.  In addition to the website, she will be purchasing a lock box to hold the key of the home she is showing, a copier to scan documents, and the fees associated with being an agent of Zip Reality.

loans.use: To pay for her website. purchase a lock box and a copier and pay agency fees

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lucia works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell herbal medicine business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling coffee. Lucia is borrowing 14,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase stocks of herbal medicine to sell in her buy and sell herbal medicine business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of herbal medicine for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothing.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Chona is thirty six years old and has four children who are in school.

Chona's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted reselling dried fish and is committed to regain what Chona lost. She is taking out a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Chona has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Chona would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Gloria  is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Gloria has been pig fattening for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Lisbeth Laura

texts.en: Lisbeth dreams of becoming a finance expert but without a degree, she knows it may never be possible. Lisbeth is currently attending the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier, working towards her degree in finance. She expects to graduate in March 2016 but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Lisbeth shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Lisbeth plans to purchase her much needed textbooks and school supplies. With the proper books, Lisbeth feels she will be able to study more effectively and earn better grades. With a degree in finance she expects to earn $20 a day. With one older sibling attending college already, Lisbeth is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Becoming a civil engineer is Alberto's dream. Alberto is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés and plans to graduate in December 2015 but without a loan from Vittana, he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. 

With this loan, Alberto plans to pay his tuition while he saves his salary from his part-time job. With a career in civil engineering, he expects to earn $20 a day. 

Alberto's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For his family, finances have always been tight. With one older sibling attending college already, Alberto is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. To help afford his school and living expenses, Alberto currently works as a tailor.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Jhoana Claudia

texts.en: Jhoana dreams of becoming a business administrator. Jhoana is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards her degree. She plans to graduate in December 2016 but without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With this loan, Jhoana plans to purchase her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Jhoana hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. With a career in business administration, she expects to earn $15 a day. With one younger brother, Jhoana hopes to be a role model for her younger sibling by being the first in her family to graduate from a university.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and school supplies

loans.name: Cumbe  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Cumbe está formado por 13 mujeres quienes laboran en diferentes actividades para aportar a la economía de sus hogares, son mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy carismáticas. Viven en la parroquia Cumbe en Cuenca, la misma que se caracteriza por ser de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Carla, está  realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Cumbe, tiene 21 años, es madre soltera  de una niña de 3 años de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte  los gastos de la casa.
Doña Carla pasa en casa realizando los quehaceres, pero para tener su independencia  económica tiene un criadero de pollos, estos animalitos los vende en pie o pelados según les pida sus clientes. Con el crédito va a comprar pollos y alimento para los mismos para crecer en esta actividad económica. Su meta es tener galpones de pollos mucho más grandes para su negocio.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Cumbe” consists of 13 women who work in different businesses in order to support their household incomes. They are determined, hardworking, and charismatic women. The members live in the parish of Cumbe in the city of Cuenca. This area is known for its cold climate. The people raise animals and grow crops. Many of them have migrated in search of better jobs.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Carla. This is the first loan cycle that she is participating in with her friends and fellow group members of the Cumbe Communal Bank. Carla is 21 years old and a single mother of a three-year-old daughter. She does not own a home, so she lives at her parents’ house and shares in the household expenses.

Doña Carla spends her time at home doing chores. In order to generate her own income, she raises chickens. Carla sells these animals live or butchered depending on the requests from her customers. Her loan will be used to buy chickens and feed for these birds so that she can grow her business. Her goal is to have larger chicken coops for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa previously accessed a loan of 15,000 PHP, that she used to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer, needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maria Theresa dreams that her business will continue to flourish and hopes that her grandchildren will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets, and supplies such as seed and fertilizer, needed in her business.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.en: Maritza dreams of becoming a business administrator but without a degree knows it may never be possible. Maritza was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, is concerned about affording her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Chuquisaca. She expects to graduate in June 2014, but without a loan, is unsure how she will be able to graduate. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Maritza shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With two older siblings attending college already, Maritza is unsure how she will be able to finance her graduation on her own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Maritza's father works as a farmer and his salary is the family's primary source of income.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Sergio Gonzalo

texts.en: Sergio has always dreamed of becoming a lawyer. To achieve his goal, Sergio has enrolled in the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier. He expects to graduate in April 2014 but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Sergio shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With a Vittana loan, Sergio plans to use the funds to pay his graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Chuquisaca. With a career in law, he expects to earn $24 a day during his first year. With two younger brothers, Sergio hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from a university. Sergio currently works as a sales representative to help afford his school and living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es: Alcides , un hombre emprendedor , tiene 39 años de edad, es casado y vive con su madre y un hermano actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a una plantación de tiquizque , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad , la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: An entrepreneurial man, Alcides is 39 years old, married, and lives with his mother and brother at the moment.  He requested a loan with the hopes of buying inputs such as fertilizer and fumigants.  Alicdes wants to improve his planting of tiquizque, with the goal of maintaining his crops in good conditions during their development in order to produce a product of better quality.  The only limitation that this gentleman has is the lack of financing in order to continue growing.  As this is the source of income on which they rely on in order to advance, he has requested a loan and it is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He does not register other loans in state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to purchase inputs for a plantation of tiquizque.

location.town: Bello Oriente, Agua Buena, Coto Brus

loans.name: Everth Luis

texts.en: Becoming a dentist is Everth's dream. Everth was accepted into the Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and now, with the chance to achieve his dream, he is concerned about affording his textbooks and materials. With a Vittana loan, Everth plans to purchase his textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Everth hopes to be able to better understand his subjects. With a career in dentistry, he expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. As the youngest, with one older sibling attending college already, Everth is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Everth's father works for the government and his salary is the family's primary source of income. To help afford his school and living expenses, Everth currently works as a dental assistant.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and supplies

loans.name: Numan Elias

texts.es:
Numan, tiene un taller mecánico más equipado gracias al préstamo anterior por que pudo comprar las herramientas que necesitaba para realizar los trabajos que requieren sus clientes
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en la compra de pastillas para frenos, aceites, bujías, focos, baterías, etc., así dará solución de inmediato a los problemas de sus clientes, espera mejorar el servicio, atraer nuevos clientes y mejorar los ingresos.
texts.en: Numan has an auto repair shop that is very well-equipped thanks to the previous loan because he was able to buy the tools he needed for the work his clients need. He is requesting a new loan to invest in the purchase of brake pads, oil, spark plugs, light bulbs, batteries, etc. This will provide an immediate solution to his clients’ problems. He hopes to improve his service, attract new clients, and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy brake pads, oil, spark plugs, light bulbs, batteries, etc.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her 2011 business and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so that she could build a house for her family. With your help, Luzviminda will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.en:
Juan dreams of becoming a finance expert but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Juan is currently attending the Universidad Autonoma Tomas Frias, working towards his degree in finance. He expects to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan, is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He shares that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Juan shares that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With this loan, Juan plans to buy his schoolbooks. Up until now, he has been managing to get by without them but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, he feels he will be able to get better grades. With a degree in finance, he expects to earn $17 a day. 

Unfortunately, Juan's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With six older siblings attending college already, Juan is unsure how he will be able to finance his education on his own without the assistance of a Vittana Loan. Juan's father's salary from his job as an electrician is the family's primary source of income. To help afford his school and living expenses, Juan currently works as a driver.

loans.use: to pay for textbooks and supplies

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en: As a married parent of seven children, Candelaria works hard to support her family. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from her general store.  Candelaria is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Chiharu Hiyashiro

texts.en:
Chiharu dreams of becoming a dentist but without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Chiharu is currently attending the Universidad Amazonica De Pando, working towards her degree in dentistry. She plans to graduate in December 2014 but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

With this loan, Chiharu plans to cover the cost of her graduation fees. Often there are fees for earning your title in dentistry before graduating. With a career in dentistry, she expects to earn $15 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Unfortunately, Chiharu's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With three younger brothers and one younger sister, Chiharu hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from a university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees

loans.name: Mira Luna

texts.en:
Mira Luna is 35 years old and has three children. She is married and all of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mira Luna requested a PHP 32,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mira Luna has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mira Luna would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Yendry

texts.es: Yendry tiene la edad de 23 años, está casada y vive con el esposo  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café . Ella desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Yendry is 23 years old, is married, and lives with her husband. She wants the loan to buy fertilizer and to help her coffee plantation. She wants to give enough support to the crops so that she will be able to have a better yield and, therefore, better earnings. In the future, she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and better financial stability and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a farmer. This is the first loan she has received from Fudecosur. She had not had any previous loans in state banks, but Fudecosur has offered her the loan with more ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 47 years old and married with three children who are in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Imelda has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sugar, soap, shampoo, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Norma Estela

texts.es: Norma de 38 años de edad, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, su negocio lo tienen ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por lo precios accesibles y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposo quien posee un molino y su hija quien le ayuda en la venta de tortillas, Norma esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para poder seguir con la elaboración de dichas tortillas ya que esa es su uncia fuente de trabajo y así poder tener junto con su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Norma, age 38, has worked for several years in the production and selling of tortillas. Her business is located at her place of residence. She has a lot of customers due to her kindness and reasonable prices. With the profits from her sales, she manages to pay for the household expenses. 

She lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. The husband has a mill and her daughter helps her selling tortillas. Norma is asking for this loan to buy quintals of corn and lime powder. This will help her to keep the production of tortillas, since it is her only job, and to be more financially stable.

loans.use: to buy quintals of corn and lime powder.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
This is Carmen, 57, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Efren, a private employee, and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Carmen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan to help her continue the operations of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Carmen dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is 36 years old, and she is happily married to Lino who works as a security guard. God has blessed them with four loving children, and all of them are still studying.  Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other by working for their family.

Jennifer owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community, and the store is connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, an egg and other things. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to make profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Jennifer hopes to expand her business and dreams to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 43 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Evelyn has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock

loans.name: Timotea

texts.en:
Timotea works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of peanuts business in the Philippines.

Timotea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of peanuts to sell.

She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Timotea would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of peanut to sell

loans.name: Kimsrorn

texts.en:
Kimsrorn is 34 years old, married, and has four children who are in school. She permanently lives with her family in Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. Kimsrorn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs at home and helping her husband in fishing activities.  She has been doing this for more than 10 years and is able to earn well for the family.

Kimsrorn is requesting a loan through Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) to buy a fishing boat and a boat motor to support their fishing business. The loan will allow them to continue working with their business and make a consistent income for the family. Her dream is to improve her family-owned businesses and increase the income to satisfy their living needs.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat and a boat motor

loans.name: Sourn

texts.en:
Sourn is 64 years old, married, and has only one child who is a seamstress. Sourn is in an agricultural business, farming rice and raising pigs at home for additional income. She has been working with agriculture for more than 40 years now. Her many years of experience makes her business a success.

As Sourn’s house was built on the low part of the land that suffers from water in the rainy season, she is requesting a loan to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground part of her house. In this way, she will be able to prevent her house from flooding. She is very delighted and grateful for the loan support. In the future, Sourn would like to save enough money to expand her current businesses and increase her productivity in order to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy excavated dirt to refill the ground part of her house.

loans.name: Agapita

texts.en: Agapita is a 58-year-old widow and the mother of five children. She is trying hard to provide for their needs. She works on the farm they own growing and selling vegetables in the market. Through this, she earns a good amount of income to support household expenditures. In order to grow her sales in the near future, she has requested a loan to buy organic fertilizer. In the future she wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jelisa

texts.en:
Jelisa previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles, and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jelisa hopes to have another stall for her business and dreams of having an apartment for additional income. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week.  There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, thread, needles, and other materials

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 36 years now.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos tiene 41 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijas (gemelas) de 10 años de edad. Carlos trabaja en una empresa cercana a su localidad y junto a su esposa quien es pequeña comerciante llevan el sustento a su hogar. Carlos solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda y para construir dos paredes para dividir un cuarto. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, lámina galvanizada y madera.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years old and lives with his wife in a house they own with their two daughters (twins), who are 10 years old. He works in a business nearby in his area and, together with his wife, who is a small businesswoman, supports the household.

Carlos is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the repair of his roof and to build two walls to divide a room. With the sum solicited he will purchase cement, sand, bricks, galvanized sheets and wood.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, bricks, galvanized sheets and wood to build two walls and to repair the roof of his dwelling.

loans.name: Him

texts.en:
Him is 40 years old and a farmer from Prey Kabas district, Takeo province. She is married with three school-going children. To meet the family’s daily needs, Him is dedicated to a farming business, growing rice on a few pieces of farmland both for sales and sustenance. She has been doing this for more than 20 years. Farming is the sole source of her income. She is photographed with her husband in the photo.

Recently Him has applied for a loan amounting to $800, which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Him is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Porferia

texts.en:
Porferia is 54 years old, married and has eight children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Porferia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and rice barns.

Porferia has been raising pigs for 6 years and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Porferia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and rice barns

loans.name: Alda

texts.en: Alda is taking a loan of 600 USD to improve her business. She is running a secondhand store that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 600 USD. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
Amabel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a flower-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell for her flower-vending business.

Amabel has been in this business for 10 years. Amabel earns more income from farming vegetables.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of flowers to sell

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liezl is 35 years old and has five children who are in school.

She has an ice cream making business in the Philippines. Liezl requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, ice cubes, etc.

Liezl has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Liezl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like milk, sugar, ice cubes, etc

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro, aged 41, is an industrious farmer from Prey Kabas district, Takeo province. She is a married woman and is responsible for three children, two of whom are going to school. Saro has been in the farming business for nearly 20 years now. She and her husband grow rice on their farm and they are able to earn a decent income for the family.

Recently Saro applied for a loan that will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Saro is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Emylou

texts.en:
Emylou previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emylou hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth previously accessed a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities of fresh fish to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to pay for fresh fish she needs in her business. The more varieties of fish displayed at her stall, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maribeth dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different kinds of fish to be sold in the market.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 38 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Myrna is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Myrna has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Myrnais is committed to rebuilding, and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, chips, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 44 years old and has five children. Jocelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pig.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, tiene la edad de 55 años, está viuda  y vive con la madre y los hijos actualmente. Ella  quiere comprar  almacigo para la resiembra de su cafetal y también algunos insumos. Ella  cuenta con el terreno y lo que quiere es resembrar las zonas más dañadas para así aumentar la cosecha próxima y crecer como una caficultora de la zona. Ella  pretende con estas mejoras generar mayor producción de café y así también le genere ganancias para seguir adelante con su proyecto y mejorar su bienestar Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old; she is a widow, and currently lives with her mother and children. She wants to buy seedlings for the re-sowing of her coffee plantation, and some other inputs. She already has the land; what she wants is to reseed the most damaged areas to improve the next harvest. This will help her to be a better coffee grower. 

With this upgrade, she expects to improve her coffee production and her well-being, and generate the enough income to continue with her project. This is the first loan she’s requested to FUDECOSUR. She’s never had previous loans with state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted her facilities, and gave her the loan at a low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy inputs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. Mary Jane is married and has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane is borrowing 4,600 PHP (Philippines pesos)  through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Mary Jane is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sonia hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business as well as to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for tailoring materials such as different types of fabric, needles, thread and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Eleazar

texts.en: Eleazar is a man who is trying hard to provide for his family's needs including food, health, clothing and education. He works on his own farm growing and selling banana with the support of his family. Through this, he earns well enough to support his household expenditures. With his income, he was able to sustain the farm and successfully repay his previous loan used for fertilizer. In order to improve his farm in the near future, he has requested a loan to purchase additional  banana seedlings and to cover replanting costs. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional banana seedlings and to cover replanting costs.

loans.name: Nubia Del Carmen

texts.es: Nubia de 36 años de edad vive con su hija, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace varios años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Nubia solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: 36-year-old Nubia lives with her daughter. She has a business she has been running from home for several years: a beauty salon. She works from 9am to 7pm. She has a lot of clients because she works very well. With her profits, and with the help of her husband, she manages to settle the household expenses. Nubia is requesting a loan in order to purchase products for her beauty salon, such as creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, and other things she needs so that she can obtain better profits, which will help her to have greater financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hairpins, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es: Narcisa es una mujer creativa, que tiene 45 años de edad y juntamente con su esposo  han luchado para sacar adelante  a sus 4 hijos  los cuales viven con ellos, dos  de sus hijas  se encuentra asistiendo a la universidad. Narcisa comenta que juntamente con su esposo se dedican a trabajar y cuidar su taller y asi cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Lleva ya 20 años dedicada a este negocio y les tiene muy contentos a sus cliente ya que les  da productos de buena calidad y les entrega sus pedidos puntuamente. El crédito que le otorgó Fodemi es para comprar madera y materiales de carpinteria. Ella aspira seguir adelante con su negocio  y cubrir los gastos de estudio para que sus hijos lleguen a sacar una profesión.
texts.en:
Narcisa is a creative woman. She is 45 years old. She and her husband have strived to get ahead in life with their four children, who live with them. Two of her daughters are at university. Narcisa says that she and her husband make a living from their workshop, thereby covering the household expenses. She has been working in this business for twenty years and her clients are very happy because she gives them good-quality products and she fills their orders on time. The loan FODEMI has granted her is for buying wood and carpentry materials.

She hopes to continue with her business and cover her children’s study expenses so that they become professionals.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.en:
Anastacio has been operating a furniture making business for ten years. He earns enough to support his family and he repaid his previous loan. Anastacio used the loan to buy additional wood to use in his business. He joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and to enable him to engage in business activities.

Recently, Anastacio took a new loan to purchase timber used for furniture making. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase timber used for furniture making

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
This is Clara, 65 and resident of Batasan Hills, Quezon City, Philippines. She is a widow, and she has children. She and her children manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Clara operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5 worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling piecemeal. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales everyday.

She is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Clara dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a long life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items available to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Anabel hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have other sources of income. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her inventory.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, fermented fish, chips, etc for her general store business.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 3 years. Ma. Luz earns more income from food vending.

Ma. Luz has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, milk, fermented fish, chips, etc

loans.name: Marime

texts.en:
Marime is 30 years old and married with five children, three of whom are in school. Marime works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase stocks to sell like can goods, chips, spices, soap, coffee, etc.

Marime has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Marime would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks to sell like can goods, chips, spices, soap, coffee, etc

loans.name: Remlani

texts.en:
Remlani works hard to support her family. Remlani is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Remlani requested a PHP 4600 loan through NWTF to purchase of solar lamp.

Remlani has been in this business for 1 year now.

In the future, Remlani would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase of solar lamp

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 23 year old man. He has two children in ages ranging from three years to six years. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorbike. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are loyal customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that during rainy season transport is a challenge. 

Michael will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to repair his motorbike. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a tuk tuk for transport. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy spare parts to repair his motorbike

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 52, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Francisco, a farmer, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to meet their financial expenses.They earn a minimum of PHP 600 per day.

Teresita is a coconut dealer. Most coconuts in the Philippines are sold by street vendors pushing deep wooden carts. The coconuts are served in two ways:  one end of it is cut with a straw in it, to serve as the container itself, or coconuts can be offered where in the juice and the edible part of the coconut are put into a plastic bag with a straw. Regular customers are those who are thirsty and those who want to refresh themselves from the heat of the sun. 
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more coconuts to provide to her customers. 

Teresita hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week  where she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more coconuts needed in her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a teacher and runs a private school. He has been running the school for 16 years now. He is 44 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with 3 children. His spouse also provides additional income. 

Joseph will be using this loan to pay school fees for his child. He will be using the income generated from his business to build more classrooms.

This is Joseph's 3rd loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has paid his previous loans successfully. In future he hopes to be successful in his business and be able to bring up his family well.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her direct selling business. Her loan helped not just in her business, but also in the education of her children. Her income is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Thelma dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  DJIGUIYA est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de YIRICOURA qui est la 2eme debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 300 kg de maïs et 200 kg de mil avec les producteurs de Méridièla. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group consists of five married women who on average are 39 years old with six children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Meridiela.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan was repaid in full.

This group of women sells grain, like Yiricoura who is the second person standing from right to left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 300 kg of corn and 200 kg of millet from producers in Meridiela. She conducts her retail sales at market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 22,000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Kodon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    KODON est constitué de  6 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de AWA qui est la 2ème femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 250 kg de riz avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Kodon group consists of six married women who on average are 37 years old with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Meridiela.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their fifth loan. All four previous loans were repaid in full.

This group of women sells grain like Awa, who is the second person standing from left to right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 250 kg of rice from wholesalers in Meridiela. She conducts her retail sales at market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 22,000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Fassodeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    FASSODEME est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 22 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 2ème prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de YATE qui est la 3ème femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 250 kg de riz avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 12.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Fassodeme group consists of four married women who on average are 22 years old with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Meridiela.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their second loan. The previous loan was repaid in full.

This group of women sells grain like Yate, who is the third person standing from left to right in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 250 kg of rice from wholesalers in Meridiela. She conducts her retail sales at market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 12,000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Marademe Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    MARADEME est constitué de  5 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 11ème prêt. Les 10 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de FANTA qui est la 3ème femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 750 kg de riz avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Marademe group consists of five married women who on average are 35 years old with three children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Meridiela.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their 11th loan. All 10 previous loans were repaid in full.

This group of women sells grain like Fanta, who is the third person standing from right to left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 750 kg of rice from wholesalers in Meridiela. She conducts her retail sales at market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 32,000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
