Le groupe    TIESSIRI est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 3ème prêt. Les 2 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’huile à l’image de YIRITIO qui est la 1ère femme  debout dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 25 litres d’huile avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group consists of four married women who on average are 36 years old with four children. They live in traditional extended families in the village of Meridiela.

They became acquainted through neighborhood ties, friendship and commerce. To strengthen their financial capacity to improve their businesses, they joined the Soro Yiriwaso institution where they are on their third loan. The two previous loans were repaid in full.

This group of women sells culinary oil like Yiritio, who is the first person standing from right to left in the photo. She intends to use her loan to buy 25 liters of culinary oil from wholesalers in Bougouni. She conducts her retail sales at market and at home, for cash and on credit to a mixed clientele.

She expects to attain average monthly profits of 15,000 CFA francs, to be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: buy culinary oil

loans.name: Yeredeme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    YEREDEME est constitué de  7 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 5ème prêt. Les 4 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de SITAN qui est la 1ère femme debout  dans la photo de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, plusieurs qualités de condiments  avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 9.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Yeredeme group is comprised of seven married women. On average, they are 26 years old and have four children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Meridiela. 

They know one another through neighbors, friendship, and business. In order to strengthen their financial capacity and better run their business., they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their fifth loan, and the four previous loans were properly repaid. 

This group of women sells condiments through Sitan, the woman standing at right in the photo. With her loan, she would like to buy many different types of condiments from the wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells at the market and out of her home, for retail and credit, and to a mixed clientele. 

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 9,000 FCFA that she will use to reinvest in the business and reimburse the loan.

loans.use: buy condiments.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is 26 years old, married, and lives in Gaza, with her husband and her three children. She started her beauty salon business in 2010, and she has had a good experience in this field. 

Amal asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy makeup tools for her salon. This will help her to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation. She dreams of expanding her business, and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future. She is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan. 

The one who appears in the photo is her husband Yosri; for cultural reasons she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologizes.

loans.use: to buy makeup tools for her salon. This will help her to improve her job, which will enable her to improve her financial situation.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La señora Paula es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto a su esposo y  sus dos  hijos. Su actividad es la venta de ropa de segunda de forma ambulante, ofreciendo su producto en su comunidad y en lugares cercanos.
Doña Paula necesita el préstamo para la compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc. ya que su clientela se lo solicita y quiere tener variedad de producto para poder ofrecerles más opciones a sus clientes. 
Doña Paula espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a el contara con los productos necesarios e implementara la venta de sandalias para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en el hogar también espera hacer que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia para que cumplan sus metas y sueños.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero del 2014
texts.en:
Paula is a hard-working, responsible person who lives in a community in northern Honduras with her husband and two children. She works as a street vendor selling used clothing in her community and other nearby locations.

Paula is in need of a loan to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. to meet customer demand and to have a variety of products on hand to offer more options to her clients.

Paula hopes the loan will be helpful as it will give her the products she needs.  She also plans to start sellling sandals to cover the needs of her customers and to increase her income to improve her family's quality of life.  Business growth is also a goal so she can continue supporting her family and they can reach their goals and realize their dreams.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - February, 2014.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock, animal feed and bran.

loans.name: Maria Belinda

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto a uno de sus hijos. Su actividad laboral es la venta de joyas de forma ambulante, ofreciendo sus productos en su comunidad y en la ciudad de Santa Cruz.  
Doña María necesita el préstamo para la compra de aretes, pulseras, anillos, etc. para aumentar su inventario de productos ya que su clientela le solicita variedad. Y quiere poder atender  bien a sus clientes.
Doña María espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a el contara con los productos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en el hogar y así lograr que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia para que cumplan sus metas y sueños  y así como el de su hijo de que termine los estudios y se convierta en persona de bien y con mayores oportunidades en el futuro.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero- 2014
texts.en:
María is a hard-working, responsible person who lives in a community in northern Honduras with her children.  She works as a street vendor selling jewelry in her community and in the city of Santa Cruz.

María is in need of a loan to buy earrings, bracelets, rings, etc. to increase her inventory because her customers want more variety and in order to offer better customer service.

María hopes the loan will be of great help because she will be able to have the necessary products on hand to meet customer demand.  She will also earn more income which will improve her family's quality of life; and her business will continue to expand so she can support her family and they can meet their goals and realize their dreams.  Her son will be able to finish his education and become a good citizen and have more opportunities in the future.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - February, 2014

loans.use: To buy earrings, bracelets, rings, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Maria Argentina

texts.es:
María, tiene un hijo de 11 años de edad, vive con dos primas y su hijo, es madre soltera, ella es empleada, desde hace dos años aprendió de sus amistades a elaborar y vender pupusas, lo cual realiza al salir de su trabajo, su horario para atender el negocio es de 4:00 p.m. a 8:00 p.m.
María solicita capital para comprar una mesa térmica, sillas, mesas, bebidas, harina, carnes chicharrón, quesillo, etc., así podrá incorporar la venta de comida, mejorar  la vistosidad del negocio, tener mejores ingresos y continuar con la venta de pupusas.
Su aspiración es tener un negocio con más rentabilidad que le de los recursos económicos para salir adelante junto a su hijo y que esté tenga oportunidad de superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
María has an 11-year-old son and they live with two cousins of hers.  She is a single mother and employed.  Four years ago she learned from friends how to make and sell pupusas (stuffed tortillas).  When she finishes work she sets up her business from 4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to buy a heated server, chairs, tables, drinks, flour, meat, pork cracklings, cheese, etc. so she can sell her food, improve her corporate image, earn more income and continue to sell her products.

Her goal is to have a profitable business in order to have enough resources to support her son so he can get a good education.

loans.use: To buy a heated server, chairs, tables, drinks, flour, meats, pork cracklings, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is forty-four years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Elma works very hard to provide for them.

Elma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Elma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Elma has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Elma is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ándres Avelino

texts.es:
Andrés de 26 años de edad, sus estudios realizados fueron hasta 9 grado, actualmente se encuentra acompañado, tienen un hijo de 4 años de edad aun no asiste a la escuela. Andrés es pescador, su esposa se encarga de los oficios domésticos y a cuidar el niño solo ellos tres viven en la casa.


Él pesca desde hace 15 años, lo aprendió de su padre y de sus hermanos mayores que de igual forma se dedican a la pesca, todos sus ingresos provienen de este rubro. Andrés vive cerca del mar sus jornadas de pesca muchas veces son de todo el día, él posee su propio equipo de pesca.


El dinero lo utilizara, para construir su casa ya tiene una pared comenzada y con el dinero comenzara a construir poco a poco lo demás, lo que comprara será bloques, cemento, hierro, vale mencionar que algunos materiales para la construcción ya los tienen.


Sus planes son terminar de construir su casa para brindarle un buen techo donde vivir a su esposa e hijo,  por que donde actualmente viven las paredes de la casa son de lámina, lo que hace que durante el día la calor sea muy sofocante.
Está comprometido en lograr esta meta y está poniendo su esfuerzo en su trabajo para alcanzarla.
texts.en:
Andrés is 26 years old. He went to school through the 9th grade. Right now, he is married and has a 4 year old who is not in school yet. Andrés is a fisherman and his wife is a homemaker and cares for their only child. The three of them live in their house. 

He has fished for 15 years. He learned it from his father and his older brothers who also fish. All of his income comes from this work. Andrés lives close to the ocean. His fishing trips are mostly during the day and he has his own equipment. 

He will use the money to build his house. It already has a wall started and with the money he will start to build the rest of it little by little. With it, he will buy blocks, cement, and iron rods. It is worth mentioning that they already have some of the construction materials. 

His plans are to finish his house and provide a good home for his wife and son to live in. Where they live now has laminated sheeting for walls, and it makes the heat of the day become suffocating.  

He is committed to achieving this goal and he is putting his efforts into achieving it.

loans.use: to buy blocks, cement, and iron rods. It is worth mentioning that he already has some of the construction materials.

loans.name: Nidia Maria

texts.es:
Nidia, ella quiere estudiar administración en salud, porque le gusta esta carrera y así complementar lo que ya estudio, auxiliar de enfermería. 
Nidia  quiere contribuir con el desarrollo social del país, ayudando a mejorar la calidad de todos los  usuarios de los servicios de salud.
Nidia sabe que es muy importante saber de todo un poco y nunca es tarde para seguir estudiando, si tiene la oportunidad debe aprovecharla para superarse cada día mas.
Dentro de los objetivos a corto plazo esta el convertirse en una profesional en el área relacionada con la salud, el subsidio con kiva le serviría ya que ella puede escalar un poco mas en la carrera a futuro que tenga, con el dinero que ella se puede economizar al hacer los pagos con el valor de kiva puede invertir en los gastos extras que este mismo le genere.
texts.en:
Nidia wants to study health administration. She likes that field and she wants to supplement what she already studied, which as assistant nursing. 

Nidia wants to contribute to the social development of the country, helping to improve the quality for all of the users of health care services. Nidia knows that it is very important to know a little bit about everything and she is never late to studying. If she has an opportunity, she has to use it to get ahead more every day. One of her short term goals is to become a professional in the health care sector. The subsidy with Kiva will serve her to advance a little more in her future major. The money she saves by economizing with Kiva can be invested in the expenses generated by her studies.

loans.use: to pay for a semester's enrollment.

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, está casada, es madre de 3 hijas ya mayores de edad, solo una hija  vive con ella es quien la ayuda con el trabajo de la casa y el negocio


María tiene una pupusería tiene más de 8 años de realizar esta actividad, esta labor lo aprendió desde  que estaba muy pequeña, es el cual le ha permitido sacar su familia adelante el negocio está a 2 minutos de su casa sobre la calle principal de su comunidad, como mencionaba es una hija quien le ayuda a realizar esta actividad.


El dinero lo utilizara para comprar una plancha donde cocinar las pupusas.  Debido a que la que tiene esta muy dañada y es necesario sustituirla para brindar un mejor servicio de calidad. La necesidad que cubrirá es de inversión para mejor su pupusería.


Los planes de ella es continuar creciendo en el negocio y seguir siendo la preferida por sus clientes para seguir así ella esta consiente de brindarle un servicio de calidad a sus clientes y con esto atraer nuevos clientes.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. She is married and the mother of 3 daughters. Only one daughter lives with her and helps in the housework and the business. 

María has had a pupusería for 8 years. She learned this work from the time she was very young. It has been what has allowed her to get her family ahead. The business is 2 minutes away from her house on a main street in her community. As mentioned, a daughter helps her with this activity. 

She will use the money to buy a press to cook the pupusas. The one she has is very damaged and she needs to change it to offer a quality service. She needs this investment to improve his pupusería.

Her plans are to continue growing in the business and keep being preferred by her customers so she can keep offering them a quality service and thus attract new customers.

loans.use: to buy a press to cook pupusas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and other products such as rice, eggs, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Bourama

texts.fr:
Mr Bourama  est âgé de 51 ans, marié à deux  épouses père de 13 enfants, il vit dans une famille polygame à Sincina. Depuis plus de 10 ans Mr Bourama exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat, Stock et vente de Bois de construction dans la ville de Koutiala. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car il reçoit beaucoup de clients. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Bourama a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat Bois de construction. Il s’approvisionne à Bougouni et effectue sa vente à Koutiala à une clientèle composée de d’hommes en général, au comptant. 
Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, monsieur compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement des intérêts  de Soro, satisfaire les  besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: Mr Bourama is 51 years old, married to two women and the father of 13 children. He lives in a polygamous family in Sincina. For the past 10 years, Mr Bourama has been involved in the commercial activity of buying and selling wood for construction in the city of Koutiala. This business provides him with enough revenue, and he is known for this activity and has a number of clients. In order to better serve his clients and increase his activity, he is asking the microfinance instititution Soro Yiriwaso for his first loan. This loan will be used to purchase additional construction materials. He stocks up on wood in Bougouni et sells in Koutiala to a client base composed mostly of men. With the increase of his activity, Mr Bourama hopes to earn a monthly profit of 70 000 FCFA, which he plans to use to remiburse the interest on the loan, to take care of his family needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: purchase wood for construction

loans.name: Zoumana

texts.fr:
Mr Zoumana  est âgé de 43 ans, marié à 1 épouse et père de 3 enfants. Il vit à Koutiala ville.
Depuis plus de 15ans Mr Zoumana exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente de divers (Sucre, Lait, Thé, Céréales,…) dans sa boutique dans la ville de Koutiala quartier Sogomougou. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, car il reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Zoumana a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, il est à son neuvième prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de Sucre, Lait, Thé, Céréales huile biscuits et pâtes alimentaires. Il s’approvisionne à Koutiala  et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, monsieur compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire les  besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité. 
Il compte sur le financement de Soro  pour élargir son activité dans le futur.
texts.en: Mr Zoumana is 43 years old, married to one woman and the father of three children. He lives in the city of Koutiala. For the past 15 ans, Mr Zoumana has been involved in the commercial activities based on the buying and selling of diverse products (sugar, milk, tea, grains...) in a shop that he runs in the city of Koutiala, neighborhood of Sogomougou. This activity generates enough revenue, as he has a number of clients every day. In order to continue satisfying his clients and increase the level of activity of his business, Mr Zoumana is asking the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for his ninth loan. This loan will be used to purchase additional products, such as sugar, milk, tea, grains, oil, cookies and pasta. He stocks up on products in Koutiala and sells them for cash from his shop to a clientele composed of both women and men. He hopes that the increased level of activity of his business will enable him to earn a monthly profit of 70 000 FCFA, which he plans to use to reimburse the loan, satisfy the needs of his family, and reinvest in his business. He is counting on the financial support from Soro in order to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase diverse articles to sell in his shop

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    YEREDON est constitué de  4 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans e t3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles  élargies dans le village de Méridièla. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur 11ème prêt. Les 10 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  céréales à l’image de GOUGNE qui est la 2ème femme debout  dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 550 kg de riz avec les grossistes  de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle mixte . 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 29.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Yeredon Group is made up of four married women who average 42 years of age and 3 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Méridièla. They got to know each other through bonds of community, friendship, and business. 

To bolster their financial capacity and better do business, they joined Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their eleventh loan. The previous ten were repaid without problems.

This group of women sells cereals, just like Gougne, who is the second woman from the left in the photograph. She intends to use her loan to buy 550 kg of rice from wholesalers in Bougouni.

She sells retail at the market and at her home, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele. She foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 29'000 (ca US$ 60), to be reinvested in her business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy 550 kg of rice

loans.name: Wendinso Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA représente le groupe WENDINSO. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 01 va à l’école et elle a 05personnes en charge.
Mme vend des condiments depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants. Ses clients sont les femmes et les filles.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac d’oignon, 02paniers de tomates fraiche et 01 sac d’ail.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle désir agrandir son commerce  et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata represents Wendinso Group. She's married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 13 years old, the youngest is 2. One of them attends school. She has five dependents.

She's been selling condiments for the past ten years. She gets her supplies in the surroundings villages. Her customers are women and girls.

She wants to buy one sack of onions, two baskets of fresh tomatoes, and one sack of garlic. With her profits, she wishes to expand her business and ensure that her children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy 1 sack of onions, 2 baskets of fresh tomatoes, and 1 sack of garlic

loans.name: Hemenia

texts.en:
Hemenia works hard to support seven children. She is widowed and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 1,800 loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting a solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of an emergency.

Hemenia is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 48-years-old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school.  Melodia works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Melodia has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Melodia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Mme Assitan  est âgée de 56 ans, mariée, mère de 7enfants. Elle vit dans une famille polygame chez son mari dans le quartier Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala. 
Mme Assitan exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat  vente de condiments, d'arachide et de savons depuis plus de 20 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. 
Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Assitan a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son dixième cycle de prêt. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 colis de condiments, 4 sacs d’arachide et 3 sacs de savons de fabrication traditionnelle.
Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et effectue sa vente à la maison et au grand marché à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme Assitan compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire ces  besoins personnels et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs Assitan is 56 years old, married, and the mother of 7 children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband in the Sogomougou neighborhood in the city of Koutiala. For the last 20 years, she has been involved in the purchase and sale of condiments, peanuts and soaps. This activity generates enough revenue, and she has a number of clients every day. In order to better satisfy her clientele and in order to expand her business, Assitan is asking the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for her tenth loan. She plans to use this loan to puchase two boxes of condiments, four bags of peanuts and three bags of soaps made from a traditional manner.
She stocks up on products in Koutiala and sells them from her home as well as in the large market for cash, to a customer base of women. She hopes that the increase in her activity level will enable her to earn monthly profit of 40 000 FCFA, which she will use to reimburse the loan, satisfy her personal needs and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: purchase diverse products

loans.name: Edilberto De Jesús

texts.es: Edilberto es casado y tiene 55 años, hombre trabajador y luchador, desde hace más de 20 años tiene un puesto de legumbres en la plaza de mercado y labora desde muy temprano hasta las 7:00 p.m; con el producto de este trabajo él ha sacado adelante a su familia. Edilberto sueña con tener un negocio más amplio y con más surtido y variedad (frutas, verduras, granos, etc) podrá hacerle frente a la competencia que día a día se presenta en el lugar de trabajo, el crédito que ha solicitado lo utilizará en parte para renovar las licencias requeridas para el funcionamiento del negocio y en segundo lugar comprar surtido (frutas y verduras), así podrá ofrecerle a su clientela productos de calidad frescos y a precios más favorables, también incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia que es por quien se esmera siempre.
texts.en: Edilberto is a 55 years old, hardworking married man.  He has had a vegetable stall for more than 20 years in the plaza market.  He works until 7:00 pm and has supported his family this way.  Edilberto wants to have a larger business with a greater variety (fruits, vegetables, gains, etc.) to be able to confront the daily competition.  He is asking for this loan to renew his business license and also to buy inventory (fruits and vegetables). This way he will be able to offer quality fresh products to his customers at better prices, increase his income, and improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to stock his business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 46 years old, married, and has three children. She describes herself to be focused and determined. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, drinks, shoes, and other household items. Alice also owns a farm where she grows crops to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be bad weather which affects farming. 

Alice requested her first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs for use in her farm. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a buying and selling of juice business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional packs of juices to sell.

Arlyn has been in this business for two years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional packs of juices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cans of solder

loans.name: Quimlie

texts.en:
Quimlie is 29 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. Quimlie requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell.

Quimlie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Quimlie would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 29-year-old married woman. She describes herself as a person who is committed to serving customers. She operates a retail business where she sells jugs, cups, sandals, plates and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy more stock of cups, jugs, plates and other items. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a supermarket. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cups, jugs, plates and other items

loans.name: Amabel

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Amabel works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dressed chicken in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amabel is borrowing 25,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of chicken to sell for her business.

Amabel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of chicken to sell

loans.name: Antoninah

texts.en: Antoninah is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two children, ranging from two years to eight years old. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more tomatoes to sell. Her goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be an independent person. This is her first loan from SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Digna Maribel

texts.es:
Digna, necesita capital para comprar verduras, carnes, pescado, queso, azúcar, sal, bebidas, etc., son ingredientes necesarios para elaborar la variedad de alimentos que ofrece en su comedor.
Con el préstamo anterior mejoro la calidad de productos que ofrecía a sus clientes, sus ventas mejoraron, con los nuevos recursos económicos Digna a cancelado puntualmente sus cuotas y vive en mejores condiciones junto a su familia.
texts.en: Digna is in need of capital to purchase vegetables, meat, fish, cheese, sugar, salt, drinks, etc.  These are necessary ingredients to make the variety of meals that she offers in her restaurant.  With the previous loan, she was able to improve the quality of products that she offeres her customers, and her sales increased.  With her newfound financial resources, Digna has been able to make her loan repayments on time and live with her family in better conditions.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, meats, fish, cheese, sugar, salt, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 47 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, sugar, etc., to sell.

Amelita has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like coffee, milk, sugar, etc., to sell

loans.name: Carina

texts.en: Carina is 41 years old, married, and has six children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Carina is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Carina has been fattening pigs for seven years, and she earns additional income from food-vending. She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 32 years old and married with three children who are in school. Janice works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like biscuits, soft drinks, milk, etc. to sell. Janice has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Janice would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like biscuits, soft drinks, milk, etc.

loans.name: Ami De Jesus Group

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATOU représente le groupe   AMIS DE JESUS. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23ans et le moins âgé a 01an6mois. 05 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du charbon, du bois de chauffe et des pagnes dentelles depuis 16ans. Elle s’approvisionne par livraison à domicile pour le bois, à Léo pour le charbon et au grand marché en ville pour les pagnes. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter 10complets pagnes  et une charrette de bois.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité et épargner. Mme ambitionne  devenir une grande vendeuse en descendant des camions de bois.
texts.en:
Aminatou represents the Amis de Jesus (Friends of Jesus) Group.   She is doing well.  She is married and has six children, the eldest is 23 years old, and the youngest is 18 months old.  Five of her children currently attend school.

Aminatou has been selling charcoal, firewood and lace pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for sixteen years.  The firewood is delivered to her home, she buys the charcoal from the town of Léo and she buys the pagnes from the main market in town.  Her customers are both men and women.  

Aminatou will use her loan to buy ten pagnes and a barrow of wood.  She will reinvest some of her earnings in her business and save the rest.  In the future, she would like to become an important saleswoman by having wood delivered by lorries.

loans.use: to buy 10 pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and a barrow of wood for resale.

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en:
Sreang is 48 years old and a farmer from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a mother of seven children. Cassava is the main source of her income and a paid working job is her additional income for wages.  

Sreang has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven cycles, with a successful repayment and it has improved her lifestyle better than before. Now she is a leader of a group consisting of four female borrowers. Sreang is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while the remaining three borrowers are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sreang will spend her entire loan portion to buy cassava seedlings and to pay for plowing fee. She hopes that she will collect a cassava yield better than last year.

loans.use: To buy cassava seedlings and to pay for plowing fee

loans.name: Aynisa

texts.ru: Айниса 63-летняя жительница района Шахритус. Она вдова и живет вместе с сыном, невесткой и внуком. Ее сын занимается растениеводством. Сама Айниса несмотря на свой пожилой возраст тоже трудится и зарабатывает. Она очень трудолюбивый человек и привыкла зарабатывать на жизнь собственным трудом. У нее сейчас имеется маленький торговый бизнес. Она в течение 5 лет занимается куплей и продажей фруктов на местном рынке. Ей конечно помогает ее сын. Он привозит товар для матери. Сейчас Айниса обратилась за кредитом, чтобы закупить новую партию фруктов. Она с нетерпением ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Aynisa is a 63-year-old resident of the Shahrituz region. She is a widow and lives with her son, daughter-in-law, and grandson. Her son raises crops. Aynisa herself, despite her her advanced age, also works hard and earns a living. She is a very hardworking person and is accustomed to making a living from her own labor.

She now has a small trading business. Over the course of five years, she has been buying and selling fruits at the local market. Of course, her son helps her. He transports goods for his mother. Now, Aynisa requested a loan to purchase a new parcel of fruits. She is looking forward to support.

loans.use: to buy and resell fruits

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Женщина, которая является хранительницей очага своего дома и опорой для своих детей, имеет грандиозную идею, организовать новый бизнес. Она много лет не имела источника дохода. Так как ее муж имеет маленькую зарплату и не в состоянии обеспечить своих детей со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Дети год за годом требуют больше благ, так как они развеваются вместе с развевающимся миром. Она решила организовать бизнес скотоводством, так как она с детства помогала родителям по скотоводству. Она долго искала помощь и наконец, она узнала о курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Теперь она готова начать бизнес, однако она не имеет денег, чтобы купить скот. Скот она будет держать дома, где она имеет большой коровник. Она планирует купить скот, пересматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
This woman, who is the keeper of the heart in her home and the pillar for her children, has the grand idea to organize a new business. For many years, she has not had a source of income. Her husband has a small salary and is not in a position to support the children with all the necessities. Year after year, the children demand more care since they are growing up in a developing world. She decided to organize a business raising livestock, since she has since childhood helped her parents with tending the livestock. She has long wanted help and finally she learned about the course "Bring on Success" organized by the Association of Business Women. She took part in this course and got a lot out of the experience for herself. After completing the course, she received a certificate.

Now, she is ready to begin a business but at the same time does not have money to purchase livestock. She will care for the livestock at her home, where she has a large cowshed. She plans to but livestock, fatten them over several months and to resell them at the local market. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en: Estelita works hard to support her family. Estelita is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Estelita is borrowing PHP 4,600 through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to be able to extend her business hours and operate even after nightfall. Estelita is aware that, by using the solar lamp, she is saving money, helping the environment and reducing the health and accident risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp so she can keep her store open at night.

loans.name: Jose Nelson

texts.es:
José, tiene disponibilidad de continuar trabajando con la institución por la facilidad de pago y además por los buenos resultados que le dio la inversión del crédito anterior pues la cosecha de maíz y frijol fueron muy abundantes, con granos de calidad, sus ingresos son mejores, el estilo de vida familiar han cambiando de manera positiva.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito para realizar la compra de abono, insecticida, plaguicida, ya que son los insumos agrícolas necesarios para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
José is able to continue working with the institution because of the ease of payments and the good results that he received from his previous loan.  His corn and bean harvests were abundant.  With quality grains, his earnings have improved and his family's life style has changed for the better.

He decided to seek a new loan to purchase manure, insecticides and pesticides since they are the necessary agricultural supplies for his next planting.

loans.use: purchase manure, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 14000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and other necessary materials.

Jonalyn has been in this business for 2 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Sokun's Group

texts.en: Sokun is a local villager from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is 37 years old and the mother of three dependent kids. To cover her family’s needs, she sells ice-cream and orange juice for income. Apart from this business, she also works as a chef during wedding ceremonies to earn additional income. She has had this business for ten years, and it has helped her to save about 20,000 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is has had seven loans from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This group is in its second loan cycle. The positive impact of her past loans has enabled her improve her life style. For this cycle, she is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR, and her fellow group member is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she is going to use her entire portion of the loan to buy a cart for transporting hot soya milk for resale. She hopes that her family’s income will increase, and that she will able to send her kids to school.

loans.use: to buy a cart for transporting hot soya milk for sale.

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en: A citizen from Battambang province, Kim is 61 years old and the mother of five children. To feed the family, she raises rainy reason rice on three hectares and dry season rice on one hectare as her primary source of income. Her family also can earn extra income via paid-working jobs, as well. She receives about 33,000 KHR per day from this business that she has had for 17 years. This is not Kim's first loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has wisely utilized her past two loans, which she has repaid with success, to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she is teaming up a group of three to get a new loan. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR, the same amount as of one of her co-borrowers, while the remaining borrower is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. For Kim, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay the water pumping fee for her farmland. She hopes her rice will produce a good crop yield and that her family’s income will increase.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the water pumping fee for her farmland

loans.name: Rokia

texts.fr: Mme Rokia est âgée de 40 ans, mariée, mère de 5 enfants, elle vit dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Kokode la préfecture de Koutiala, région de Sikasso. Mme Rokia exerce les activités commerciales basées sur l’achat et vente de pièces de pagnes wax, bazin, tissus depuis plus de 10 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenu, sa notoriété est bonne car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme a fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso, elle est à son cinquième cycle de prêt. Ce prêt sera utilisé pour l’achat de pièces de Pagnes wax et des rouleaux de  bazin. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et effectue sa vente à la maison et aux différentes foires hebdomadaires des villages  à une clientèle composée de femmes. Avec l’agrandissement de son activité, Mme Rokia compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement de son prêt, satisfaire ses  besoins personnels et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rokia, age 40, is married and the mother of five children. She lives in a polygamous family in Kokode, a neighborhood in Koutiala Prefecture, in Sikasso Region.

For more than ten years, her business has been based on buying and selling lengths of Wax "pagnes" (colorful African cloth), bazin cloth, and fabrics.

This business generates sufficient income, and her reputation is good since she has a large number of customers. To satisfy her clientele and expand her business, she's getting help from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which she is seeking her fifth loan.

This loan will be used to buy lengths of Wax pagnes and rolls of bazin fabric. She gets her supplies in Koutiala and resell at her home and in various weekly village fairs, to a female clientele.

Thanks to her increase in business, she intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 30'000 (ca US$ 60), that she will use to repay the loan and provide for herself. The remainder will be invested in her business.

loans.use: to buy Wax pagnes (colorful African cloth) and bazin fabric

loans.name: Newaongo Group

texts.fr:
Mme MADELEINE  représente le groupe  NEWAONGO. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 14ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Mme est coiffeuse vend des mèches, des pommades  depuis 11ans.  Elle s’approvisionne  au secteur 10. Ses clients sont les femmes et filles.
Mme veut s’acheter  20 paquets de mèches ; 30 boites de pommades pour cheveux. 
Mme veut utiliser ses  bénéfices pour la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne agrandir son hangar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Madeleine represents Newaongo Group. She is well. She's married and the mother of two children. The eldest is 22 years old, the youngest is 14. Both go to school.

Mrs. Madeleine is a hairdresser, and she's been selling hair extensions and balsam for the past eleven years. She gets her supplies in Sector 10. Her customers are women and girls.

She wants to buy 20 packs of hair extensions and 30 boxes of hair balsam. She wants to use her profits to send her children to school. She ambitions to enlarge her hangar.

loans.use: to buy 20 packs of hair extensions and 30 boxes of hair balsam

loans.name: Maria De La Paz

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive con sus dos nietas y su esposo en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, una comunidad al norte de Honduras. Su actividad laboral es la venta de sandalias, en el barrio donde vive y lugares cercanos a su casa de habitación.
Doña María tiene su negocio desde hace más de 5 años y necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de sandalias, zapatos y un fardo de ropa usada, ella quiere poder ofrecerles variedad de productos a sus clientes y espera poder atraer a nuevos clientes a su negocio.
Doña María espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a él contara con los productos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en el hogar y a su vez que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia. Y así poder tener mejores oportunidades en el futuro.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero- 2014
texts.en:
María is a very hardworking and responsible person.  She lives with her two granddaughters and her husband in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, a community in northern Honduras.  She works selling sandals in her neighborhood and in nearby areas.  María has had her business for the past five years, and needs this loan to purchase sandals, shoes and a bundle of used clothing.  She wants to be able to offer her customers a variety of products, and attract new customers to her business.  

María hopes that the loan will be very useful for her as it will allow her to have the needed products to meet her customer's demand.  In so doing, she will be able to increase her earnings and be able to improve her family's quality of life, and continue to grow her business in order to support her family.  This will allow her to have better opportunities in the future.  

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – February- 2014

loans.use: purchase sandals, shoes and bundles of used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr:
Monsieur Lamine est un jeune, qui s’active dans l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Quand il a démarré avec les crédits à l’IMCEC, il avait déjà débuté son activité mais voulait surtout un renforcement de son activité. Il est à son 6ème prêt, qui lui permettra d’acheter deux bœufs, les emboucher puis les revendre. Lamine part dans les marchés hebdomadaires aussi bien quand il a besoin d’acheter, que de revendre ses bœufs. Il est actif toute la journée de 7h du matin à 19h du soir.
Lamine est marié et père de famille ; et grâce aux revenus de l’embouche, il arrive à nourrir sa famille et sa mère dont il a la charge, à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et à épargner un peu d’argent afin de pouvoir construire sa propre maison.
Lamine veut devenir un grand éleveur et possédait un grand troupeau, c’est là son vœu le plus cher.
texts.en:
Lamine is a young man who has been raising livestock for more than ten years.  After starting his business he turned to the field partner, UIMCEC, to help him strengthen his business.  This will be his sixth loan, and will enable him to buy two cows for fattening up for resale.  Lamine buys and sells his cattle at the weekly markets.  He works from seven in the morning until seven in the evening.

Lamine is married and has children.  The income from his livestock business allows him to feed his family and mother (for whom he is financially responsible), pay for the school fees of his children and build up some savings.  He intends to use his savings to build a house for his family.  In the future, Lamine would like to become a big livestock farmer and have an extensive herd, this is his most sincere wish.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar âgé de la cinquantaine, s’active dans le domaine de l’élevage, plus particulièrement l’embouche bovine, activité qu’il fait depuis plus de 10 ans. Il est marié et père de 6 enfants dont les 3 sont scolarisés. Babacar n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit à l’IMCEC et sollicite un montant de deux cents mille francs afin de pouvoir acheter 2 bœufs, les emboucher au but de les revendre. Babacar connait pratiquement beaucoup des commerçants qui sont dans les marchés hebdomadaires, ce qui fait que ses bêtes sont déjà achetées avant d’être à terme, il n’a donc pas un problème d’écoulement. Son seul souci est de trouver assez d’argent pour augmenter la quantité des bœufs. Il s’occupe des animaux lui-même et les amène paitre de 8h jusqu’à 18h de l’après-midi.
Il paie les études de ses enfants avec les bénéfices acquises, améliore les conditions alimentaires de sa famille y compris sa mère qui est aussi à sa charge.
S’il a les moyens, Babacar aimerait avoir beaucoup d’autres bœufs, agrandir son troupeau, pour pouvoir maximiser son profit.
texts.en:
Babacar is in his fifties and has worked raising cattle for more than ten years.  He is married and has six children, three of whom currently attend school.  Babacar has never before had a loan from the field partner,UIMCEC.  He has requested this loan for 200,000 francs CFA in order to buy two cows for fattening up for resale.

Babacar knows many of the traders who attend the weekly markets, so his animals are usually sold in advance, meaning that he has no problems disposing of them.  His only problem is to find enough money to allow him to increase the number of animals that he has.  Babacar takes care of his animals himself, taking them to pasture from eight in the morning until six in the evening.

With the money that he earns, Babacar pays for his children's studies and improves the standard of food available for his family, including his mother, for whom he is financially responsible.

If he had the resources, Babacar would like to expand his herd and have many more cattle, this would maximise his earnings.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening up for resale.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат старательная и предприимчивая женщина родом из района Шахритус. В свои 55 лет она научилась новой для нее профессии - кройке и шитью женских национальных платьев и собирается открыть свое швейное дело. В течение полтора года она была ученицей опытной швеи и изучив все тонкости шитья она теперь может самостоятельно заниматься этим делом. У Саломат сейчас на руках имеется 400 долларов. Она накопила эту сумму за счет своей деятельности по уходу за больными. Однако для купли швейной машинки и тканей ей еще не хватает 2000 долларов США. Саломат обратилась в организацию и просит эту сумму в кредит. Она будет заниматься этим делом у себя дома и уже получила партию заказов. Как только она купит машинку и ткани, она сразу же приступит к работе. Благодаря прибыльному швейному делу жизнь семьи Саломат намного улучшится.
texts.en:
Salomat is a diligent and enterprising woman born in the Shahrituz region. At 55 years old, she has learned a new profession - cutting and sewing women's national dresses and is going to open her own sewing business. Over the course of a year and a half she was a pupil of an experienced seamstress and learned all the intricacies of sewing, she now is able to engage in this kind of work on her own. Salomat how has in hand US$400. She saved this amount from her activities for the purpose of caring for the sick. However, she still lacks US$2,000 to purchase a sewing machine and fabrics. Salomat applied to the organization and is requesting this sum as a loan. She will engage in this work from her home and already received a set of orders. As soon as she buys a machine and fabrics, she will immediately start her work.

Thanks to the profitable sewing business, the life of Salomat's family will be much improved.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and fabric for starting a new sewing business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Juliet works hard to support her family. She has a direct selling ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Juliet is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase additional stock for her ready-to-wear business, like shorts, shirts, and other products.

Juliet has been sustaining her business activities through her four previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like shorts and shirts

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline is 25 years old, married, and has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business selling curtains, which she has been doing for two years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. 

Maryline requested her first loan from SMEP DTM for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of curtains to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of curtains

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: Muhammad appreciates the the support from Yehu and Kiva at large. The previous loans have helped him to boost his business. Here again he comes to you requesting for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy roofing materials, iron sheets and labor charges for his house at home.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials, iron sheets and labor charges for his house.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
Phally is a villager from Battambang province, and a mother of three kids. Presently, two of her children rely on her; one is in school and another one is under-aged for schooling. To support the family, she does rice farming as the main source of income. She has been with this business for twenty years, and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day.

This is not the first cycle for Phally with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed to use her past loans in a smart way, to improve her livelihood. Including this new loan, it is the seventh loan cycle for Phally and the sixth for her other group member. Both of them are requesting the same loan amount, 1,400,000 KHR each. Phally will spend her entire loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income and do better than last year.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Fayzimo

texts.ru: Файзимо 52-летняя сельская женщина. У нее большая семья. Файзимо живет в районе Фархор с мужем и девятью детьми. Она мать четверых сыновей и пятерых дочерей. Все ее дети уже взрослые. Файзимо и ее семья занимаются земледелием. У них имеется 2 га орошаемого участка земли. В данный момент Файзимо и ее муж решили параллельно начать бизнес по откорму и продаже скота, чтобы увеличить бюджет семьи. Для ведения этого бизнеса у них во дворе дома имеется коровник, а корм для скота они будут брать со своих земельных участков. Файзимо просит кредит, чтобы закупить несколько голов бычков. Данный кредит поможет обеспечить семью дополнительным источником дохода.
texts.en:
Fayzimo is a 52-year-old rural woman. She has a large family. Fayzimo lives in the Farkhor region with her husband and nine children. She is the mother of four sons and five daughters. All her children are already grown.

Fayzimo and her family are engaged in agriculture. They have two hectares of irrigated land. Currently, Fayzimo and her husband decided in parallel to start a business in fattening and selling cattle, in order to increase the family budget. For running this business, they have in their yard a cowshed and feed for the cattle will come from their plot of land.

Fayzimo is requesting a loan, in order to purchase several heads of steer. The loan will help to support the family with an additional source of income.

loans.use: to buy and sell several heads of steer, in order to support her family with an additional source of income

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una máquina de coser donde se dedica a la costura y reparación de prendas de vestir, desde hace 14 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de cemento y arena para el arreglo de una pared de su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar seguro donde residir.
texts.en:
Marleny is 43 years old.  She lives with her husband and son in Oyotún, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, commerce and cattle.  It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast.  She has a sewing machine that she has used for sewing and repairing clothing for the past 14 years.  Her business is located in her home.

She has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase cement and sand to fix a wall in her home, giving her a more secure place to live.

loans.use: purchase cement and sand to repair a wall in her home.

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun, age 40, is a local villager from Moung Russey district, of Battambang province. She is a mother of two, but only one is under her responsibility, as this son is in school. To strive for a living, she grows paddy rice as the main source of income. She is also a vendor in the village, to supplement her income.

In this group of four borrowers, she is the leader with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and two other borrowers are in their fifth loan cycle, whereas the remaining borrower is in her seventh cycle. Each of them, including Sarun, is seeking the same loan amount of 1,400,000 KHR. Sarun will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 65 years old and married, and she has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 13 years, and she earns additional income from fattening pigs.

Lourdes requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like soap, shampoo, and soft drinks. She has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF, before this loan. Lourdes aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell at her store, like soap, shampoo, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The loan will be invested in purchasing seeds and manure for reseeding.

loans.name: Saisii

texts.en:
Saisii is 29 years old and married, and she has three children. She runs a small business selling fish, crabs, and octopus, to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years.

Saisii is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. Saisii will use part of the loan to buy cement, sand, and iron roofing, and part of her loan to buy a new canoe, spears and goggles. Saisii joined SPBD in 2007, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new canoe, spears, goggles, cement, sand, and iron roofing

loans.name: Munovara

texts.ru: Муноваре 36 лет. Она уроженка района Кубадиен. Муновара замужем. Она давно хотела начать свой бизнес, найти дополнительный источник дохода и помочь мужу обеспечить дом, очаг. Муновара решилась обратиться за кредитом, с надежной на поддержку для обоснования нового бизнеса, что дает ее семье новые экономические возможности. На сумму кредита Муновара собирается купить скотов и выращивать их в коровнике рядом с домом. На сегодняшний день у нее есть корова и два козла. Она считает, что у нее есть достаточный опыт работы в этой сфере деятельности,чтобы начать новый бизнес. Помогите осуществить ее планы.
texts.en: Munovara is 36 years old. She is a native of the Kubadiyon region. Munovara is married. She has long wanted to start her own business, to find an additional source of income and to help her husband to support the home and hearth. Munovara decided to apply for a loan with reliable support to justify a new business, that gives her family new economic opportunities. With the loan amount, Munovara intends to purchase cattle and raise them in a cowshed near her home. Currently, she has a cow and two goats. She considers that she has sufficient work experience in this sphere of activity to start a new business. She wants help to realize her plans.

loans.use: to open a business in the area of animal husbandry and buying livestock

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Madame Anna, fait parti des plus anciens sociétaires du guichet. Elle s’active dans l’élevage de poulets de chair, mais aussi la vente de tissus teints. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 6 ans dans ce domaine. Anna est mariée, et mère de 4 enfants dont l’ainée, une fille de 23 ans et le cadet, une fille aussi, âgée de 15 ans. 
Madame Anna vient pour la cinquième fois, solliciter un crédit de 600 000F CF A afin d’acheter 250 poussins, pour les élever et les revendre. Elle est active de 8h du matin, jusqu’à 18h de l’après-midi. Elle va aussi profiter d’un pèlerinage qui verra des vendeurs de tissus teints pour acheter en gros et revendre.
Elle appuie son mari dans la gestion de la maison en donnant une participation volontaire pour l’éducation et l’entretien des enfants.
Elle épargne, en achetant des bijoux en or, pour les garder en cas de besoin urgent.
Anna rêve de construire sa propre maison avec les bénéfices de son activité.
texts.en:
Anna is one of the longest-standing clients of the field partner.  She raises broiler chickens, and also sells printed fabric, and has more than six years' experience.  

Anna is married and has four children, the eldest is a 23-year-old girl and the middle child is a 15-year-old girl.  This will be the fifth loan for Anna, she has requested 600,000 francs CFA in order to buy 250 chicks for raising and resale.  She will also travel to buy printed fabric in bulk, which she will then sell.  She works from eight in the morning until six in the evening.

Anna helps her husband by willingly contributing to the education and care of their children.  She saves her money in the form of gold jewellery which she resells in case of urgent need.

Anna dreams of building her own house with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks for raising and resale.

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be successful. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, maize flour, sweets and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of sweets, bread, sugar and other items. She also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sweets, bread, sugar and other items to sell

loans.name: Fayziniso

texts.ru: Файзинисо является одним из таких личностей, которая старается улучшить условия жизни и стимулировать экономическое состояние семьи. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Она 6 месяцев назад начала свой бизнес скотоводством. Файзинисо теперь хочет расширить свой новый бизнес. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может развевать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 Сомони для покупки скота. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своего ребенка с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Fayziniso is a person who tries to improve her family’s life conditions and promote its economic well-being. She is a widow and has one dependent child. Six month ago she launched a livestock business. Now she would like to expand her new business. With this goal she has completed a Reach for Success course organized by the  Association of Business Women. Now she has an opportunity to develop her business and become successful. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000 TJS to buy livestock. She plans to use the resulting income to provide her child with a good education and   nutritious food products. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her new business.

loans.name: Maria Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora María es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive con su esposo en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, una comunidad al norte de Honduras. Su actividad laboral es la venta de tortillas de maíz, en el barrio donde vive y lugares cercanos a su casa de habitación.
Doña María sus tortillas son muy apetecidas ya que es una persona muy aseada y cuidadosa con la elaboración de su producto, necesita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de papas, yuca, patastes, plátanos, cebollas, chiles, etc. ya quiere emprender en este negocio ya que ella y sus vecinos no cuentan con un puesto de verduras cercano y tiene una galerita en donde piensa colocar la venta de verduras.
Doña María espera poder atraer a nuevos clientes con este negocio, espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a el contara con los productos necesarios para cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes. Y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia en el hogar, espera  que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera apoyar a su familia. 


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero- 2014
texts.en:
María is a very hard-working and responsable person. She lives with her husband in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, a community in the north of Honduras. She sells corn tortillas in her neighbourhood and in areas close to her home.
Maria's tortillas are very appetizing because she values care and cleanliness in her cooking process. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of potatoes, yucca, bananas, onions, chillies, etc because she wants to start this business. She and her neighbours do not have a vegetable stall close by, and she has a display area where she plans to sell vegetables.
Maria hopes to be able to attract new clients with this business. She hopes that her loan will be useful. Thanks to this loan, she will have the products necessary to cover her clients' needs. She will be able to obtain more income which will improve the quality of life of her family. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and support her family.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero- 2014

loans.use: to purchase potato, yucca, pataste, bananas, onion, chillies, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 46 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cañaris una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercio de ganado caprino, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, el comercio lo realiza en los caseríos aledaños a su distrito, Manuel ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de ganado menor para posteriormente engordarlo y ofrecerlo a sus clientes a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 46 and lives with his wife and children in the Cañaris district, a community with green landscapes. The people work in agriculture, commerce, and livestock.   Cañaris is located in the province of Chiclayo, belonging to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.
Manuel raises and sells goats, and has been doing this for ten years. He sells in the nearby hamlets of his district. Manuel has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Alternativa for the purchase of small livestock in order to fatten them and re-sell them to his clients at a better price.

loans.use: to buy small livestock to fatten and then re-sell at a higher price.

loans.name: Nezel

texts.en:
Nezel is twenty-six years old and married with two children who are in school. Nezel works very hard to provide for them.

Nezel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, coffee and sugar to sell. Nezel has been in this business for five years.

In the future, Nezel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soft drinks, coffee and sugar to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old, with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for herself and her child, running a business selling firewood, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional firewood to sell. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Melva requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of soap, shampoo and biscuits to sell.

Melva has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of soap, shampoo and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Nema

texts.en:
Nema is married and has ten children.

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nema requested a loan of PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Nema has been pig fattening for twelve years now. She has borrowed fifteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nema would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sausage-making machine

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en:
Sakhorn is from Moung Russey district, in Battambang province. She is 50 years old and a mother of five children, two of whom still rely on her. One is in school, and one is too young for schooling. Her entire household depends solely on agribusiness, specifically rice-growing and pig-raising. She has been occupied in this work for more than 10 years, and currently it returns her about 42,000 KHR per day.

Since joining with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Sakhorn has managed to upgrade her living conditions, and she has repaid her past loan with success. She and her fellow borrowers are each seeking the same loan amount, 1,400,000 KHR apiece. Sakhorn will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and seed for her farmland. She hopes that her business will improve and enable her to support the family, on time.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and seed for her farmland

loans.name: Fiapito

texts.en:
Fiapito is 42 years old and married, and she has eight children. She runs a small business, selling fish, crabs, and octopus in her community. She has been doing this work for three years.

Fiapito has requested a loan, which she will use to buy a canoe, fishing torch, spears, other fishing gear, and goggles. She joined SPBD in 2006, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fiapito will provide for her family financially.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear, including a canoe, fishing torch, and spears

loans.name: Bun Lestari Group

texts.en:
The group paid off all the previous loan on time. They sold the pigs with a good price. Now, the price for pork is about 25,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) per kilogram. Ni Wayan, the head of the group, maintained four superior pigs and all sold. She gained a profit of 2,000,000 IDR for all. She’s really grateful for that. She has a plan to use the profit to renovate her kitchen and for savings. During the last loan period, she didn't have a problem. All the pigs grew well. She said thanks to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.

The Bun Lestari group is a group of women in the village who have the same effort: pig farming. They are joined in groups to get funding and training from MUK.

Ni Wayan is married with one child still in elementary school. Ni Wayan is using a loan to buy four piglets that will be maintained for five months for fattening. The remainder of the loan will be used to buy pig feed.

Ni Wayan spends 5,000 IDR for the kitchen per day and 100,000 IDR to pay for electricity and water per month. Although her business is still small, Ni Wayan hopes this business can support her child's education to buy books and for other school purposes, beside the kitchen needs.

loans.use: to buy four piglets for fattening, and feed

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Dewi lives in Baturiti village where most of the population work as a fruit and vegetable growers. As a newcomer from Java, Dewi does not have a piece of land, but she opened a diner business by renting a house. Due to excellent cuisine, Dewi often got food orders for weddings. 

Currently, Dewi needs a loan for working capital to buy groceries to serve orders in large numbers. She will use the loan to buy vegetables, seasoning, catering equipment, and fruit, and she will pay workers. 

Her husband helped her in serving customers. Dewi has a child who is still in high school. She hopes that her business will grow, that she is well-known to many people, and that she brings prosperity to families and creates jobs for others.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, seasoning, catering equipment, and fruit and to pay workers.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as being stable and vision-oriented. 

She operates a retail business where she sells utensils. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a place with many customers and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes.
