Jeniffer will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stocks of plates, cooking pans, and other utensils. Her business goal is to have a big store within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a stable life. 

This is Jeniffer's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). She also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of plates, cooking pans, and other utensils.

loans.name: Eber

texts.es:
Eber tiene 27 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 8 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas y pago de mano de obra a jornaleros para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz.
texts.en:
Eber is 27 years old. He lives together with his wife and children in the Querocotillo district of Cutervo Province which belongs to Cajamarca Region in the North Andes of Peru. The people here works in farming, commerce and raising livestock. 

Eber is a farmer who specializes in growing corn. He has been doing this for 8 years, His wife helps him with this work. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy seeds and pay for day labor to maintain his corn crops.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay day labor to maintain his corn crops.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose works hard to support her family. Rose is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rose requested a 29,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, sugar, etc., to sell.

Rose has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Rose would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like sardines, soft drinks, sugar, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing through NWTF to buy additional stock like sardines, noodles, eggs, sugar, soap, chips, etc., for her general store business.

Yolanda has been in this business for three years. Yolanda earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Yolanda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like sardines, noodles, eggs, sugar, soap, chips, etc.

loans.name: Aparicio Sanchez

texts.es:
Aparicio,  es padre de tres hijos de 14, 17 y 22 años de edad, actualmente viven con su esposa y sus hijos, desde hace ya 30 años se dedica a la siembra y venta de granos básicos como frijol, maíz y café, también ejerce los conocimientos de albañilería, esto lo aprendió de su padre.
Necesita invertir en el negocio por lo que está solicitando un  crédito que utilizara en la compra de maíz y frijol por mayor, el resto lo invertirá en dar mantenimiento a la finca de café que posee el cual consiste en podarla, abonarla y aplicación de fertilizantes para evitar las plagas, será de gran ayuda para que su negocio se vea fortalecido y tenga mayor rentabilidad.
Su aspiración es que negocio continúe creciendo y dándole los recursos económicos necesarios para cubrir sus gastos familiares y cancelar la deuda adquirida.
texts.en:
Aparicio is the father of 3 children ages 14, 17, and 22. Today he lives with his wife and their children. He has been in the cultivation and sale of basic grains like beans, corn, and coffee for 30 years. He also exercises his knowledge of masonry, which he learned from his father.
He needs to invest in the business for which he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy corn and beans wholesale. He will invest the rest in doing maintenance on the coffee farm that he owns, which consists of pruning and fertilizing it and the application of fertilizer to get rid of pests. It will be a great help so that his business will be strengthened and have higher returns.
His aspiration is that his business will continue growing and giving him the economic resources necessary to cover the family expenses and cancel the acquired debt.

loans.use: to buy corn and beans wholesale and do maintenance on the coffee farm.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is married and has four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Mary Ann is 37 years old, and all four of her children are in school. She has a business in the Philippines, buying and selling dressed chickens. She has been in this business for two years.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it to purchase additional boxes of dressed chickens to sell.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dressed chickens to sell

loans.name: Alejandra Isabel

texts.es: Alejandra tiene 20 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Soltera, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Su meta próxima es estudiar un curso de computación. Solicita el crédito para pagar su curso de titulación con el cual estaría finalizando la carrera. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para obtener el título y crecer profesionalmente. Su plan futuro es conseguir un empleo como visitadora médica, y obtener su carro.
texts.en: Alejandra is 20 and from the city of Managua. She is single and studies at one of the universities in the city. Her next goal is to study computing. She is requesting this loan to pay her tuition; this will complete her degree. She thinks that this loan will be a great help to her in getting her degree and growing professionally. Her plan for the future is to get a job as a medical inspector and to get a car.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Sri lives west of Bandung, about three hours from Jakarta. Sri manages a small shop selling snacks  and mobile phone airtime credit.  She is married and lives with three persons in the family home.

Sri  joined Ruma one month ago because she finds it interesting selling mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Sri is seeing improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she has earned an average of $11-12 per day  in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions.  Her goal for her business is to expand and do more new business in the future.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and service bill payments on weekends.

loans.name: Fesuluai

texts.en:
Fesuluai is 48 years old and married with eight children. She has a small business of selling fish in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy fishing net, spears and a new canoe, and some will be used for school fees.

In the future, Fesuluai hopes to use her business profit for her family and business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, spears and a new canoe, and pay school fees

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en: Temukisa is a 70-year-old widow  with two children. She runs a small new business selling snacks and finger food in her community. Temukisa has requested a loan to buy a sack of flour, chicken, sausage, snacks, oil, a frying pan and a gas oven to help her increase the quality of her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 for the financial needs of her new business. With her earnings, Temukisa will help her family in every need.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, chicken, sausage, snacks, oil, a frying pan and a gas oven

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 25-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

Pamela will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to open a big store to sell fish within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Alipio

texts.en:
Alipio, 56 years old, lives with his children and operates a fruit production business for a living. He specializes in mangoes and bananas. He has been  running the business for 15 years. His wife has a sari sari store, earning better income to cover family expenditures.

Alipio is requesting a loan to buy organic pesticides  so that he can boost his fruits to harvest more. He saves his revenue for the  education of his children,  for he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticides

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Nilda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like noodles, sardines, sugar, etc. to sell.

Nilda has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like noodles, sardines, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and married, and she has five children in school. Mercy works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business, buying and selling native products in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 26 years.

Mercy has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase additional native products to sell.

In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional native products to sell

loans.name: Pablo Pastor

texts.es:
Pablo Pastor tiene 40 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El tiene un pequeño taller donde repara motos desde hace 6 años, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos y accesorios para motos y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo Pastor is 40 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Morropon district, in the province of the same name which belongs to the Piura Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work in agriculture, commerce and raise livestock.

Pablo has had a small shop where he has repaired motorcycles for the past 6 years. He has a large clientele. He is requesting a loan of 2,000 PEN to buy parts and accessories for motorcycles so he can offer them to his customers and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts and accessories for motorcycles to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is thirty-nine years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school, Pinky works very hard to provide for them.

Pinky's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Pinky has restarted her buy-and-sell business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Pinky has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Pinky is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Fanta

texts.fr:
Madame Fanta, une femme de la quarantaine, est très active et évolue dans le commerce de légumes depuis en fait 1996, qu’elle a démarré son activité. Elle achète la marchandise, dans un village situé à environ 60 kilomètres de la ville principale. Étant donné que les légumes sont vendus à un prix abordable, elle préfère se ravitailler là –bas pour avoir une marge bénéficiaire plus importante. Fanta achète en gros, par sacs, et vient revendre aux détaillants des petits étalages des marchés. Elle se lève à 5h du matin pour livrer la marchandise, jusqu’à 10h, elle a terminé. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit à l’IMCEC et le renouvellement lui permettra d’acheter 4sacs de choux, 5 sacs de carottes, 2 sacs d’aubergines douces et amères.
Fanta est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l’ainé a 20 ans et le cadet, 2 ans. Elle participe dans la gestion du foyer, en s’occupant de la scolarité de ses enfants, de leur habillement et de leurs besoins au quotidien.
Grâce au crédit, elle peut augmenter la quantité de sa marchandise, et les bénéfices lui permettront de réaliser son souhait de terminer la construction de sa maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fanta, a woman in her forties, is very active. She has been selling vegetables since 1996, when she first got started. She buys her good in a village about 60 km [37 miles] from the main town. Given that vegetables are sold at an affordable price [in the countryside], she prefers to restock there in order to increase her profit margin. Fanta buys wholesale, by bags, and resells to retailers who have small stands at the markets. She rises at 5 AM to deliver her merchandise and finishes at 10 AM. She already obtained a loan from IMCEC in the past. This new loan will allow her to buy four bags of cabbage, five bags of carrots, and two bags of sweet and bitter aubergines/eggplant. 

Fanta is married and has six children, the eldest of whom is 20 years old and the youngest two years old. She  contributes to the household budget by taking care of her children’s school expenses, clothing and everyday needs. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to increase her stock. The revenue will allow her to realize her wish to complete the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy four bags of cabbage, five bags of carrots, and two bags of sweet and bitter eggplant.

loans.name: Mshikamano Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Lucy, who is in her early 30s, is married and has one kid. For four years now, Lucy has had a stationary business. She starts her business from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is Lucy's third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use it to buy new stationary products to resell. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, she restocked her business with new items like envelopes, printing papers, pens, pencils, books and cards of different functions. Lucy received an extra income, which she partly used to cover home expenses and saved the rest. Lucy dreams to make her business bigger. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Mshikamano Tegeta," which consist of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new stationary products to resell.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es: luis de 30 años de edad vive en casa propia con su familia conformado por su esposa y sus hijos, el se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, también vende de formas ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Luis esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos y ropa por mayor para poder surtir con mas mercadería su negocio y así poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is 30 years old. He lives in his own house with his family which consists of his wife and his children. He sells shoes and clothing from a shop which is located in his home. He also sells them in the streets in the different neighborhoods around his residence. With what he makes he manages to pay some of the household expenses. Luis is requesting a loan to buy shoes and clothing wholesale to stock his business with more merchandise. Then he can generate more profit and provide his family with a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Rechelle

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rechelle works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Rechelle is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Rechelle has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Gamaniel Alberto

texts.es:
Gamaniel Alberto tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la decoración de eventos sociales como cumpleaños, matrimonios, promociones y otros además de confección de material de ternopol, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, conocido en su zona por su magnífico arte de decoración.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de colores de telas para sus decoraciones y de esta manera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gamaniel Alberto is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and children in Morropon district, in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura Region on the North Coast of Peru. The people here work at farming, commerce and raising livestock. 

 Gamaniel works decorating social events like birthdays, weddings, promotions, etc constructed from polystyrene. He has been doing this work for 5 years and is well known in his district for his magnificent art of decoration. He is requesting a loan of 800 PEN to buy a variety of colors of fabrics for his decorations and in this way offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of colors of fabric to offer better service.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is thirty-three years old, widowed and has three children, two of whom are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Anabel is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Anabel has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Anabel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. 

In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Moung Russrey district of Battambang province, Mom is 42 years old and a mother of six children. Currently, three of them are under her responsibility, two schoolchildren and one under school-aged child. 

To deal with the financial hardship in her household, Mom grows rice as the primary source of income and she works for others for fee to supplement her income. The business that she has engaged in for 20 years earns her about KHR 30,000 per day. 

The past five loan cycles, which she has completely repaid, have enabled Mom to upgrade her living conditions. Now, she is in her sixth cycle and leader of a group consisting of four borrowers. 

Mom will spend her entire loan portion to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and rice seeds. She strongly hopes that her rice will gain a good and timely crop yield.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and rice seeds.

loans.name: Lorm's Group

texts.en:
Lorm, 47, is a citizen of Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a mother of four children. To support her family’s cost of living, she does rice farming and vegetable farming as the main source of income. She has been with this business for 27 years, and it has returned her 25,000 KHR per day. 

Now, she is the leader of a first microloan group consisting of two and seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Lorm is going to use her entire loan portion to pay for the reaping fee, fertilizer cost and gasoline purchase. 

She hopes to increase her income so she can have more money to buy a car to run a taxi to earn additional income.

loans.use: to pay for the reaping fee, fertilizer cost and gasoline purchase.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
Phan, aged 50 and a widowed mother of five children, is a villager from Banteay Meanchey province. Nowadays, she needs to support only two schoolchildren. Her entire family solely counts on a single source of income, vegetable selling.  

Now, the lack of financial support for her business is the main challenge for her. She is applying for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). For this time, she is the leader of a group consisting of five borrowers. She is seeking 1,200,000 KHR, whereas her joint borrowers are applying for 1,000,000 KHR each. 

As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more vegetables for resale. She highly believes that this loan will enable her to replenish her vegetable selling business in a timely manner with a good income in return.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for resale.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es: Iris tiene 48 años y un hijo de 18 años el cual ha sacado adelante con su trabajo; desde hace 5 años laboraba en oficios varios y por motivo de recorte de personal se quedó sin empleo, en vista de sus obligaciones se motivó y montó un negocio de comidas, su sueño es poder tener un mejor local para brindarle un bienestar a sus clientes y terminar de ofrecerle a su hijo una carrera profesional, con el crédito Iris tiene pensado comprarse un congelador para poder adquirir muchos productos que son perecederos en su negocio y poder así conservarlos y que todo tengan una buena calidad al momento de servirles a sus clientes, también comprar surtido como (carnes, pollos, pescados, verduras, hortalizas, etc), Todo esto le brindará a Iris una estabilidad económica y su vida será más placentera.
texts.en: Irene is 48 years old and has gotten ahead through her work.  She has worked in various fields and lost her job due to personnel cuts, so she started her own food business.  Her dream is to set up a better location to provide better customer service and offer a professional career to her son.  Iris plans to buy a freezer with the money from this loan so she can buy many products and store them so that they can remain quality items when she serves them to her customers.  She will also buy stock (meats, chicken, fish, vegetables, etc.)  All this will provide Iris with financial stability and make her life more pleasant.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es: Hilda es casada y tiene dos hijos, desde hace muchos años su familia tiene el negocio de confecciones y ella emprendió la elaboración y ensamble de los botones, trabaja en la casa de su madre en forma muy rudimentaria, a pesar de que tiene mucha demanda de estos artículos, sueña con terminar de pagar su casa y ayudarle a sus hijos a que obtengan la de ellos,  con éste crédito que Hilda solicita comprará una mesa de trabajo más adecuada para esta labor y también se surtirá en abundancia de insumos requeridos para el ensamble y producción de botonería. Ella busca seguir con este oficio y mejorar sus condiciones de trabajo porque labora muchas horas al día, y su nivel de vida mejorará con el apoyo de su familia.
texts.en: Hilda is married and has two children.  Her family has been making clothing for many years and she started making and assembling buttons.  She works from her mother’s house and even though she has a great demand for her products, she hopes to finish paying off her house and helping her children get theirs.  Hilda will use the money from this loan to buy a better work table so she can improve her income.  She wants to continue this work and improve her conditions because she works many hours during the day.  Her quality of life will improve with support from her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jorge Iván

texts.es: Jorge, soltero y con un hijo, trabajó muchos años en empresas de renombre pero como empleado temporal; desde hace 4 años tomó la decisión de poner su propio negocio y actualmente tiene una chaza en un parqueadero donde vende cigarrillos, dulces, mecato y otros productos. Jorge sueña con tener un negocio muy amplio y con mucho surtido, por ello solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía (mecato, galletería, cigarrillos, chicles) y tener una buena reserva,  esto le brindará una estabilidad económica más estable y que le represente mejorar su calidad de vida y dar como cumplido su anhelo.
texts.en: Jorge is single and has a son.  He worked many hours as an employee for different companies, but only as a temp.  Four years ago he decided to set up his own business and has a stand in a parking lot where he sells cigarettes, candy, pastries, and other products.  Jorge dreams of having a large business and is asking for a loan to buy merchandise (pastries, cookies, cigarettes, gum) so he can have a reserve.  This will provide him with more stable financial stability so he can improve his quality of life and achieve his desire.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Hezekiah

texts.en:
Hezekiah is a 41-year-old, married man. He has eight children. He describes himself as being determined. 

He operates a welding business where he makes metal doors, frames, and other items. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an area with high demand for products and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. 

Hezekiah will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of metal bars and other welding materials. He hopes that, in the future, he will be successful. 

This is Hezekiah's first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy more stocks of metal bars and other welding materials.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena, 53 years old, is married with ten children. She is a very hardworking mother and with the help of her husband, they both manage their farm. They need to work hard for their children, just to sustain the daily needs of the children. 

Lucena is asking for a loan amounting to Php 40,000 to buy sacks of seed and fertilizer for her farm business so as to have additional income. She hopes and dreams that she can save enough money for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of seed and fertilizer for her farm business

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita  is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Julita  is sixty years old and has one child who is in school.

Julita's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending and is committed to regain what she lost. Julita is taking out a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Julita  would like to save enough to build a better house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Kelly Yurley

texts.es: Kelly con 24 años de edad es una joven muy trabajadora que, desde hace varios años aprendió el oficio de manicurista y pedicurista, actualmente tiene un salón y con el apoyo familiar ha salido adelante, pero aún tiene necesidades para que éste funcione como ella anhela, también tiene como sueño lograr comprar su propia casa con el producto de su negocio, Kelly solicita el crédito para comprar un puesto de manicure y pedicure y también comprar insumos para desempeñar dicha labor como son (esmaltes, removedores, toallas, lavapies, etc) y hacerle mejoras al local para brindar un espacio muy acogedor y agradable para toda su fiel clientela, con todo esto ella logrará obtener unos grandes ingresos los cuales le dan una mejor estabilidad económica y su nivel de vida será excelente.
texts.en: Kelly is 24 years old and is a hardworking young woman who spent several years learning to be a manicurist and pedicurist.  She has a salon and has gotten ahead with her family’s help, but she still has some needs.  She also has a dream of buying her own house with the product of this business.  Kelly is asking for this loan to buy a manicure and pedicure station and supplies (nail polish, remover, towels, foot wash, etc.) and make improvements to her area to make it more comfortable and welcoming to her steady customers.  This will all allow her to increase her income that will provide her more financial stability and make her quality of life excellent.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Yeat's Group

texts.en:
Yeat, 43, is a resident of Battambang Province. She is married and has one son who attends school. The family's main source of income comes from raising cows and farming a two-hectare rice paddy. These business activities generate almost 21,000 KHR daily. 

Yeat has successfully repaid three loans from Kiva partner, VisionFund. Now, she is the group leader for a group of four borrowers who are each requesting 1,4000,000 KHR each. Yeat will spend her entire loan amount to purchase fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor costs for her rice paddy. She hopes to earn extra income from her crop. The profit will allow her to continue supporting her family and maintaining her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides and pay for labor costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay a debt and buy merchandise.

loans.name: Luis Hernando

texts.es: Luis, un comerciante de 45 años, casado y con dos hijos, antes de trabajar con la venta de mercancías, Luis tenía una ferretería, la vendió y se dedicó a ser conductor, con el anhelo de mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad de vida para toda la familia, él empezó a viajar a Venezuela  y traer mercancía para la venta, su sueño constante es invertir en mucha mercancía y poder satisfacer la demanda del mercado lo cual es muy extenso.  Con el crédito podrá realizar las compras de surtido (ropa, cremas corporales, perfumería) y brindarle a su familia un mejor bienestar y una muy buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Luis is a 45 year old merchant.  He is married and has two children.  Before selling merchandise, Luis used to have a hardware store that he sold to become a driver.  With a desire to improve his income and quality of life, he started travelling to Venezuela to bring merchandise to sell.  His dream is to buy lots of merchandise and be able to satisfy the market demand that is very extensive.  He will be able to buy items with this loan (clothing, body creams, perfumes) and provide better wellbeing and financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Neat's Group

texts.en: Neat, 37 years old, is a resident of Kampong Cham province.  Neat and her husband are cassava and rice farmers on one hectare area each. She has been involved in this current business for 17 years. This is not the first cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner ). Now, she is the group leader of two. Neat and her group are requesting loan of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR, respectively. Neat will use her entire loan portion to cover the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to increase her income via this business.

loans.use: To cover the plowing fee for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru:
Нуриддин молодой человек в возрасте 24 лет. Он очень добрый и трудолюбивый. Нуриддин проживает в селе, которое находиться не далеко от района. Нуриддин с детства любил природу, чистый воздух и конечно же животных. Нуриддин в детстве помогал родителям в откармливание скота, со временем стал самостоятельно сам их разводить. В этом ему помогло знание и навыки который он освоил от отца. В связи с обстоятельствами Нуриддин не смог получить среднее специальное образование. Но он в будущем хочет дать полное образование детям. В данное время у Нуриддина вырастает сын, у них молодая семья. Жена  Нуриддина работает в поле занимается прополкой земли, кроме этого дополнительно дома обрабатывает молоко, приготавливает кефир, сметану и продает их соседям. Иногда привозит в районный рынок для оптовый продажи.
С наступлением весеннего периода Нуриддин хочет приумножить поголовье крупно рогатого скота, так как  этот период является сезонным для купле продажи скота.  Чтобы купить скот  Нуриддину не хватает денежных средств и он обратился в МДО "Арванд" за финансовой поддержкой и очень надеется что организация Арванд вовремя предоставит кредит и он сможет реализовать свои планы.  
.
texts.en:
Nuriddin is a 24-year-old young man. He is very kind and hardworking. Nuriddin lives in a village located not far from the district. Since childhood, Nuriddin has loved nature, fresh air and, last by not least, animals. When he was a kid, Nuriddin helped his parents fatten up cattle. Eventually, he began to raise them on his own. The knowledge and skills his learned form his father have helped him in this business. As a result of his circumstances, Nuriddin was unable to receive a secondary-specialized education. But he wants to give his children a complete education in the future. Nuriddin is raising a son. He has a young family. Nuriddin's wife works in the fields, weeding the land. In addition to this, she cultures milk at home and prepares kefir and sour cream which she sells to their neighbors. Sometimes, she brings these milk products to the regional market for wholesale distribution.

With the upcoming Spring season, Nuriddin wants to increase his number of cattle, as this is the season for buying and reselling cattle. Nuriddin doe not have enough money to buy cattle and turned to MDO Arvand for financial assistance. He really hopes that the Arvand organization will grant him loan in a timely manner so that he will be able to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Magu Group

texts.en:
Josephine is a mother of one son who is schooling. She is in her mid-thirties and makes her living by running a beauty salon. She has been in this business for seven years now. Josephine's business is open from 9 am to 8 pm per day and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This is Lucy's eighth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which have been paid back successfully, to buy business equipment and supplies: a foot-washing sink, salon mirrors, cosmetics and chairs. She made her business look attractive. Josephine earned extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses. Josephine will use this loan to start selling fabrics in the same shop. She dreams of building a house and improving her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Magu" which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling fabrics in the same shop.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 27 years old and married.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business was wiped out. 

Edelyn is taking out a bridge loan to restart her agricultural business raising pigs. Edelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins.

Edelyn has been raising pigs for years now, and this is her first loan from NWTF.

With your help, Edelynis is committed to rebuilding her business. In the future, she  would like to to have enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Pak

texts.en:
Pak, 43, is married with three children and resides in a rural village located in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. For the last seven years, she has been growing cassava while her husband works as a carpenter. The current business earns her about 45,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Pak is a first-time borrower with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan to buy a machine to help her husband’s business. She hopes this loan will enable her family to earn more income from his business.

loans.use: to buy a machine to help her husband’s carpentry business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is a single mother of four children who all go to school. She also takes care of a younger brother. She has run a restaurant business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more soda, passion fruit for making juice, boxes of mineral water and  bread and cakes. She works six days a week and her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to invest in used clothes and also to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more soda, passion fruit for making juice, boxes of mineral water, bread and cakes.

loans.name: Leat's Group

texts.en:
A mother in her late 40s and a widow, Leat is a villager from Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province. To endure the family’s hardship in her household, she does cassava farming on half hectare of farmland and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. The business that she has been engaged in since she was 20 years has returned her currently up to 26,000 KHR per day. 

Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for the past three cycles, Leat has utilized her past loans wisely to support her business and her household especially in providing decent and sufficient food for her family. The total requested loan amount for her entire group is 8,400,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is Leat's loan portion. Leat is the group leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for farmland leasing fee. She hopes that this rental will enable her to expand her cash-crop farming on a larger scale with good income in return.

loans.use: To pay for farmland leasing fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be experienced and customer-oriented. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is in a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. 

Monicah describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be profitable within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be happy. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standard.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nazir

texts.ru:
Назир жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 39 лет. Он женат и имеет троих детей. Назир живёт вместе со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он старается много работать, чтобы иметь достаточно средств для достойного проживания. С самых юных лет он помогал своему отцу выращивать на поле разную сельхозкультуру, и с тех пор он научился этому делу очень хорошо. Сейчас Назир сам ведёт бизнес - выращивание сельхозкультуры, а также овощей. 

Вот уже около 11 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры, лука, а также винограда. У него есть небольшая площадь земли для этого. Также на этой земле Назир пасёт скот, которых также выращивает для дальнейшей продажи. Во всём ему помогает его семья. Жена и дети помогают ухаживать за скотом, а потом продавать молоко, полученное от этого скота. Ещё Назир подрабатывает мастером по ремонту домов. Сейчас Назир обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку семян и удобрения для дальнейшего посева. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Nazir is a cheerful and hardworking 39-year-old man. He is married and has three children. Nazir lives with his family in a rural village. He strives to work as much as possible so that there are sufficient funds for a good quality of life. From a young age, he helped his father grow various crops in the fields. From then on, he learned how to do this business very well. Now Nazir runs his own business of crop and vegetable farming.

For around 11 years, he has been growing crops, onions and grapes. He has a small plot of land for this. On this plot of land he also grazes cattle, which he raises for future sale. His family helps him with this. His wife and children help him look after the cattle, then they sell the milk which they get from the cows. Nazir also earns extra money as an expert in home repair. Now Nazir is turning to Arvand and wants to receive a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for future sowing. He really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
A very loving father of three children, Joseph has been engaged in a farming business for six years. Joseph is known as very dedicated in his work. Early in the morning, he makes sure that he can check his farm. To have additional income he is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, pesticide and seed for his business. 

In the future, Joseph hopes that he can renovate his house so that he can improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer, pesticide and seed for his business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She is now requesting a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Janet will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Chelou

texts.en:
Chelou is 25 years old and married, with three children, two of whom are in school. Chelou works very hard to provide for them.

Chelou's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Chelou has restarted her life and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Chelou is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and, in the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nem's Group

texts.en:
Aged 38 and a resident of Tbaung Khum district of Kampong Cham province, Nem is blessed with four kids, two of whom are in school. Her entire family solely counts on five hectares of farmland.  This is the fifth loan for Nem and second loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Nem repaid her past loan completely and it has helped her to keep her kids in school. 

For this cycle, Nem is seeking 1,400,000 KHR while her joint borrower is applying for 1,200,000 KHR. Nem is the group leader and she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the reaping fee. She hopes that she can gain a good yield, one better than before, to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for reaping fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sokleap

texts.en:
Sokleap, 32, is married with three children residing in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. To support the family, she has been growing cabbages and mushrooms for 12 years, and to supplement the income, she also works as a garment worker. She can earn about KHR 31,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs. 

Sokleap has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy a decent motorbike for her family to use. She hopes to have a proper motorbike so that she can reduce some expenses on motor-taxis.

loans.use: to buy a decent motorbike for her family to use

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: Martha tiene 49 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora, esto se refleja en las actividades que realiza en la actualidad, además de prestar el servicio de aseo en un edificio en la zona céntrica de la ciudad, tiene una venta de gaseosas, licores, fritos y mecato, actividad que realiza desde su casa y con lo cual apoya al esposo en el sostenimiento de su familia, Sueña con ampliar más el negocio y con el crédito solicitado también comprará mercancía para surtirse. Esto le generará mayores ventas y con sus ingresos mejorar la calidad de vida y el futuro para todos y cada uno de la familia.
texts.en: Martha is 49 years old and has three children.  She is an enterprising and hardworking woman and this is reflected in her activities.  Besides providing custodial services in a building in the city center, she also sells snacks, liquor, Fritos, and pastries from her home, with which she helps her husband support the family.  She dreams of expanding her business and will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise.  This will generate more sales and she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Hilda Liliana

texts.es:
La Atención Integral a la Primera Infancia es la carrera del futuro, sencillamente el futuro del país, del mundo son los niños y el tener la posibilidad y la maravillosa oportunidad de aportar un grano de arena para la formación,  es y será siempre un incentivo, una motivación mas para Hilda Liliana y seguir adelante, estudiar con esmero para ser una profesional exitosa, pero sobre todo una docente integral, que pueda encaminar a los niños hacia un mañana mejor, mostrar que el estudio los hace grandes de espíritu, que es el camino para llegar al alcanzar las metas que se propone y que con dedicación y empeño los sueños si se cumplen. 

En algunas situaciones, el factor económico juega un papel muy importante y aunque no siempre se piense, es un obstáculo en la consecución de algunos fines, por eso es grandioso contar con el apoyo del convenio KIVA y la organización Campo alto como apoyo a los estudiantes que como ella necesitan una ayuda real que les ayude a solucionar aunque sea en parte. 

Gracias infinitas a kiva por ayudar a cumplir sueños y por hacer realidad el deseo de la gente que quiere aportar a la capacidad para hacer de este un mejor país formando a los niños.
texts.en:
Comprehensive Early Childhood Care is the career of the future. Put simply, the children are the future of the country and of the world and having the possibility and the wonderful opportunity of making a contribution to their development is and always will be an incentive and a further motivation for Hilda Liliana to make progress in life. This will make her study conscientiously to be a successful professional, but above all an all-round teacher, who can set children on the path to a better future, show them that education expands their horizons, show them which path to take to reach their proposed goals and show them that with dedication and hard work their goals can be reached.

In certain situations, the finances play an important role and although it isn't always thought to be the case, this can be an obstacle to achieving some goals. For this reason it is magnificent to have the support of the Kiva agreement and the CampoAlto organization who support students like her who really need help, by helping them to find solutions even if these are only partial. Many thanks to Kiva for helping to fulfil people's dreams and for making wishes come true for people who want to contribute to the possibility of making this country better by educating the children.

loans.use: to pay for a term's tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 31 years old, married, and she has one child in school.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Mercy is taking out a housing loan, amounting to PHP 10,000, to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Mercy has been a Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) borrower since 2013.

With your help, Mercy can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en:
Hadjah is married with five children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas.  She works six days out of every week and works at the market. She generates additional income from rental rooms.

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She aspires to go to the villages of Masaka for green bananas and also to see that all her children acquire university educations. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. 

Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for electricity bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: José Raul

texts.es:
José es un joven de 20 años de edad, es muy trabajador. Actualmente vive alquilando una casa donde vive con su compañera de vida y su recién nacido de tan solo 2 meses de edad. 
A José desde pequeño le ha gustado salir a vender frutas en los buses y en el mercado de la ciudad donde él reside, este habito viene de generación en generación, ya que todos sus antepasados se han dedicado al comercio en pequeño y les ha resultado bastante rentable.

Él está solicitando este préstamo, para comprar frutas y también una parte la usará para comprar unas medicinas de su hijo recién nacido, esto le permitirá al joven continuar con su trabajo de vendedor y mantener con buena salud a su hijo recién nacido.
José sueña con tener un puesto en el mercado para tener un mejor orden de las ventas.
texts.en:
José, aged 20, is a very hard-working young man. He currently lives in a rented house with his life partner and their newborn son who is just 2 months old. Since José was young he has enjoyed going out selling fruit on the buses and in the market of the city where he lives. This custom has been passed down from generation to generation, as all his forebears have made a living from small scale trading and it has been fairly profitable for them. 

José is asking for this loan to buy fruit and will also use part of it to buy medicines for his newborn son. This will help him to continue working as a vendor and keep his newborn son in good health.

José's dream is to have a market stall so he can organise his sales better.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell and to buy medicines for his newborn son.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 40 years old and he lives in the village of Khashtarak in the Tavush region.

Arsen is the father of three sons and all of them are still school-aged. Arsen is divorced and the care of his children and their everyday needs are Arsen’s duty. Despite the different construction work that he does around his village, he earns his family's living through farming and agriculture. His father was a very skilled farmer and he was their village shepherd, so when Arsen was a child he dreamed of becoming a good and clever farmer like his father. Now he has a cute farm where he has piglets and chickens. He manages the farming with his sons, who help him and at the same time learn a lot for their own. 

Arsen asks for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams since he wants to buy a pig and fodder for his farm animals. This will mean that he will have a richer farm and he can also sell meat with good profit for his family.

loans.use: to buy a pig and fodder

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 49-year-old gentleman from Usenge. He is married to Rosemary, who is also a business lady in the same town, and they have nine children.

He has operated a retail shop as his business for the last 28 years, earning an average income of 3,000 KES per month. 

He is taking his second loan of 30,000 KES with Vision Fund Kenya to use for buying supplies in bulk (e.g. toothbrushes, sugar, salt, flour, etc.). The profits will be used to repay the loan and do some saving.

His dream is to prosper.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Doreiba Amparo

texts.es: Doreiba tiene 37 años de edad y hace dos años tiene un restaurante ubicado en una zona de talleres del centro de Medellín, de donde provienen sus clientes. El oficio lo aprendió de manera informal y empírica. En el restaurante tiene una empleada y trabajan en el horario de 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, todos los días. Doreiba utilizará el dinero del crédito para la compra de insumos (carnes, granos, pastas) y así poder tener disponibilidad del producto necesario y no perder el cliente. Además sueña con mejorar la apariencia del negocio y poder ubicarlo en un mejor lugar por donde pasen más personas y pueda acreditarlo más, pues el restaurante es el sustento total de su familia y aunque tienen dificultades económicas, han sabido sobrellevarlo con las ventas que hacen.
texts.en:
Doreiba is 37 years old and for the last 2 years has had a restaurant in the workshop district in the centre of Medellín, where her customers come from. She learnt the trade in an informal and empirical way. She employs a woman in the restaurant and they work from 6 in the morning until 5 at night every day.

Doreiba will use the money from the loan to buy supplies (meat, grains, pasta) so she can have the necessary ingredients available and not lose customers. She also hopes to improve the appearance of the business and to be able to move it to a better location where there are more passers-by. 

She wants to build up her reputation more, because the restaurant is the family's only source of income and although they have financial difficulties, they have been able to deal with them from the sales they make.

loans.use: to buy supplies (meat, grains, pasta).

loans.name: Martha Inés

texts.es: Martha es casada y tiene dos hijos, vive en las afueras de la zona metropolitana, tiene un negocio de arepas desde hace doce años y con éste ha subsistido junto con su familia, Sueña con tener un negocio más amplio ya que tiene mucha demanda en la venta de arepas y por ello con el crédito ella cancelará un saldo que tiene pendiente con la Corporación y con lo demás comprará materia prima y elementos de trabajo, además de hacer las reparaciones locativas que tiene pendientes, le gusta lo que hace y con esto mejorará sus ingresos y su bienestar familiar.  También con parte del crédito Martha debe realizar gestiones para poder conseguir la licencia de funcionamiento para su negocio y debe cancelar unos montos de dinero para tal fin, de lo contrario no sería más aprobado su funcionamiento.
texts.en: Martha is married and has two children.  She lives in the outskirts of the metro zone and has had a business for twelve years with which she supports her family.  She dreams of having a larger business because she has great demand and this loan will allow her to pay off another debt with the corporation and also to buy supplies and work items.  She will also make some needed repairs.  Martha will also use another part to acquire her business license which she must pay for.

loans.use: To pay a debt, buy supplies, and pay for a business license.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cows and supplies.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth helps her husband in operating their own farm ,cultivating rice. This is the family's main source of income and how they make a living. She had successfully repaid her previous loans for the farm using her income.

Recently, she took a new loan to buy fertilizer in order to gain more returns during harvest. She works hard to provide a better education for her children soon. She wants to improve the general living conditions of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of seeds to plant

loans.name: Asiris Margarita

texts.es: Asiris tiene 58 años y es madre de 3 hijos, desde hace mucho tiempo trabaja como administradora de canchas de tejo y en este lugar vende bebidas (gaseosas, cervezas, jugos, etc). Con el crédito que solicita ella sueña con ampliar y adecuar mejor su negocio propio para ofrecerle a todos sus clientes  un lugar más agradable y confortable para el esparcimiento, dado que día a día allí se reúnen muchas personas para divertirse, también desea  aumentar las ventas y comprar mesas.  Todo esto representa para Asiris y su familia  mayores ingresos y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Asiris is 58 years old and the mother of three children.  She has been working as a courtyard manager for a long time and she sells beverages there (soft drinks, beer, juices, etc.)  She will use the money from this loan to expand and better stock her business and provide a more comfortable area for her customers, given that many people go there to have fun every day.  She also wants to increase her sales and buy tables.  This will mean better income and more financial stability for Asiris and her family.

loans.use: to buy tables.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is a 51-year-old widowed woman. She has 5 children with ages ranging from 12 to 26 years. She describes herself to be honest and humble.

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy stock of cooking oil and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to expand  within 5 years.

She hopes that, in the future, she will have a good life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock of cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Makhliyo

texts.ru:
Махлиё позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. Сразу после окончания средней школы Махлиё выдали замуж. И так она стала домохозяйкой. Но, даже находясь постоянно  дома,  Махлиё никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым.

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание Махлиё вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Махлиё выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Махлиё получает хороший доход. Муж Махлиё также занимается земледелием и  его работа приносит дополнительный доход в семью. Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Махлиё с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Махлиё заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Makhliyo is a positive and hardworking woman. She is married and has two children. She lives in a small, country village. Makhliyo got married right after she graduated from secondary school. Makhliyo became a homemaker. But even though she is always at home, Makhliyo never just sits idly. She and her husband strive to do all that they can in order to provide their children with all the necessities.

In order to have a constant income to live on, Makhliyo and her husband started their own business. They practice livestock breeding. Makhliyo raises cattle then sells the milk and meat from them. Makhliyo receives a good income from this business. Makhliyo's husband also practices crop farming and his work brings in additional revenue for the family. Their combined income is enough for an average standard of living. At the moment, they do not have enough money to cover all of their current needs. Now Makhliyo and her husband want to buy several cattle to fatten them up. This is why she turned to Arvand to take out a loan to buy cattle. Makhliyo thanks Arvand in advance for their support, as it will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 27 years old and married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elena's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is committed to regaining what she lost. 

Elena is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Elena has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  

In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Rem is 40 years and married with seven dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, earning a living through farming rice. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

Rem has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her to better support her family. 

Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. 

She hopes to make more income from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a fast-food cart and a range of food to get started (bread, cold meats, sauces).

loans.name: María Alejandra

texts.es: María es una joven que ha trabajado en diferentes  almacenes de ropa en la ciudad de Medellín, pero ahora quiere independizarse y va a utilizar el crédito para comprar vitrinas y mercancía (ropa de dama y caballero), para iniciar su negocio, con el fin de generar mayores ingresos y ayudar a su familia. El sueño de María es extender su negocio y montar varios almacenes de ropa en distintos sectores de la ciudad.
texts.en: María is a young woman who has worked in various clothing stores in the city of Medellín, but now she wants to open her own business.  She is going to use this loan to buy display cases and merchandise (ladies’ and men’s clothing) in order to get her business started.  Her goal is to earn a higher income and help her family.  María’s dream is to spread out her business and open various clothing stores in different parts of the city.

loans.use: to buy display cases and merchandise (ladies' and men's clothing)

loans.name: Cinthia Vanessa

texts.es:
Cinthia Vanessa tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedido, los fines de semana lava ropa de sus vecinas y apoya los días de fiestas a los dueños de los juegos recreativos es una joven emprenderá, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de calaminas para el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar seguro donde residir.
texts.en:
Cinthia Vanessa is 26 years old and lives in the district of Morropón, in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. The locals earn a living from agriculture, livestock and commerce.

Cinthia Vanessa makes a living selling clothing to order. At the weekends she washes clothes for her neighbours and on festival days she helps the owners of children's playgrounds. She is an enterprising young woman.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles to buy corrugated iron for the roof of her home so she can have a secure place to live.

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron for the rood of her home.

loans.name: Ysolina

texts.es:
Ysolina tiene 58 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene una bodeguita donde ofrece venta de variedad de productos de primera necesidad azúcar, leche, huevos, cereales, menestras entre otros, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de abarrotes para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ysolina is 58 years old.  She lives together with her husband and children in the Cayaltí district, a community with people who work in agriculture, trade, and cattle.  It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs tot he Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Perú.

She has a little grocery store where she offers the sales of a variety of necessities such as sugar, milk, eggs, cereals, and vegetable soups, among others.  She is asking for a 2,000 nuevos soles loan to buy a greater quantity of groceries to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of groceries to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Tropia Group

texts.en:
Miriam, who was born in the late 1960s, is single and has got four children who are in school. Since 2000, she has had a genge business selling fruits and vegetables. She opens her genge business from 06am to 07pm per working day and is able to make a fair profit. Miriam normally services her business with new products one or two times in a week. 

This will be her third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans, all of which paid back successfully, to restock genge fruits and vegetables. Miriam managed to earn an extra income which she used to cover school fees and household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business. In the coming years, Miriam would like to improve her business and life. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, "TROPIA", which consist of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her 2013, and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Elvira will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough to provide a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Luis Aníbal

texts.es: Luis es un tapicero con mucha experiencia que tiene su negocio en un barrio humilde de la ciudad de Medellín. Tiene una tapicería ya reconocida en el sector, pero sus clientes son de bajos recursos y los trabajos que hace, los tiene que vender muy baratos. Luis piensa invertir el crédito en la compra de materiales (espumas y telas) para un trabajo que tiene que hacer. Su sueño es poder salir adelante con sus hijos y darles estudio para que sean profesionales.
texts.en: Luis is an upholsterer with a lot of experience.  He has a business in a modest neighborhood in the city of Medellín.  He has an upholstering shop that is well-known in the area, but his customers have limited resources and so he has to sell his work for a very low price.  Luis plans to invest this loan in the purchase of materials (foam and fabric) for a job that he has to do.  His dream is to be able to get ahead with his children and give them an education so that they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy materials such as foam and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, oil, meat, chicken and disposable items.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru:
Майсара доброжелательная и жизнерадостная женщина в возрасте 34 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Майсара живёт счастливо, старается делать всё возможное, чтобы её дети ни в чём не нуждались. Сама Майсара работает в местной столовой официанткой. Заработная плата, которую она получает совсем маленькая, и ей приходится ещё подрабатывать на дому в свободное время. Также в семье имеется дополнительный доход от мужа, который работает мастером по ремонту домов.

Чтобы иметь хороший доход на проживание, Майсара работает на дому швеёй. Она научилась этому делу ещё от своей матери. И сейчас она шьёт разные национальные вещи, женские платья. Она имеет уже своих постоянных клиентов, которым очень нравится, как Майсара выполняет свою работу, очень аккуратно и красиво. Но сейчас Майсара хочет купить новую машинку, так как машинка, которую она имеет сейчас уже работает плохо. Поэтому Майсара обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку швейной машинки для реализации своего бизнеса. Она очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Maysara is a considerate and cheerful 34-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Maysara and her family live happily together. She strives to do all that she can so that her children want for nothing. Maysara works in a local dining hall as a waitress. She makes a really small salary, so it is necessary for her to earn extra money at home in her spare time. Her family also has an additional income from her husband, who works as a home repair foreman.

In order to have a good income to cover living expenses, Maysara works at home as a seamstress. She learned this trade from her mother. Now she sews ethnic Tajik items and women's dresses. She already has loyal customers who really like how Maysara does her work - carefully and beautifully. Now Maysara wants to buy a new sewing machine, as the machine she currently has does not work very well. This is why Maysara is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy a new sewing machine to help with her business. She really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto a su nieto. Su actividad laboral es una Pulpería ubicada en un barrio de esa comunidad.
Doña Consuelo le brinda sus servicios a todos sus vecinos y personas de comunidades cercanas a su casa de habitación, por los años que lleva brindando este servicio a sus vecinos y demás personas cuenta con una muy buena clientela porque trata de mantener siempre lo necesario para darles una buena atención a sus clientes además es una persona muy amable.
Doña Consuelo necesita el préstamo para la compra de arroz, manteca, frijoles, aguas, café, azúcar, leche, queso, mantequilla, etc. y así aumentar su inventario de productos y poderle brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 
Doña Consuelo espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que gracias a el contara con los productos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero- 2014
texts.en:
Consuelo is a very hard-working and responsible woman who lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, a community in the north of Honduras, with her grandson. She runs a grocery store which is situated in the local neighbourhood. Consuelo provides a service to all her neighbours and people from communities near her home. Thanks to the number of years she has been providing this service to her neighbours and other people, she has a very good clientele, because she always tries to have everything necessary to give her customers a good service and she is also a very friendly person.

Consuelo needs the loan to buy rice, lard, beans, water, coffee, sugar, milk, cheese, butter etc. so she can increase her stock and provide a better service to her customers. Consuelo hopes the loan will be a great help to her as it will enable her to have the products she needs to satisfy her customers' requirements. At the same time she will make more income which will help to improve her family's quality of life.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – February 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, lard, beans, water, coffee, sugar, milk, cheese, butter etc. for her business.

loans.name: Teang

texts.en:
Teang is a 44-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. She lives in a remote area of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. 

Teang is a farmer and she grows a rice crop to earn a living. Farming is her major source of income. She has been doing this for almost 20 years. Despite her hardships, she aims to educate her children to be professional in the future.

Recently, Teang has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, for the sake of her family members. 

Thanks to the water loan program, with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Teang is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family, and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank, for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Sirojiddin

texts.ru:
Сирочидин добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 27 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Сирочидин живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме в сельском посёлке. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он работает трактористом, а также занимается своим бизнесом.

Сирочидин занимается животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле он занимается выращиванием моркови, картошки и зерновых культур. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Сирочидин хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Сирочидин очень надеется на положительный результат, а также заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Sirojiddin is a kind-hearted and cheerful 27-year-old man. He is married and has two children. Sirojiddin lives with his wife in a small house in a rural village. In order to feed his family, he works as a tractor operator as well as having his own business.

Sirojiddin practices livestock breeding. He has a plot of land. From the total area of land, several portions of the land are left as non-irrigated land. The rest of the plot is made up of irrigated land. On this land he grows carrots, potatoes and grains. His wife helps him look after and raise cattle. As their plot of land is large, they also graze their cattle there. The business of livestock breeding brings in a good income, which is why Sirojiddin decided to expand his business by increasing the size of his herd. He turned to Arvand to request a loan to buy cattle. Sirojiddin really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and doors to repair the walls of his house and install the doors.

loans.name: Hikoyat

texts.ru: Хикоят верная жена и мама. Она воспитала двоих сыновей и пятерых дочерей. Ее сыновья находятся в Российской Федерации на заработках. Хикоят с мужем занимаются земледелием, выращивают на земле сельскохозяйственные культуры. Она решила начать новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Хикоят намерена выращивать скотин, у нее имеется не большой опыт работы в данной сфере и коровник для содержания скотов. Только у нее не хватает средств, чтобы купить телят и начать новый бизнес. Она не унывает и верит, надеется, что ее поддержат для обоснования бизнеса, что станет основной причиной стабилизации финансового положения семьи. Хикоят ждет поддержки.
texts.en: Hikoyat is a loyal wife and mother. She raised two sons and five daughters. Her sons work abroad in the Russian Federation. Hikoyat and her husband practice agriculture, raising crops on their land. She decided to start a new business in the sphere of livestock breeding. Hikoyat is determined to raise cattle. She has some work experience in this field and has a barn for housing the cattle. She just goes not have enough money to buy calves and start her new business. She is not disheartened and believes and hopes that she will be given financial assistance to start up her business, which will become the main way the family stabilizes their financial circumstances. Hikoyat awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Shinuhayr village with her husband, parents-in-law and three school age children (14, 13 and 7 years old).
