Lusine is involved in farming of course with her family members who help her very much. The farm they run includes cows, sheep, oxen and some calves. Lusine also cultivates barley to use as forage for the livestock and to sell.
 
The family sells agricultural products in nearby open markets and gathers income for living.

Now, Lusine is asking for this loan to purchase 22 more sheep and enrich her livestock. The loan will be a big support for this family's farm and they wait for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 22 sheep

loans.name: Sokun

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sokun is 38 years old and married with three children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava while her husband sometimes works for others for a fee. Together, they can earn about KHR 40,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for their future needs.

Sokun has been with VisionFund for four cycles and successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and to use a portion of it to renovate her old house. She hopes to earn more income from her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer and renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: María Elva

texts.es:
María tiene 57 años de edad, está acompañada y vive con su hija que ya es mayor de edad y un nieto que aún no estudia pues está muy pequeño.
María cultiva granos básicos como maíz y frijol, utilizando mano de obra para realizar las respectivas actividades agrícolas, ademas se ocupa de los oficios domésticos.
El préstamo que ella está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para invertir en la pos-cosecha de los granos básicos y así poder guardalo y protegerlo de las plagas.
Doña maría desea seguir produciendo los granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia.
texts.en: Maria is 57 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with her daughter, who is now an adult, and her grandson, who doesn't go to school yet because he is very young. Maria grows staple grains, such as corn and beans. She uses laborers to do the corresponding agricultural work. She also takes care of the domestic work. The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo will be used in the post-harvest of the staple grains, to store it and protect it from pests. Maria wishes to continue growing staple grains to feed her family.

loans.use: to invest in the post-harvest of staple grains.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 55 years old and married. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Eufemia's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is committed to regain what she lost. Eufemia is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to  purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Eufemia has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nor's Group

texts.en:
Nor, 52, lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district. She is a married mother of three children. Her family’s income is from growing cassava. She has been in this business for 20 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 36,000 per day and manages to save about KHR 10,000 per day for her future needs.

Nor has been with VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back her prior loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Nor is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, 37 years old, is from Naivasha and married. They have six children who are between 12 and 4 years old.

Lucy has a tailoring business that she has been running for the past nine years. She has applied for her second loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy clothing materials to use in her tailoring business. Lucy will use the profits made to support her family and improve their living standards.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: To buy clothing material

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 27 years old and has three children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Maribel and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Maribel has been an NWTF borrower since 2012 and plans to recover through her food vending business.

With your help, Maribel can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 54 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Shirly has borrowed and repaid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Shirly aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gretchel

texts.en:
Gretchel is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Gretchel is 36 years old and four of her children are in school.

Gretchel's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her Avon Dealership and is committed to regaining what she lost. Gretchel is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Gretchel has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Gretchel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Dúo Concepcion Group

texts.es: Dúo concepción formado por doña María Luisa de 48 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de tortilla en su local ubicado en su localidad  ella solicita su crédito para la compra de utensilios de cocina (ollas grandes, sartenes, mesa, silla, etc.) ya que actualmente ella logro implementar venta de comida en su local y esto le a generado mayores ingresos a ella porque es la única que vende comida en la localidad su mayor anhelo es lograr poder tener otro local para poder tener mejores ingresos y poder tener un ahorro para su  futuro ya que no cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus hijos y es viuda.
texts.en:
"Dúo Concepción" is partly formed by Doña María Luisa who is 48 years old. She makes her living selling tortillas in her store, located in her neighborhood. 

She is requesting a loan to buy cooking utensils (large pots, frying pans, a table, chairs, etc.) now that she has begun to sell food in her store. This has generated greater earnings for her because she is the only one that sells food in the neighborhood. 

Her greatest desire is to be able to have another store in order to earn a higher income and have savings for her future now that she does not have the economic support of her children and she is a widow.

loans.use: to buy goods for the preparation of refreshments.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Teresita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Teresita has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell.

Teresita is committed to rebuilding, and in the future, would like to have enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, spices, etc

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta de 25 años de edad vive en casa de la abuela junto con ella, desde hace 3 años tiene un negocio de salon de belleza ubicado en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. la clienta solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoos, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
This 25-year-old client lives with her grandmother in her grandmother's house. For three years, she has had a beauty salon business located in her residence. She works from 9:00 am until 7:00 pm and has many clients since she does good work. With the earnings she obtains, she is able to pay her household expenses. 

This client is requesting a loan to be able to buy more products for her beauty salon, like creams, shampoos, hairpins, and scissors among other things she needs. In this way she will be able to make a better profit which will help her have more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoos, hairpins, and scissors among other things

loans.name: Jorie

texts.en:
Jorie is 31 years old, a widow, and lives with her three children. 

She has a retail store selling grocery goods to customers and has three years experience in this business. She is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show her responsibility to her family. She generates additional income that helps her family a lot.

Jorie requested a loan to buy additional goods  to sell. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she will continue assisting her family and children's education.

The story of Jorie and her business is just one of the many examples of loans supported by GDMPC for economic development clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 5000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Mary Jane will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to build a house for your family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en:
Sarun is a 25-year-old married mother of one child. She resides in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. 

She earns a living by weaving mats and has been in this business for seven years. Sarun earns about 50,000 KHR per day to make a living and can save about 30,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sarun has been with VisionFund for just one cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sarun is going to use her portion to buy grocery items to resell in order to earn more income for her family. 

She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for resale

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Anecita will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, she would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 6 years to 14 years. She describes herself to be outgoing. 

Asha operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds to expand her business. 

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy timber and iron sheets to build a business location. 

Asha's business goal is to have a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. 

This is her first loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited.

loans.use: to buy timber and iron sheets to build a business location.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old and has eight children. Four children are in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marilyn has taken a 10,000 PHP housing loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

Marilyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is a 38 year old married woman.  She has 2 children ranging in age from 9 years to 14 years.  She describes herself to be persistent.  She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, maize flour, washing soap and other items.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of adequate stock.  She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, maize flour, washing soap, drinks and other items.  Her business goal is to open another shop within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future, she will be independent.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.  She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, maize flour, washing soap, drinks and other items

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary  is 33 years old, married and lives with her family.  She has a retail store serving many customers; she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate additional income with her husband's support.

Rosemary has seven years experience in this field.  Rosemary works every day in order to provide income for the family.  Rosemary requested this loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.  She is aiming to develop her business to continue assisting her family with the additional income.

In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is fifty four years old and married with seven children, one of whom is in school,  Victoria works very hard to provide for them.

Victoria's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Victoria has restarted building her home and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Victoria is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 47 year old married woman, from the village of Bjinevi, in Chiatura district.  She lives with her husband, 2 sons and a daughter.  Nino and her husband work as shepherds and generate approximately 150 GEL in monthly income.  Nino is also involved in agricultural activity.  She works hard on the family owned agricultural land growing maize and other cereal crops and has seasonal income. 

For further development her agricultural business needs some investments.  With the requested money Nino will start dairy farming.  For the beginning she will purchase a milked cow, produce milk products and sell it locally.  In the future she will expand this mentioned activity and will generate more profit. This will be a huge help for this hard-working woman, as she gets a chance to create financial stability for her family.  Nino and her family rely on the good will of lenders and highly appreciates your help.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: María Pedrina

texts.es:
María de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado, con este estudio, manifiesta se ha podido valer en su vida, con lo poco que aprendió pudo trabajar por varios años como promotora de salud, llevando el sustento a su familia; está casada y su esposo tiene una pequeña tejera donde en la época seca (verano) comercializan teja. De sus 7 hijos, solamente dos viven con ella, los cuales le ayudan en la elaboración de teja.

Ella realiza los quehaceres del hogar, además les ayuda a sus hijos y esposo en la tejera, tiene 20 años de experiencia en esta actividad. Se levantan a las 3 de la madrugada para aprovechar la mañana, hasta las 11:00am; en la tarde (3:00pm) tienen que recoger la teja fabricada en la mañana, posteriormente realizan el “quemado” de la teja.


Ella utilizará el crédito en la compra de leña y zacate para el proceso de quemado de la teja, ya que en este momento tienen mucha teja sin quemar y los clientes le están demandando en este momento el producto terminado. Consiguiendo el dinero, podrá aprovechar la oportunidad de venta que se le presenta.
 

 Sueña con tener el negocio familiar fortalecido y rentable y que sus hijos puedan tener como medio para su sustento, ir diversificando la producción, fabricar también ladrillo, producto con gran demanda en la zona.
texts.en:
María, 63, studied until the 6th grade and her schooling has been worthwhile. What little she learned, she could work for several years as a health promoter, bringing sustenance to her family. She is married and her husband has a small tile business, selling tiles during the dry season (summer). Of their 7 children, only two live with her. They help in making tile. 

She performs household chores, cares for her children, and helps her husband making tile. He has 20 years of experience in this activity. The wake up at 3 in the morning and work until 11 am making tile. In the afternoon, at 3 pm, they have to collect the tile made in the morning and then fire the tile. 

She will use this loan to buy firewood and grass to fire the tile. At this time, they have a lot of unfired tiles and customers are demanding a finished product. With this money, they can take advantage of the sales opportunity that are presented. 

She dreams of having a stronger and profitable family business so that her children may have a means of making their livelihood. She wants to diversify production and manufacture other brick products that have high demand in the area.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and grasses used in the process of firing tiles.

loans.name: Vuth's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, Vuth is 52 years old and married with six children.  For the last several years, she has been weaving mats.  With the current business, she can earn about KHR 40,000 per day and can save about KHR 30,000 each day for future needs.

Vuth just joined with VisionFund for this cycle.  Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan.  Vuth is going to use her portion to buy piglets to raise in order to earn more income.  She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise in order to earn more income

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana tiene 22 años de edad y reside en casa propia junto a su madre y su pequeña hija de dos años de edad. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de ropa de forma ambulante y en su casa. La venta la realiza desde hace 5 años  y gracias a su carisma ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Ana Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio de ropa y para comprar productos de tienda. De esta forma espero mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos y por consecuencia espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Ana is 22 years old and lives in her own home with her mother and 2-year-old daughter. She makes her living by selling clothing as an ambulant vendor and in her home. She has done this work for 5 years and, thanks to her charisma, she has many customer and gains more who prefer her every day. Ana applied for this loan from FUSAI to invest in her business to purchase clothing and products for a store. In this way, she hopes to improve her sales and profits, therefore expecting to improve her living conditions and those of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell including pants, skirts, blouses, beans, sugar, sweets, salt, and more.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina is a Kiva borrower. She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food for sale. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years.

loans.use: buy ingredients for preparing food for sale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 41 years old woman. She lives with her father and two children in the small village of Kharagauli district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a cow and a pig. Nana milks the cow every day and produces dairy products to sell locally. In addition she has a small plot of agricultural land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. She decided to start additional business and requested a loan. The Start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1500 Gel. With the received credit she will start a trade clothes business. This will give her an opportunity to have stable income, which will be used for improving family conditions. Nana awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trade clothes business

loans.name: Anjela

texts.en:
Anjela lives in Khndzoresk village with her husband and daughter. They have been involved in agriculture for 8 years. She is a hairdresser by profession and together with work in the farm also provides hairdressing service for locals in village. 

Anjela is very enthusiastic about having a profitable farm so she works hard to run it in sustainable way. Anjela applied for this loan to purchase three calves and enrich her livestock. The loan will be a great support for this family and they wait for your support.

loans.use: to pay for three calves

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is twenty-nine years old and has two children. Monina is married and has one child who is in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Monina is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012, and plans to recover through her General store income.

With your help, Monina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Tang Or's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Tang Or is 34 years old and married with three children. She earns a living through growing cassava and farming rice, raising pigs and selling grocery items. Having been in this business for 14 years, she is able to earn about KHR100,000 per day and manages to save about KHR50,000 each day for the future needs.

Tang Or is with VisionFund for this cycle and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Tang Or is going to use her portion to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes this loan will enable her to fatten her pigs so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for raising

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 42 years old, married and the mother of six children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them, especially since her business and family home were destroyed by super-typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Lorna has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. To make this possible, she has taken out a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials to rebuild her family home and pay for labor. Lornais is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials and pay for labor

loans.name: Lorena Catalina

texts.es:
Lorena de 40 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, que a diario busca  la forma de como llevar ingresos para su familia,  estudio hasta  4°grado de educación básica; la poca formación educativa no ha significado una barrera para detenerse en la lucha incansable de buscar el sustento de los suyos. Esta acompañada y su pareja de vida le ayuda en sus iniciativas productivas, además, realiza trabajos de albañilería. Juntos han logrado que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.

Lorena vende ropa de casa en casa, en el cantón y fuera mayormente en la zona rural, también compra leche para la elaboración de queso, el cual lo vende a los vecinos, además, tiene crianza de cerdos, alimentándolos con desperdicios de alimentos. Lorena tiene aproximadamente unos 20 años, en los cuales a realizado distintos negocios, que le han permitido a su familia no le falte al menos lo básico.

 Trabaja todos los días, es una rutina, levantarse luego para hacer el desayuno a sus  hijos para que vayan a la escuela y luego prepara lo que ira a vender en el transcurso del día.


Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de mercadería (zapatos y ropa) que le venden a muy cómodo precio, por ello necesita el dinero y así aprovechar esta oportunidad, después revender estos productos y que le pueda quedar un buen margen de ganancia. Por ello a decidido  realizar el crédito, que posteriormente cancelara con lo que genere del negocio.


Sueña con tener una tienda de productos como zapatos, ropa  entre otros artículos que tienen bastante demanda en el mercado y que le gustaría poder tener esa oportunidad de invertir y que con lo que genere el negocio sus hijos puedan completar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Lorena, 40, is an enterprising woman who seeks ways to bring income for her family daily. She has studied until 4th grade of elementary school. Her weak educational background has not been a barrier for her relentless struggle to support herself and her family. She is partnered and her husband helps her in her production initiatives and preforms masonry work. Together, they ensure that their children can continue studying. 

Lorena sells clothes from door-to-door, mostly in the rural areas in the countryside. She also buys milk to make cheese, which she sells to neighbors. She also raises pigs, feeding them food scraps. Lorena has been working in various businesses for 20 years which have allowed her family to not lack their basic needs.

She works everyday, as it is her routine. She gets up to make breakfast for her children to go to school and then prepares what she is going to sell for the day. 

She will use this loan to buy merchandise (shoes and clothing) that she sells at very affordable prices which is why she needs the money to take advantage of this opportunity. She will resell the products at a good profit margin. She decided to take this loan. She has repaid in the past and generated more business.

She dreams of having a store containing products such as shoes and clothes among other items that are in demand in the market. She'd like to take this opportunity to invest and thereby generate income for her children to complete their studies and go to university.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothing to resell.

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Phanna is 53 years old and a widowed mother of only one child living with her in Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She earns a living by farming rice and selling in her community. She has been farming rice for nearly 20 years and earns well for the family. After many years of experience, she has improved her farm successfully.

Recently Phanna has applied for a loan which will be used to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Phanna is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She restarted her business in 2013 and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Melanie will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miraluna is thirty-nine years old and has two children who are in school.

Miraluna's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her rice selling business and is committed to regain what she lost. Miraluna is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Miraluna has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Miraluna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Sreynon's Group

texts.en: Sreymon is a 37-year-old mother of two children who lives in a rural village in the Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Cambodia. To support herself and her family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for 37 years. Together, she and her husband earn about KHR 29,000 per day from their business and save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs. She has taken out and repaid four previous loans from VisionFund which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading a four-person group to ask for a new loan. Sreynon is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees to harvest her cassava. She hopes to do this on time so as to sell her produce for a good price.

loans.use: to hire workers to help harvest cassava

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Ont's Group

texts.en:
Ont, 42, is married, living with her family in a village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children. For the last twenty years, Ont and her husband have been farming rice and cassava as a main source of the family’s income to make a living. Together, they can earn about 50,000KHR per day from the current business. 

Ont’s group consists of three members and they are the fourth cycled client with VisionFund. The past loans which Ont successfully repaid have helped her support her family with sufficient foods. Now requesting a loan with VisionFund, Ont, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jeanalyn

texts.en: Jeanalyn earns a living by selling produce in her village. Her main products are fruits and coconuts, which she sells in a local market where her sales are good. Her three children were not yet in school but she has to earn enough money to meet their needs. She has requested a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy fertilizer and cover the cost of weeding her plot of land. She wants to expand and improve her farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. Her goal is to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for weeding.

loans.name: Salima

texts.en: Salima is widowed. She raises 3 children. Salima always works hard. She cooked and sold bread but 2 years ago she changed her business. Since 2012 year she has sold women’s and children’s clothes. Salima has her own store in a local market. Her daughter helps her to manage the business. Salima little by little developed her business. She is going to buy goods for the new spring season but she does not have money. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy women’s and children’s clothes. From the profit she is going to improve her living condition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women’s and children’s clothes for resale

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a married woman who has three children who range in age from 2 to 9 years old. She describes herself as a business woman and operates a stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for the last seven years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are local residents. She will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients to prepare more food to sell. Her business goal is to expand within the next five years. She hopes that in the future she and her family will have a happy life.

loans.use: to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia De Jesús

texts.es: Aurelia,  es viuda, tiene 51 años, trabaja desde hace muchos años como peluquera en su residencia, y se ha acreditado su labor por el buen servicio que presta a su comunidad en corte, cepillado, planchado y diversidad de tratamientos de belleza, etc. Tiene como sueño ampliar y mejorar las condiciones de su negocio debido a la gran demanda que tiene, a pesar de que en su entorno tiene mucha competencia de la cual ella hace más énfasis en dar un mejor servicio y con mucha calidad, por ello Aurelia anhela comprar con el préstamo mucho surtido e insumos para la peluquería y también elementos de trabajo (secadores, plancha, cepillos, shampoo, tratamientos capilares, tintes, etc) con el fin ofrecer una gama de productos de actualidad en el mercado y de esta forma poder tener  una permanencia en la prestación de este servicio, representando un incremento en ingresos mejorando así su nivel y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Aurelia is a widow, 51 years old, who has worked for many years as a hairdresser in the place where she lives. Her work has been credited for the good service she gives to her community-- haircuts, brushing, straightening, various beauty treatments, etc. 

Her dream is to expand and improve the conditions of her business, due to the large demand she faces. Although she is very competent in her surroundings, she emphasizes better and high-quality service. For this reason, Aurelia is longing to use this loan to buy lots of stock and supplies for the salon, as well as tools (hairdryers, straighteners, brushes, shampoos, hair treatments, dyes, etc) so that she can offer a range of current products for sale. This way she will have permanency in offering this service, representing an increase in income and thus improving her standard of living and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy stock and supplies for her hair salon and also tools of the trade (hairdryers, straighteners, brushes, shampoo, hair treatments, dyes, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair enrichments, jewels and other cosmetics

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is forty-eight years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Norma works very hard to provide for them.

Norma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Norma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Norma has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Norma is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Ram's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Ram is 52 years old and widowed. She has two children to take care of. 

To feed her family, she has worked hard as a rice farmer and she also has grown cassava for several years. The current business earns her about KHR 28,000 per day. 

Ram has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles and she has successfully paid back the past loans. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Ram is going to use her portion to pay for labor fees to harvest rice. She hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees to harvest rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kmanh's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Kmanh is 36-years-old and married with five children. To support her family, she has been farming rice and growing cassava for 16 years and supplements her family’s income by working for others for a fee. From the current business, she can earn about 23,000 KHR per day and can save about 8,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Kmanh has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Kmanh is going to use her portion to pay for rental land fees in order to grow rice and cassava. She hopes to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so she can sell it for a good price to improve her family’s life style and build on her savings to extend her farmland.

loans.use: to pay for rental land fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida was born in the year 1976. She is married and is a careful mother of four children. Five years ago, Hamida began her own business selling women’s clothes because she needed money. Her husband works in a state organization and his salary is not enough to provide four children with good education and other necessary things. 

Hamida began her business five years ago with small working capital. Thanks to her patience and hard work she developed her business. Hamida now is going to increase her working stock but she has not got enough money. She is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to buy women’s clothes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes to increase her working stock.

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is 26-years-old and married with two children. With one child in school, Janes works very hard to provide for them.

Janes' business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Janes has restarted her business  and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Janes has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Janes is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for cooking gas so that she can cook breakfast and get to school

loans.name: Varziyar

texts.en:
Varziyar is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and three children. Her family members have been Internally Displaced Persons from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Füzuli city, for over twenty years. Now they are living in Kurdmahmudlu village of Füzuli region. 

Her elder son was married last year. Her younger son studies at the third course of college, and her daughter, who graduated from school, helps Varziyar with her business. 

Varziyar has cows. She sells their milk and milk products (yogurt, cheese, etc.) at the local bazaar and to neighbours. Now Varziyar wants to buy more cows for increasing her business. Therefore, she needs 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Varziyar is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization for this loan. She wants to build a big stall for her cows in the future.

loans.use: to buy more cows for increasing her milk and milk products business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna owns and operates a retail business in the local community to earn a living. For the seven years she has been running the business, she has sustained it, and has successfully repaid her previous loan used in the business. She always wants to see improvements to her business. 

To earn more return, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family. Emma hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a 43-year-old man. He has four children, with ages ranging from 6 years to 21 years. He describes himself to be honest and humble. 

He operates a food stall where he cooks food for sale. He has been involved in this business for twelve years. His business is located on a roadside, and his primary customers are honest and loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low sales. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a different life. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 40-years-old and has three children.  She is married and has one child who is in school.

Liza and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Liza is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Liza has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.  She plans to recover through selling fish.

With your help, Liza can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
Flor tiene 36 años de edad, está acompañada y no tiene hijos, su pareja está pensionado por haber prestado sus servicios como empleado.
Flor se dedica a la venta de atol chuco, poleadas y palomitas de maíz, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 meses, la necesidad de superación la ha llevado a probar nuevas oportunidades de negocio, fue asi como descubrió un buen mercado para la venta que ella realiza, esto le ha permitido tener mejores ingresos para el hogar.
Con el préstamo que ella está solicitando a CrediCampo, podrá comprar materia prima al por mayor, como harina de maíz, frijoles y otros ingredientes que ella ocupa para sus ventas.
Para un futuro, Flor sueña con tener un negocio muy fuerte y que nunca falte lo necesario para ella y su pareja.
texts.en:
Flor is 36 years old and has no children. Her partner, who was previously employed, is now retired.

She works selling "atol chuco" (a hot cornflour drink), "poleada" (a hot drink made from milk and flour) and popcorn, a business she has been running for three months. The need to better herself has led Flor to try out new business opportunities, which is how she discovered a good market for the sales that she makes, thereby allowing her to increase her household income.

With the loan she is requesting from CrediCampo, she will be able to buy raw materials wholesale, such as cornflour, kidney beans and other ingredients that she uses for selling. As for the future, Flor dreams of owning a very strong business that never fails to meet the needs of both her and her partner.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as cornflour, kidney beans and other ingredients for sale

loans.name: Tara

texts.en:
Tara is a 24-year-old university student in his 9th semester living in Pontianak on the island of Borneo in West Kalimantan Province, Indonesia. He is pursuing a degree in information technology and pays for his studies by selling Nazava water filters. This loan will help Tara to get enough stock to sell water filters to 4 different districts in the state of West Kalimantan. 

This is the second loan provided to Tara. The first loan helped him to build his business and to build partnerships with governmental organizations and businesses. 
Tara will continue to focus on selling water filters in rural areas in West Kalimantan, where people need them most. Many of those places can only be accessed by boats that cross dense rain forests and remote rubber plantations. Such travels are not without danger. 

Tara will be setting up demonstrations on rural markets in multiple villages to raise product awareness and sell the water filters. A loan for Tara truly means a win-win situation for Tara and the communities that buy them: villagers get clean, affordable drinking water and Tara makes enough money to continue his university studies.

loans.use: to increase water filter sales and provide access to safe and affordable drinking water

loans.name: Siran

texts.en:
Siran lives with her husband in the town of Goris. Their children are married and live together with their families separately. Siran and her husband are involved in cattle breeding. They currently keep cows, calves, pig and piglets.  As a result of their tireless and hard work during recent years, Siran and her husband are currently able to earn a stable income to cover their daily costs. 

Siran has applied for this loan to be able to enlarge her livestock by two more cows. This is Siran's second loan. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, she wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, by ensuring that her agribusiness is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Siran has been approved for this loan. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for two cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, beans and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet is 60 years old and a resident of Preah Sdach district, Prey Veng province. She is married and blessed with five children. To provide for her family’s daily needs, she is engaged in farming activities, primarily growing rice on her own farmland. She has been a farmer for almost 40 years and earns a suitable income for her family. Her priority is still her children’s education.

As this is her first loan, Yet aims to invest in the purchase of a solar home system to install on the top roof of her house, which is located in the off-grid area of the province. After this initial investment, Yet will be able to gain access to clean energy, which she uses to support household appliances such as light, TV and radio, so everyone in her family can even work or study at night. She is very thankful and is hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a solar home system to install on the top roof of her house.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is 28 years old, married and has two children. He is a fisherman and his wife is a hog grower. Regie only generates PHP 3,000 each month in fish selling and wants to increase his income. That is why he is asking for PHP 5,000 to buy another fishing net for fishing. He will also buy medicines and feed for hogs. 

In the future, Regie hopes to keep achieving good sales in his business to save funds for his family's future expenses.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net for fishing and medicines and feeds for hogs.

loans.name: Wyndelle

texts.en:
Wyndelle is 36 years old with four children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Wyndelle's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her rice retailing business and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Wyndelle is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Wyndelle has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. 

In the future, Wyndelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives in Verishen village. Her husband provides different cultivation services using his agro-machinery. Their elder son serves in the army and their two children attend village school.

Karine herself is involved in agriculture. She keeps livestock of cows and calves and cultivates some grass as forage for feeding them. Karine's husband sells the gathered milk and meat in nearby markets and earns income for the family.

Realizing the importance of agricultural income for the family, Karine has decided to apply for this loan and purchase two cows and four oxen. The loan will be a huge support for enlarging the farm and will make it better.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and four oxen.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina is a hardworking woman. She is widowed and has an adult son. She came to Tajikistan from Russia many years ago. She lives in Tajikistan and she likes the country very much. Galina began her own business six years ago after the death of her husband. Galina sells fabrics in a local market. She manages her business alone. Her business is the main source of income for her family. Galina works hard from early morning till late evening. She is a very sociable woman. Thanks to her good service and high quality goods, she has regular customers. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy fabrics for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for the new season

loans.name: Jirah

texts.en:
Jirah is 25-years-old and married with one child in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Jirah's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Jirah has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jirah is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Severinus

texts.en:
This loan will help Severinus to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.  Coming from a farming family, Severinus continued the family’s legacy although he dreamed of becoming a successful businessman.  Severinus lives in one of the poorest regions in Indonesia: Nagakeo regency in East Nusa Tenggara. 

Today, he is the closest he has ever been to that dream by joining Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy stock and grow his business.  Severinus is very enthusiastic about the initiative and started spreading the word about cost-savings and health benefits of these products before his first shipment arrived to sell. He is also excited about the benefits of additional income for to his family.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to help Richard purchase $4.00 kits that enable clean births for mothers.

loans.name: Juan Evangelista

texts.es:
Juan, se está preparando para su próxima siembra granos básicos y hortalizas por lo que solicita más capital para comprar semilla, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pagar mozos para recolectar la cosecha.
Para Juan el préstamo anterior le dio efectos positivos la cosecha fue abundante, libre de plagas y eso ha hecho que tanto su situación económica como familiar mejore un poco.
texts.en:
Juan is preparing for the next planting of basic grains and vegetables.  He is, therefore, requesting more capital in order to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, and herbicides.  He will also use the loan to pay for workers to gather the harvest.

The previous loan had a positive effect for Juan.  The harvest was abundant and free of pests.  This has caused his financial situation and his family situation to improve a little.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer, and herbicides, and to pay for workers to gather the harvest.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 43-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself as honest, happy and humble. She operates a green grocery where she sells tomatoes and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. She describes her biggest business challenge as low sales. 

Sofia will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and other items. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, the family will have a better life. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes and other items

loans.name: Yohanes

texts.en:
Yohanes is a tenacious entrepreneur with a strong passion to learn and improve his livelihood.  He currently works as a farmer, and this work is main source of income for his wife and two small children. This loan will help Yohanes to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

To transform the outlook of his family’s future, Yohanes has joined Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network to sell simple life-changing technologies. He will use the loan to buy stock and grow his business.  He and his wife will go to community meetings to educate people about the cost-savings and health benefits of these products. One of his dreams is to provide better education for his children. The income from selling technologies will help him towards exactly that.

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, es parte de una familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, ellos dependen completamente de él, no posee ayuda del extranjero, por iniciativa propia instalo un atienda en su residencia la cual atiende de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., como forma de sustento para salir adelante con su familia.
Necesita un crédito con el cual mejorar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, comprara, dulces, pan, boquitas, bebidas, pastas, aceite, detergente, etc., así podrá adquirirlos por mayor, para ofrecer precios más accesibles y así mantener la afluencia de sus clientes.
Su sueño es mejorar la vivienda, dar a su familia mejora alimentación, vestuario, salud y educación.
texts.en:
Jorge is part of a family that is comprised of his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 14.  They are completely dependent upon him.  He does not have help from abroad.

On his own initiative, he set up at store at his house.  He tends the store from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m.  He does this as a means of support in order to get his family ahead.

He needs a loan to improve the variety of products that he offers his customers.  He will buy candy, bread, snacks, drinks, pastas, cooking oil, and detergent, etc.  This way he will be able to get them wholesale in order to offer more affordable prices.  This way he will maintain the influx of his customers.

His dream is to improve the house and to give his family better food, clothing, health, and education.

loans.use: to buy candy, bread, snacks, drinks, pastas, cooking oil, and detergent, etc.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.en:
Nilufar was born in 1991. She is single and lives with her parents. Nilufar is a hardworking young woman. She is a seamstress. Nilufar has been busy with this business more than eight years. She serves her clients in her workshop which is located in the center of her region. Nilufar has regular customers. She has two sewing machines. 

Nilufar is ill now. She must to treat her illness, but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS) to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her treatment

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina lives in Hartashen Village with her family. Her elder son is married with two little kids and lives with his parents. Valentina and her family have been involved in agriculture for 17 years. The livestock that they keep currently includes cows, calves and some piglets. The family also owns a plot of land where they cultivate wheat and some grass.

By asking for this loan, Valentina wants to solve the most urgent need among numerous maintenance issues on her farm: to buy three cows and forage for them to eat. This will be a big support for her farm, and Valentina's whole family will be very thankful to lenders.

loans.use: to pay for three cows and forage for feeding them

loans.name: Agustinus Kutu

texts.en:
Agustinus is an ambitious man who is using the advantage of his single status to make as much of himself as he can.  Before joining Kopernik’s Tech Kiosk network, he earned a living from his employment as a farmer and a village official. 

This loan will help Agustinus to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community in the Nagakeo regency of East Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia. Agustinus intends to use the money that he will earn from selling Kopernik technologies to acquire more equipment for his farming business. He will also save money towards purchasing a house and educating his future children.  What a forward thinker!

loans.use: to introduce simple, life-saving technologies such as solar lamps, water filters and clean cookstoves to his community.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es: Anabel de 48 años de edad vive con su compañero de vida y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatos, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, posee mucha clientela por la calidad de sus productos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos del hogar, Anabel esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder seguir con su trabajo y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Anabel, age 48, lives with her life partner and their children.  She sells shoes.  Her business is at the place where she lives.  She has a lot of clientele because of the quality of her products and the good prices.

With what she gets from her sales she manages to pay for some of the household expenses.

Anabel is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale.  She will do this in order to be able to continue with her work and to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Enrique Uriel

texts.es: Enrique, es un hombre muy trabajador de 39 años de edad, casado, vive en Tulcán, tiene 3 hijos, 2 niños de 7 y 9 años de edad y una niña de 12 años que asisten a la escuela. Él desde que era joven se dedica al cultivo de papa. Vive con su esposa y con sus hijos. El necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fungicidas para seguir cultivando papas. Su meta es que su familia tenga estabilidad económica y que no les falte nada para vivir bien.
texts.en:
Enrique is a very hard-working man of 39, who is married and lives in Tulcán. He has three children: two boys 7 and 9  years old, and a 12-year-old girl, and they go to school. He has grown potatoes since he was young. He lives with his wife and children. 

He needs a loan to buy fertilizer and fungicides so that we can continue growing potatoes. His goal is for his family to have financial stability and not lack anything for living well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and fungicides to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Edelita

texts.en:
Edelita is 52 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Edelita works very hard to provide for them.

Edelita's business and family home was destroyed by the Super Typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Edelita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Edelita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Edelita is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Geraline

texts.en:
Geraline is fifty two years old.  Geraline is married and has two children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Geraline is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Geraline can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Rong's Group

texts.en:
Rong, 28, is a citizen from the district of Tbaung Khmum in the Kampong Cham province. She is 28 years old. To earn a living, she plants cassava on one hectare of farmland and has a rice paddy on another half hectare. This serves as her main source of income. Having engaged in her current business for eight years, she is able to generate up to 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is not the first loan for Rong with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is the leader of a group consisting of three borrowers. She and one of the joint borrowers are seeking for 1,400,000 KHR each while a remaining borrower is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion on fertilizer and pesticide for her cassava crop. She hopes her family’s income will increase.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Da's Group

texts.en: Da is a borrower from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 32 years old, a mother blessed with one daughter who is in school. To feed her entire family she does rice farming as the main source of income and chicken trading business to supplement her income. She has been with this business for 11 years. Da is not the first-cycled borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan which was repaid completely has enabled her to improve her living conditions gradually. Now she leads a group of four to get a new loan. She and one of her joint borrowers are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each, whereas the remaining borrowers are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader she will spend her entire loan to buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and some portion of the loan to buy chickens for resale. She hopes that her family’s business will gain good profit for her to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, rice seed, pesticide and some  portion to buy chickens for resale

loans.name: Polivio Fabian

texts.es: Polivio, es un hombre de 63 años de edad, divorciado, vive en Tulcán, tiene 3 hijos los cuales ya tienen su propio hogar. Él vive con su madre que es discapacitada. Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura pero últimamente no le ha estado yendo muy bien, por lo que ha decidido empezar con el negocio de venta de leche, para iniciar con esta actividad, él necesita comprar una vaca lechera y para hacerlo solicita el préstamo. Polivio quiere que  a su madre no le falte nada mientras él tenga salud y pueda trabajar para cuidar de ella. Su sueño en algunos años más, es tener más vacas para aumentar su producción.
texts.en: Polivio is 63 years old. He is divorced and he lives in Tulcán. He has 3 children, all of whom have their own homes. He lives with his mother, who is handicapped. From the time he was very young, he has worked in agriculture, but lately it hasn’t been going well for him. So he has decided to start a business that sells milk. To start this business, he needs to buy a milk cow. To do this, he is requesting the loan. Polivio doesn’t want his mother to lack for anything so long as he has his health and can work to care for her. His dream, in a few more years, is to have more cows so he can increase his production.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and to start his milk selling business.

loans.name: Henry Rodolfo

texts.es: Henry tiene 21 años de edad, es un joven soltero que vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, su mamá se dedica a criar animales y su papá se dedica la agricultura. Él está asistiendo a la universidad siguiendo la carrera de desarrollo integral agropecuaria y para poner en práctica sus conocimientos se dedica a criar chanchos. El crédito lo invertirá comprando chancos que les tiene en la propiedad de sus padres. Henri es un joven muy responsable que aspira mejorar sus ingresos para terminar su carrera universitaria y luego ponerse un negocio de alimentos para animales.
texts.en: Henry is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings. His mother raises animals and his father works in agriculture. He is attending the university, studying Integrated Agricultural Development, and so he can put his knowledge to work, he raises pigs. He will invest the loan by buying pigs that he keeps on his parents’ land. Henry is a responsible young man who aspires to improve his income so he can finish his university studies and later start an animal feed business.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sofya

texts.en:
Sofya lives in Qarahunj village of the Syuniq region. Because of the severe climate in her region, people here are mainly involved in cattle breeding. Sofya and her family have been running their business for 17 years. The gathered milk and meat Sofya's husband sells in local open markets and in this way the family gathers income for living. 
Sofya and her husband feel very responsible to run their farm in a sustainable way, ensuring stable income over each month for the family. 
Sofya has now applied for this loan of USD 3000 in order to purchase 5 calves. This loan is important for their farm and Sofya hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to purchase 5 calves for her farm.

loans.name: Rosa Dina

texts.es: Rosa tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 15 años y 4 años y su hijo de 10 años de edad. Rosa se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir tanto para hombre como para mujer. Tiene aproximadamente 16 años de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Rosa desea construir un baño sanitario con ducha para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y de más materiales necesarios para la construcción del baño con ducha.
texts.en: Rosa, 38, lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters of ages 15 and 4 and their son who is 10 years old. Rosa makes clothing apparel for both men and women. From working almost 16 years in this business she has gained much experience and many customers who every day prefer her more. Rosa asks for this credit from FUSAI so that she can build a bathroom with a shower with the purchase of cement, sand, brick, iron and all the other materials necessary for the construction of a bathroom with a shower.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, iron and other materials needed to construct a bathroom with a shower.

loans.name: Veronica Elizabeth

texts.es: Verónica tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 9 años de edad. Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica al comercio de variedad de productos como: pescado, carnes, crema, chorizo y verduras. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Su deseo es dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar lo antes posible el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Verónica is 27 years old and lives in her own house along with her 9 year old son. For more than 5 years she has sold a variety of products, such as: fish, meat, lotions, sausages, and vegetables. This is how she earns her living and provides for her household. Her wish is give the best living conditions to her family. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of galvanized metal roofing sheets and wood to repair the roof of her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets and wood to repair the roof on her house.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is 36 years old. She is an industrious woman. She is married and has 4 children. Her children Mahina, Avazbek, Muhlisa and Ruslan are non-adults. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Nasiba now needs to money for living. She is going to organize her own business of selling home products. She will sell her goods in a local market. Her children will help her with managing the business. She took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy goods such as buckets, kettles, etc. for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy goods as bucket, kettle and etc. for organizing new business

loans.name: Çiğdem

texts.en:
Cigdem is single and has worked in insurance at different companies for 17 years. She now owns and manages a cafe. She was sitting in the cafe with friends when her friend said she wanted to sell the cafe. She wanted to follow her dreams of running her own business and being her own boss. She told her family and with their support she bought the cafe three years ago. She's had good profits for three years. She comes in contact with people from all walks of life and is very pleased with her business. The cafe is always full because it is on the shore. It gets busier in the summer months and stays open until 3 AM. This job puts her in charge. It has taught her the value of money and that money isn't easy to earn. She will buy goods for the cafe with this loan. She thinks that the cafe will have more business and wants to make innovations and changes. She wants to use the money she makes to buy her family a bigger house. 
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Üyemiz on yedi yıl değişik şirketlerde sigortacılık yapıyor.  Şu an sahip olduğu cafeyi arkadaşı işletiyor muş,arkadaşlarla cafe de otururken arkadaşı cafeyi satmak istediğini söylüyor.Kendi hayalinde hep kendi işini yapmak ve patron olmak olduğundan cafeyi almak istiyor.  Ailesi ile paylaşıyor.  Ailesinin de desteği ile üç yıl önce cafeyi satın alıyor.  Üç yıldır çok güzel kazançlar elde ediyor.  Her kesimden çevresi oluyor .  İşinden çok memnun.  Sahilde olması her zaman dolu olmasını sağlıyor.  Yaz aylarında daha da hareketleniyor ve gece saat üçlere kadar açık oluyorlar.  Bu işin kendisini sorumluluk sahibi yaptığını,paranın kıymetini öğrettiğini,paranın kolay kazanılmadığını öğrettiğini söylüyor. Bu kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Cafenin daha çok işi olduğunu,bir çok yenilik ve tadilat yapmayı düşünüyor.  Kazandığı para ile ailesine daha büyük bir ev almak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy goods for her cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lisbeth Stefania

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito 5 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Lisbeth, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 4  años el cual está en jardín de infantes. El marido trabaja con aluminio y vidrio.
Doña Lisbeth es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Belcorp (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo en las noches ya que a esa hora su esposo se hace cargo su pequeño hijo y ella puede ir a hacer sus recorridos con más comodidad, ella para tener mayores ventas deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Tiene 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se ayuda para salir adelante en el hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Lleva 4 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en:
In the neighborhood of La Paz in the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the communal loan group “5 de septiembre” meet every fifteen days. This is where Lisbeth lives. She is 23 years old and lives in a common-law marriage, from which she has one 4 year-old son. He is in kindergarten. Her husband works with aluminum and glass.

Lisbeth is a homemaker who, in order to make her own money, sells clothing, shoes, and Belcorp products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). She works three days per week, usually in the evenings since this is when her husband takes care of their young son and she can make her rounds more easily. In order to have more sales, she sells her products on credit and collects every fifteen days. She has been working in this business for 4 years and this is how she helps provide for her household.

The loan is to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing for women, men, and children. She has been in the communal loan group for 4 years and she likes it because she started her business with the loans. Her dream is to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, cosmetics, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Lefia Atenaida

texts.es:
En la ciudadela La Paz en la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida desde tiempos coloniales como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito 5 De Septiembre.
En este lugar vive la señora Atenaida, tiene 47 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa aunque ya están comprometidos. El marido es comerciante
Doña Atenaida es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de Oriflame (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja tres días a la semana más que todo por las mañanas, ya que a esa hora se le hace más fácil realizar sus recorridos, ella  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana. Lleva  más de 10  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual ayuda a su marido a sacar adelante su hogar.
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa de temporada. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho en su negocio. Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y vida personal.
texts.en:
In the citadel of La Paz in the city of Portoviejo, known since the colonial times as the Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos, every 15 days the members of the Grupo De Credito 5 De Septiembre meet.

In this place lives Mrs. Atenaida, 47, who is married with four elder children. Two of the children still live with them in their house even though they are engaged. Her husband is a merchant.

Mrs. Atenaida takes care of the home and to gain her own income she also sells clothes and Oriflame products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories). She works three days a week mainly in the morning as working at this hour makes it easier to run her errands later, as she sells her products on credit and collects every week. She has worked this business for over 10 years, which has helped her husband as he works to raise the living standards of their household.

This loan is to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and seasonal clothing. She has been a part of the Groupo De Credito for 5 years and she likes them because their loans help her business a lot. Her dreams are to continue making progress with her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, cosmetics and clothing.
